 Please note that this role will have its base in our Stockholm office and is primarily an onsite role, with the opportunity to work from home twice per week.
   

  

 Learn more about Our Ways of Working - Guiding Principles by clicking here.
   

  

 Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications? Apply anyway and let us know why you would thrive working in this role at Mentimeter!
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Uppsökande säljare inom IT-hårdvara med fokus på nya kunder
description:
Nu söker vi en driven nykundsäljare med erfarenhet inom IT-hårdvara som vill bli en del av Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Vi söker dig som har en förmåga att göra komplex IT enkel och som gillar att upprätthålla värdefulla kundrelationer. På Iver är lagandan stark och nu har du chansen att bli en del av vårt framgångsrika säljteam inom Iver. Är du vår nya kollega?
   

  

**Om Rollen**
 Ivers erbjuder bland annat en komplett livscykelhantering för datorer och mobila enheter – från logistik och asset management till återbruk och hållbar återvinning. Tjänsten erbjuder en komplett arbetsplats med konfigurerade och färdiginstallerade datorer och/eller mobila enheter med möjlighet att skräddarsy support, administration av applikationer, uppdateringar och policys. Det är en flexibel och skalbar lösning för våra kunder, som är enkel att skala upp och ner.
   

  

 Affären växer och vi satsar på att utveckla området inom Iver. Vi söker en engagerad och målinriktad säljare som brinner för att hitta nya affärsmöjligheter och skapa långsiktiga kundrelationer inom IT-hårdvara. Du kommer att ha en nyckelroll i att leda hela säljcykeln med allt från att identifiera affärsmöjligheter, kvalificering, utveckla lösningen, skriva offerter, prissättning, skapa presentationer för ledande befattningar, förhandla och stänga affärer.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Aktivt och uppsökande bearbeta nya kunder inom olika branscher och segment.
* Bygga och utveckla kundrelationer från första kontakt till långsiktiga samarbeten.
* Identifiera kunders behov av IT-hårdvara och presentera skräddarsydda lösningar som skapar värde och effektivitet.
* Leda presentationsmöten, demonstrationer och förhandlingar med potentiella kunder.
* Arbeta självständigt för att nå och överträffa individuella försäljningsmål.
* Samarbeta med vårt tekniska team för att säkerställa att våra lösningar möter kundernas krav och behov.
* Regelbundet rapportera och följa upp försäljningsaktivitet och resultat.


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Iver - We empower our Nordic society. Hos Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. På Iver är vi inkluderande och strävar efter genuint samarbete där vi arbetar mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas.
   

  

**Din profil & Bakgrund?**
 För att lyckas i rollen hos oss tror vi att du har dokumenterad framgångsrik erfarenhet av uppsökande försäljning inom IT-branschen, gärna inom IT-hårdvara. Du brinner för att göra affärer genom personligt engagemang, innovativa lösningar och kompetens i framkant, med målet att vara en långsiktig och hållbar partner. I rollen kommer du att möta kunder och nyckelpersoner i ledande befattningar och behöver ha förmågan att snabbt bygga förtroende. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet och vill att du utvecklas tillsammans med oss, både som säljare och medarbetare för att bidra till arbetsglädje, vår tillväxt och ett bra kundbemötande.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Är van att skapa nya affärsmöjligheter genom proaktivt prospektering och kallringning.
* Har en god teknisk förståelse för IT-hårdvara och kan snabbt sätta dig in i kunders behov av produkter och relaterade lösningar.
* Är en självständig, målmedveten och resultatinriktad person som trivs med att jobba i en snabb och föränderlig miljö.
* Är van att arbeta med CRM-system och följa upp aktiviteter och resultat på ett strukturerat sätt.
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska.
* B-körkort.


**Placeringsort**
 Iver finns på 25 platser i Sverige och Norge. Denna tjänst utgår från vårt kontor i Solna men du kommer att bearbeta affären inom hela vår marknad.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-03-16. Du är välkommen att kontakta Henrik Olsson (henrik.olsson@iver.se) vid eventuella frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: Tester
Data Modeler & Data Analyst Consultant
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**About Us:**




**LTIMindtree** 
 is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 700+ clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world. Powered by nearly 90,000 talented and entrepreneurial professionals across more than 30 countries, LTIMindtree — a Larsen & Toubro Group company — combines the industry-acclaimed strengths of erstwhile Larsen and Toubro Infotech and Mindtree in solving the most complex business challenges and delivering transformation at scale. For more information, please visit www.ltimindtree.com.
 



  





 We are looking for Data Modeler cum Data Analyst in Stockholm, Sweden with below expertise:
 



  





**Job Description**



* Analyst for Recovery Data monitoring reports in Information capability ART
* Able to work independently with defined problems on an average

 ANSI-SQL

title: Backend Engineer
description:
**About Sana**
 We're on a mission to revolutionize how humans access knowledge through artificial intelligence. Throughout history, breakthroughs in knowledge sharing—from the Library of Alexandria to the printing press to Google—have been pivotal drivers of human progress. Today, as the volume of human knowledge grows exponentially, making it accessible and actionable remains one of humanity's most critical challenges. We're building a future where knowledge isn't just more accessible—it's a catalyst for achieving the previously impossible. If all of this sounds exciting, you’re in the right place.
   

  

**About The Role**
 This role will help build the core systems that power both our Learning and AI platforms. We're looking for engineers who can work with either Node.js (TypeScript) or Kotlin backends to create scalable, resilient systems. You'll focus on data flows, cloud deployments, and the orchestration that enables our products to deliver value to users.
   

  

 In this role, you will
   

  

* Architect the systems that power Sana’s products. Your mission is to build and maintain scalable, resilient, and extensible systems that enable us to deliver features that transform knowledge sharing.
* Develop and maintain features and systems that drive our products.
* Be responsible for scalable and stable deployments.


 Your background looks something like
   

  

* Experience building backend systems, modeling data, scaling, and tuning performance.
* Proficiency in Node.js (TypeScript) and/or JVM (Kotlin)—our two products have different backends.
* Proficiency with PostgreSQL and GCP.


**What We Offer**
* Help shape AI's future alongside brilliant minds from Google AI, Spotify, McKinsey, BCG, and Slack.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Swift professional growth in an evolving environment, supported by a culture of continuous feedback and mentorship from senior leaders.
* Work with talented teammates across 5+ countries, collaborate with customers globally and work in our offices in New York, London and Stockholm.
* Regular team gatherings and events (recently in Italy and South Africa)

title: Informations- och Verksamhetsarkitekt
job_function: Strategy/Planning, Project Management, and Business Development
company_industry: Financial Services, Banking, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
***Vill du vara den som hjälper oss att vidareutveckla och ta ansvar för Bankomats informations- och verksamhetsarkitektur, en nyckelposition som syftar till att bidra till att vi uppnår övergripande affärsmål och strategier.***




  





 Vi söker dig som har ett stort intresse för informationshantering och informationsstrukturer. Du kanske arbetar som informations- eller verksamhetsarkitekt idag, eller har kommit i kontakt med området, men nu känner en nyfikenhet kring att jobba mer aktivt med dessa frågor.
 



  





 Vi är i startgroparna med att bygga både strukturer och verksamhetskunskap kring vår informationsresurs. Hos oss kommer du att ansvara för att vidareutveckla och förvalta Bankomats informationsarkitektur. Du blir en viktig medarbetare, för att stötta verksamhetens behov av informationsstruktur, genom olika pågående projekt och initiativ. Du blir en naturlig länk mellan verksamhet och IT.
 



  





 Dessutom kommer du att arbeta för att sprida kunskap och förståelse för hur informations- och verksamhetsarkitekturens olika modeller och verktyg kan stötta hela Bankomats verksamhet.
 



 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm, ett centralt beläget kontor. Du hör till teamet Verksamhetsutvecklingsstöd, 5 medarbetare, som ingår i avdelningen Marknad- och Tjänsteutveckling.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder:** 




 Vi erbjuder en arbetsmiljö där dina idéer blir verklighet och där du har en unik möjlighet att forma både din roll och vår arkitektur. Hos oss arbetar du nära beslutsfattare och verksamheten, vilket ger dig möjlighet att omsätta dina insikter i direkt förändring. Vi har inga onödiga hierarkier, dina idéer kommer snabbt att göra skillnad. Det du bygger idag kommer att forma vårt arbete för många år framöver.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 



* Strategisk utformning av strukturer för vår informations- och verksamhetsarkitektur.
* Ledning och styrning av arbetet med informationsarkitektur.
* Delta i pågående projekt, workshops, informations- och utbildningsinsatserför att fånga in behov av informationshantering.
* Utveckling och förvaltning av informations- och verksamhetsmodeller genom att analysera, beskriva, och visualisera lösningar, strukturer, skeenden, och samband.
* Förankra olika initiativ som syftar till att stötta verksamheten med hjälp av informations- och verksamhetsarkitektur.
* Omsätta verksamhetens krav till tydliga och effektiva informations- och verksamhetsmodeller i nära samverkan med, och stor förståelse för, verksamhetens behov.
* Samarbeta med ledningen och andra nyckelfunktioner för att stötta och påverka beslutsprocesserna kopplat till informationsarkitektur.
* Delta aktivt som medlem i funktionen Verksamhetsutvecklingsstöd som också inrymmer projektledning och processledning.



  





**Varför du kommer att trivas här:** 




 Vi är en organisation som värdesätter initiativkraft, hos oss kan du verkligen ta ägarskap över både strategi och utförande. Här får du även chansen att vara den som sätter ramarna, som inte bara arbetar med arkitektur utan också bygger och vidareutvecklar den. Du kommer att vara en del av ett engagerat team som värdesätter innovation och handlingskraft.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




***Krav:***



* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller liknande, alternativt arbetslivserfarenhet som vi bedömer likvärdig.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med informationsarkitektur eller verksamhetsarkitektur med fokus på information.
* Erfarenhet av modellering av information och processer.
* God förståelse av olika metoder för informationshantering.
* God svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.



  





***Meriterande:***




* Certifierad informations-, eller verksamhetsarkitekt.
* Erfarenhet av att hålla utbildningar.
* Erfarenhet av att kartlägga verksamhetsförmågor och informationsflöden.
* Erfarenhet av Visio.
* Erfarenhet av data governance.



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Du ser värdet i att arbeta både strategiskt och praktiskt, och du trivs i en dynamisk miljö där du får ta stort ansvar och där beslut kan tas snabbt. Du motiveras av att få bidra till utvecklingen och förbättringen av vår informations- och verksamhetsarkitektur.
 



  





 Med din erfarenhet av att skapa strukturer har du både förmågan att se helheten och att dyka ner på detaljnivå när det behövs för att säkerställa att allt fungerar i praktiken. Du har också en god problemlösningsförmåga och kommunikativa egenskaper för att kunna samarbeta med andra funktioner inom organisationen. Med en positiv och entusiastisk inställning, ett nyfiket och pragmatiskt förhållningssätt, samt en naturlig pedagogisk förmåga, är du också engagerad i att lära ut och dela med dig av din kunskap.
 



  





**Ansökan och mer information** 




 Välkommen att söka!
 



  





 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Bankomat AB med Compass. Du söker tjänsten via länken nedan och vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande, så ansök gärna så snart som möjligt. För mer information om bolaget och tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Compass ansvariga konsult Susanne Bryhn 070-531 34 25.
 



  





 Tjänsten kommer att placeras i säkerhetsklass. Det innebär att i denna roll behöver du vara svensk medborgare för att vara aktuell.
 



  





 För slutkandidaten kommer det att genomföras en grundlig bakgrundskontroll och eventuellt även en säkerhetsprövning.
 



  





*Bankomat är Sveriges ledande aktör inom kontanthantering. Vi erbjuder människor möjlighet att ta ut och sätta in kontanter via våra välkända blå automater, som finns på nästan 600 orter i Sverige. För oss är det viktigt att de som vill använda kontanter* 
*har den möjligheten. Vi har en heltäckande infrastruktur av uttags- och insättningsautomater över hela landet. I 250 av våra automater erbjuder vi även de vanligaste valutorna euro, brittiska pund och amerikanska dollar.* 




  





*Bankomat har påbörjat ett arbete för att kunna starta egen värdehantering. Syftet är att själva kunna transportera kontanter mellan företagets depåer och automater.* 




  





*Kännetecknande för vår organisation är att vi arbetar med komplexa tjänsteleveranser och arbetar kontinuerligt med förändringsarbete och innovation. I dagsläget är vi ca 60 medarbetare som arbetar tillsammans i en platt organisation.*

title: Junior systemtekniker Microsoft 365
description:
**Junior systemtekniker Microsoft 365** 




 Riksdagsförvaltningen är en myndighet som har till uppgift att underlätta riksdagens arbete. Cirka 750 partipolitiskt neutrala medarbetare arbetar vid Riksdagsförvaltningen med många olika typer av arbetsuppgifter. Sektionen applikationsdrift och kammarstöd fortsätter att växa och nu söker vi fler juniora systemtekniker.
 



  





 Vår sektion ansvarar för drift, underhåll och förvaltning av applikationer i riksdagens it-miljöer. Vi är också en viktig del av Riksdagsförvaltningens kammarstöd och arbetar med de it-system som används i riksdagens kammare. Hos oss finns mycket senior kunskap att ta del av liksom utrymme för att bidra med nya idéer. Din utveckling och trivsel är av största vikt för oss och du får en god introduktion och mentorer så att du får stöd i att utvecklas på bästa sätt.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som junior systemtekniker arbetar du i ett engagerat team som bland annat ansvarar för delar av Microsoft 365.
 



  





 Vi arbetar proaktivt, men om en incident ändå inträffar genomför du och ditt team felsökning, felavhjälpning och analys av eventuella felkällor i en komplex och verksamhetskritisk it-miljö. Säkerhetstänket är väl utvecklat och en naturlig del i arbetet.
 



  





 I arbetet har du löpande kontakt och nära samarbete med kollegor både inom och utanför den egna verksamheten.
 



  





 Tjänsten innefattar visst kvällsarbete och eventuellt beredskapstjänstgöring.
 



  





**Dina kvalifikationer** 




 Vi söker dig som har relevant eftergymnasial utbildning inom it eller på annat sätt förvärvat motsvarande goda kunskaper. Utöver det ser vi att du har erfarenhet av drift i form av överrakning, driftsättningar och underhåll av Microsoft 365 i form av till exempel Defender, SharePoint, Teams och Entra ID.
 



  





 Det är meriterande med
 


* erfarenhet av drift on-premises i form av övervakning, driftssättningar och underhåll av Microsoftmiljöer
* erfarenhet från ett eller flera av följande områden: PowerShell, IIS, Exchange, SharePoint, MS-SQL
* god förståelse för nätverk.



  





 Du har lätt för att kommunicera i tal och skrift, både på svenska och på engelska. Du trivs med att samarbeta med andra och är lyhörd och smidig. Du är genuint intresserad av teknik och ser rutiner och dokumentation som en viktig del av arbetet. Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





 Riksdagsförvaltningen tillämpar provanställning. Anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass, vilket i detta fall ställer krav på svenskt medborgarskap och godkänd säkerhetsprövning.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder dig** 




 I Riksdagsförvaltningen får du jobba med stimulerande, utvecklande och samhällsnyttiga arbetsuppgifter nära demokratins kärna. Här får du yrkesmässiga utmaningar och bra villkor kring semester, tjänstepension, föräldraledighet och kompetensutveckling. I riksdagens lokaler finns gym och träningslokal med olika träningspass varje dag. Vi strävar efter att våra medarbetare ska ha en bra balans mellan jobb och fritid. Vi erbjuder möjlighet till distansarbete i viss utsträckning.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Ansök via www.riksdagen.se, senast den 13 mars 2025.
 



 Referensnummer: 1200-2024/25
 



  





**Övrigt** 




 Riksdagsförvaltningen har gjort sitt medieval för rekrytering och undanber sig alla erbjudanden om annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp i samband med denna annons.
 



  





**Kontakta oss** 




 Fredrik Elmér, sektionschef, 08-786 60 40
 



  





**Fackliga representanter** 




 Helena Fridman Konstantinidou, Saco,
 



 Anneli Löfling, ST,
 



 Lars Vestberg, Seko, 08-786 40 00
 



  





**Att arbeta i Sveriges riksdag** 




 Riksdagen är hjärtat i den svenska demokratin. Riksdagsförvaltningens uppgift är att skapa bästa möjliga förutsättningar för riksdagen och dess ledamöter. Det är ett unikt uppdrag vi är stolta över. Vi har spännande arbetsuppgifter där vi utmanas yrkesmässigt. Samtidigt har vi god balans mellan arbete och fritid. Våra värdeord kvalitet, kompetens och engagemang ger oss en gemensam riktning. Tillsammans ser vi till att demokratin fungerar.

title: DATA SCIENTIST
description:
**Our purpose**
 At SAS we are passionate about revolutionizing the aviation industry through cutting-edge technology. We aim to become Scandinavia's preferred airline with your help. As part of our AI Team, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of air travel by developing and deploying innovative solutions. If you’re excited about driving machine learning projects to enhance network efficiency and revenue optimization, this role is for you!
   

  

**About The Team**
 We are a central machine learning team that collaborates closely with stakeholders across various business units, identifying business challenges and opportunities that can be addressed through advanced analytics.
   

  

 We work with diverse machine learning projects, collaborate and contribute to the machine learning practice to ensure that we have a solid foundation for SAS to scale and realize the full potential of machine learning.
   

  

 We are now strengthening our team with an experienced Data Scientist focused primarily on optimization projects within Revenue Management and Network, enhancing our advanced analytics capabilities to drive continuous business optimization.
   

  

**Data Scientist - Focused on Revenue Management and Network Optimization**
 In this role, you’ll work closely with the Commercial team, collaborating with Data Analysts and System Specialists on cross-functional initiatives within Revenue Management and Network.
   

  

 Your primary responsibilities will include translating business questions into analytical requirements and actionable data science use cases, developing and maintaining machine learning models, and applying innovative analytical approaches to drive business value.
   

  

 You’ll bring a fresh perspective to problem-solving by exploring advanced analytical techniques to address business challenges and uncover valuable insights. Your contributions will strengthen our data-driven approach, building a foundation for SAS to scale and unlock the full potential of machine learning.
   

  

 We believe you share our passion for data and algorithms. In this dynamic, fast-evolving environment of digital transformation, your curiosity and enthusiasm for using algorithms to solve complex problems and inspire others will be invaluable.
   

  

**To Be Successful, We Believe You Should Have**
* Master’s Degree or higher with strong mathematics focus (Data Science, Statistics, Econometrics, Applied Mathematics, Optimization, Computer Science) or related field.
* At least 3 years of industry experience within Data science domain
* Proven record of taking on loosely defined problems and translating into practical application
* Strong mathematical background (e.g., linear algebra, calculus, statistics, optimization)
* More than 3 years’ experience with Python, SQL and popular machine/deep learning libraries
* Proficient with statistical- and machine learning models (both supervised learning and unsupervised learning)
* Well-versed in cloud computing, prior experience with Azure is a big plus


 We believe you share our passion for data and algorithms. You’re self-driven, persistent, creative, and curious, with a strong passion for learning. You seek to understand both the big picture and the intricate details that make it up. Like us, you get excited by commercial opportunities and proactively strive to create business value.
   

  

**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Central Station, Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


 If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply already today with your CV and a short personal letter. Last day for application is January 26th, 2025. For questions relating to this position, please contact responsible Talent Acquisition Specialist rakhi.romarker@sas.dk.

title: Sr Director Analyst, Strategy for Automation Technologies (Business Process Automation) Remote Europe
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Information Services, and Research Services
description:
We are looking for a Senior Director-level analyst and thought leader to join our highly collaborative and diverse team who is passionate about helping our clients leverage automation technologies and platforms to support enterprise application strategy and application integration. Analysts produce research that answers the most pressing questions for IT Leaders across a number of industries. An analyst is an articulate thought-leader as well as an inquisitive student who enjoys continually learning. The ideal candidate will have hands on experience with numerous automation technologies and platforms (e.g., robotic process automation, business process automation, and AI driven automation) and a vision for the future automation and the evolution of the business orchestration and automation technologies market.
   

  

**What you'll do:**
* Develop thought leading research on business orchestration and automation technologies.
* Work with clients on strategic and tactical automation technology challenges.
* Deliver presentations at Gartner events, including Summits, and Symposia.
* Work with major robotic processing automation (RPA), business process automation (BPA) platforms and AI driven automation and low code application providers on product and industry direction.
* Attain industry leadership by responding to press inquiries and speaking at industry events.
* Support Gartner sales with proof of concepts and consultation on becoming a Gartner client and how we can help them with their automation technology and platform decisions.
* Contribute to research and agenda planning.


**Who you are:**
* We are seeking an experienced automation professional who has knowledge across a variety of automation platforms and industries. Qualified candidates should demonstrate expertise in the following areas:
+ Subject matter expertise in RPA and BPA. Knowledge of the RPA and BPA market and vendor landscape, and the competitive interplay between established vendors, emerging providers, disruptors and industry partnerships. Demonstrated understanding of RPA and BPA applications and opportunities in that market.
+ A broader understanding of the automation market beyond RPA, including BPA, workflow orchestration tools, business rules engines, AI driven technologies, low code and no code application development platforms.
+ Creating an automation strategy with practical steps for the implementation of RPA and BPA.
+ Practical insights on security and governance of automation including establishing an automation COE.
+ Knowledge and experience with RPA platforms from major vendors such as UiPath, Automation Anywhere, SS&C Blue Prism and Microsoft preferred.
+ Knowledge and experience with BPA platforms from major vendors such as Appian, Pegasystems, IBM, and Nintex.
+ A working knowledge of at least 1-2 tools from RPA and BPA or low code application market (LCAP) market.
+ Exposure to popular agentic AI capabilities/tools from different vendor ( e.g. Microsoft copilot Studio and or Salesforce’s Agentforce) is a plus.
+ Ability to develop thought leadership on he evolution of business orchestration and automation technologies (BOAT).
+ Preferably have some basic understanding of the Generative AI trends, Large Language Models and Prompt Engineering.
+ Some high-level understanding of the integration technologies including roles of APIs in automation.
+ Experience in comparing vendor capabilities (strengths and challenges) and preparing a shortlist vendors. Was responsible for vendor selection or at least had the opportunity to influence the decision making process.
+ Experience in developing a framework or strategy/roadmap for technology investment.
+ Experience or idea in governance of enterprise-wide automation initiatives. Either led an automation COE or worked with them.


**What you'll need:**
* Minimum of 12 years of experience in a research or technology related role
* Candidates may come from an end user environment, software vendor in the product team, implementation partner, and/or a consulting background in this space.
* Excellent writing and research skills, coupled with strong analytical skills.
* Willingness and ability to travel up to 25% (where applicable).


**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
   

  

 Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
   

  

 Job Requisition ID:97425
   

  

 By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
   

  

 Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
   

  

**For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.**

title: Senior Integration Engineer
description:
IT Corporate is a Nordic IT unit with close to 60 employees and consultants divided into three teams. We are responsible for systems and IT solutions for If's corporate units such as Accounting, Cash Management, Marketing, Legal and HR.
   

  

 Join us as we build a modern, sustainable tech unit within IT Corporate. Our mission is to embed sustainability in all operations, delivering high-quality, stable solutions that empower businesses. We’re modernizing our tech ecosystem to support the CFO unit’s transformation and improve financial reporting.
   

  

 Are you passionate about designing scalable, cutting-edge data infrastructure solutions and integration systems? Do you thrive in event-driven architectures and serverless ecosystems? If so, we’re looking for a Senior Azure Integration Engineer to join our team and help us push the boundaries of modern data engineering and integration.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a highly skilled Azure Integration Engineer to enable our Data Mesh called IT Corporate Data Platform using Azure Integration Services. This is an exciting opportunity for experienced professionals to take on a pivotal role in a dynamic environment.
   

  

 You will be part of a dedicated team from the very beginning, building our new data mesh platform and shaping its functionality and design. This is a unique opportunity to influence and create something extraordinary from the ground up.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

* Design and create integration patterns using modern integration tools such as Azure Event Hubs, Azure API Management, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Bricks, Azure Data Lake Storage.
* Implement integration processes and apply security best practices to ensure robust and secure data solutions.
* Deliver innovative financial solutions for Nordic and Baltic countries, addressing complex business needs with creative technical solutions.
* Implement a robust and scalable integration architecture cross domains, establishing integration standards and best practices.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an Agile work environment to streamline development processes and ensure seamless integration of financial data.


**What We Offer**
 In the same way that we place expectations on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
   

  

* An inclusive work environment where everyone is welcome.
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics.
* Social activities in a highly skilled professional environment.
* Possibility of a hybrid workplace.
* A health-promoting workplace with wellness allowance and various sports activities.
* Comprehensive insurance benefits.
* Lunch benefits.
* High pension savings.


**About The Team**
 IT Corporate offers work in a modern IT environment where you’ll combine maintenance with new development projects. Our technical environment includes several platforms, and our applications support various functions and processes.
   

  

 In this role you would be part of an innovative and driven team building a transformative data platform from scratch. We take pride in our expertise, not only in programming and system development, but also in project management, requirements handling, and test management. Our team works in close collaboration with customers, offering opportunities to engage with multiple customers and applications. You'll get the chance to contribute to both smaller and larger development projects in this role.
   

  

**Who Are You?**
 You enjoy collaborating and sharing knowledge with others, and you are recognized as a proactive and dependable team member. You are highly focused on delivering results, demonstrating flexibility and a solution-oriented approach in your work. You’re comfortable engaging in dialogues with users to understand their requirements and always strive to be proactive and innovative in addressing their needs.
   

  

**Your Qualifications**
* A relevant educational background in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent education.
* Strong expertise in Azure Integration Services, including Logic Apps, Azure Functions, API Management (APIM), Service Bus, and Event Grid.
* Proficiency in C#, PowerShell, and Python for developing custom integrations and automation scripts.
* Strong knowledge of RESTful APIs, SOAP, OAuth, and message-based architectures.
* Experience designing and implementing event-driven and serverless architectures in Azure.
* Practical understanding of Azure security best practices, including Managed Identities, Role-Based Access Control (RBAC), and API security.
* Ability to troubleshoot and optimize integrations for scalability, reliability, and cost-efficiency.
* A business understanding of accounting, financial data, and regulatory reporting (beneficial).
* Excellent communication skills and full proficiency in English, both verbal and written.
* Experience with collaborative problem-solving and troubleshooting.


**Additional facts and the recruitment process** 

**Application deadline:** 
 Screening and interviewing will start immediately. However, application deadline is 20th of March 2025.
   

**To apply for the position:** 
 Please attach your CV and answer the questions in the application form.
   

**Work location:** 
 Stockholm, Bergshamra.
   

  

**Background check:** 
 Final candidates will undergo a background check before employment.
   

  

**For more information,** 
 please contact Pontus Orrby, Head of Solutions Development, pontus.orrby@if.se.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: GTM Associate
description:
Pocketlaw is seeking a highly motivated, engaged and results-driven Go-To-Market Associate to join our growing commercial team and exciting journey in Legal AI.
   

  

 This role is ideal for someone with commercial background, keen to work at the intersection of business, legal and technology, and eager to see the impact and value that Legal AI can create for large businesses.
   

  

 As a GTM Associate, you will play a key role in driving Pocketlaw’s growth by engaging with potential clients and truly understand their legal challenges, and how our innovative AI solutions can enable them to work with control, consistency and speed.
   

  

 You will report directly to our VP GTM and have significant opportunities for professional development within a fast-paced, dynamic and fun company.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Business Development & Lead Generation – Identify and engage potential clients through outbound prospecting, networking, and social selling
* Product Demonstrations – Present and showcase Pocketlaw’s AI-powered tools, explaining how they can streamline legal processes
* Relationship Building – Develop strong relationships with decision-makers by understanding their legal and business needs
* Pipeline Management – Track and manage your sales pipeline to ensure a steady flow of opportunities


**Qualifications**
* +3 years of experience in Sales, Business Development, Management Consulting or some other commercial role, preferably at a B2B SaaS company
* Intelligent, strong communicator with strong interpersonal skills
* Driven, self-motivated, and eager to achieve and exceed targets
* Interest and/or knowledge about AI and the digital transformation of legal work
* Fluency in Swedish and English
* Business degree from a top university
* Preferably with some legal experience, training or background


**Key Competencies**
* Proactive: Takes initiative and works independently to drive sales outcomes
* Results-Oriented: Focused on achieving and exceeding sales targets
* Team Player: Works well within a team, contributing to collective goals
* Strong Communicator: Excellent verbal and written communication skills


**Salary & Location**
* Competitive base, with double OTE commission structure
* A dynamic work place at the intersection of legal and tech
* A warm and welcoming office in central Stockholm


**About Pocketlaw**
 Pocketlaw is an AI legal tech company reimagining legal work for every team. We enable companies to centralise legal processes and automate contract management through intuitive tools, automation, and AI. Headquartered in Stockholm, with offices in London, Pocketlaw is rapidly expanding after continued revenue growth.
   

  

****Join us at Pocketlaw and be a part of the future of legal tech!****
 Pocketlaw helps companies solve their everyday legal needs - empowering every team in the organisation to create contracts and manage legal with efficiency, ease and confidence. Pocketlaw is transforming legal for businesses; turning it from a business blocker into a business enabler - with the end goal of giving every company in the world legal peace of mind.

title: Project Manager
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Research Services
description:
We invite you to join our closely-knit, motivated, and fantastic team, taking your place in our team as a Senior Project Manager based in the Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 You will be responsible for delivery of projects supporting our customers when deploying Dassault Systèmes solution, on time, to budget and with optimum value. This for example includes management of financial reporting, dependencies across several projects, mitigation of project risks and issues and status reporting to customers. The initial project at hand is focusing on IT operations and IT systems change management hence experience of IT management is useful.
   

  

 Dassault Systèmes, the 3DEXPERIENCE Company, provides businesses with virtual universes to imagine sustainable innovations. Our world-leading solutions transform the way products are designed, produced and supported. Our Industry Services division is responsible for the delivery of our product implementations in Enterprise and household-name brands, providing exciting and challenging exposure to leading-edge innovation in a wide range of industries.
   

  

**Role Description & Responsibilities**
* Monitor progress of tasks and activities in relation to the defined scope, anticipate, communicate and mitigate projects risks and issues within a shared governance structure
* Stakeholder management and status updates of the key milestone, issues, and escalations to the senior management
* Prepare complete and accurate reporting including financial, internal and external status reporting
* Prepare and submit forecasts for assigned projects
* Prepare, communicate and execute project schedules to fulfil the scope of the project
* Foster strong team sprit among project team members and trust-based relationship with the end customer
* Drive project activities and resources to guarantee the committed quality, margin and schedule


**Qualifications**
* Solid experience in a Project Management role implementing information systems (PLM, ERP, MES) at enterprise level
* Experience of aligning project work with Agile principles such as SAFe , LeSS or other Agile deployment methodologies
* Demonstrate strong communication and expectation management skills by effectively conveying information tailored to different audiences, including customer executives, business stakeholders, IT stakeholders, and end users.
* Capable of managing difficult situations and not afraid of being challenged
* Experience working with team from different countries and with off shore resources and teams.
* IT operational, change management and leadership experience with a knowledge and experience of IT global services provision and processes
* Project management certifications: PMP, PRINCE 2 or similar are considered as an asset.
* Swedish language skills are considered as a big asset, fluent English skills are critical requirement


**What’s In It For You**
* An international and diverse working environment in a collaborative team
* Flexible working hours with hybrid working model, a good work-life balance and comprehensive benefits package.
* Extensive skills and career development programs to build your journey with us.


 Interested? Click on "Apply" to upload your application documents.
   

  

**Diversity statement**
 As a game-changer in sustainable technology and innovation, Dassault Systèmes is striving to build more inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. We believe that our people are our number one asset and we want all employees to feel empowered to bring their whole selves to work every day. It is our goal that our people feel a sense of pride and a passion for belonging. As a company leading change, it’s our responsibility to foster opportunities for all people to participate in a harmonized Workforce of the Future.

title: SaaS Backend Engineer - IoT Data
description:
This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing pre-IPO international software company.
   

  

 Canonical's engineering team is at the forefront of the IoT revolution and aims to strengthen this position by developing cutting-edge telemetry and connectivity solutions. By integrating reliable, secure, and robust data streaming capabilities into the Snappy ecosystem, we are setting new standards in the industry for ease of development, implementation, management and security.
   

  

 We are seeking talented individuals to help us enhance our global SaaS services, providing customers with the essential data services needed to build the next generation of IoT devices effortlessly. Our commitment to data governance, ownership, and confidentiality is unparalleled, ensuring our customers can innovate with confidence on top of the globally trusted Ubuntu platform.
   

  

 Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Collaborate remotely with a globally distributed team.
* Architect scalable service APIs to provide streaming data services to other teams and products using Python and Golang.
* Develop data governance, management and auditing systems within our telemetry platform.
* Work with our infrastructure team to develop both a cloud-based SaaS offering as well as a containerised on-prem solution.
* Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production and ongoing operations at scale.
* Review code and technical designs produced by other engineers.
* Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding optimal solutions.
* Work remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events.


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people.
* You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable.
* You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated.
* You have a broad technology base but favour backend code and infrastructure.
* You have a good understanding of cybersecurity and the challenges of the IoT environment when it comes to connectivity and data streaming.
* You have knowledge and experience of telemetry and connectivity systems and platforms including data streaming technologies (MQTT, Kafka, RabbitMQ, etc) observability (OpenTelemetry), industrial/engineering data exchange protocols (OPC-UA, ModBus), and the application of data governance/IAM models to such systems.
* You have proficiency in the design and implementation of back-end web services, messaging/data pipelines, and REST APIs using Python and/or Golang.
* You are familiar with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform.
* You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree.
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 1000+ professionals across 70+ countries. We want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.
   

  

 What Canonical offers:
   

  

* Work from home
* Learning and development allowances
* Competitive Salary
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Generous annual leave
* Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave
* Priority Pass for travel
* Exposure to international business and technology


*We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.*

title: Quality Assurance & HACCP Co-ordinator
company_industry: Food and Beverage Manufacturing, Food and Beverage Services, and Manufacturing
description:
**Job Description**
**Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?**
**Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.**
 You are a key ingredient in helping us in enabling the site in effective compliance for Food Safety and HACCP rules. This role will lead and co-ordinate HACCP and Food Safety requirements in line with company objectives, ensuring effective CAPA and quality system programs and driving continues improvements. You will report directly to site quality manager.
   

  

**How You Will Contribute**
* Drive for Results - can be counted on to exceed goals successfully; is constantly and consistently one of the top performers; very bottom-line oriented; steadfastly pushes self and others for results.
* Priority Setting- Spends their time and the time of others on what’s important; quickly zeros in on the critical few and puts the trivial many aside; can quickly sense what will help or hinder accomplishing a goal; eliminates roadblocks; creates focus.
* Interpersonal Savvy – Relates well to all kinds of people in the organization; builds and leverages relationships; can diffuse high-tension situations effectively.
* Ensuring all functions in change management projects are aware of and follow policies, legislation, and best practices regarding food safety, and HACCP guidelines.
* Contributing to the required competency level of Manufacturing Unit (MU) personnel by influencing, supporting and educating in quality awareness when applicable (ex. compliance to quality policies and best practices)


**Key Responsibilities**
 HACCP:
   

  

* You will lead site’s quality & food safety system, including internal documentation and change management control to ensure quality policies, internal and external aspects are integrated into the local systems effectively.
* Implement and ensure compliance with Mondelez Standard, FSSC 22000, internal and external requirements.
* Participation in change projects to assure potential quality and food safety risks are assessed and actions taken accordingly.
* Develop and facilitate food safety training sessions, ensuring employees are well-versed in food safety protocols and regulatory expectations.
* Perform regular verification of Critical Control Points (CCPs), Specific Prerequisite Programs and Operational Prerequisite Programs (OPRPs), ensuring they meet established standards and coordinating corrective actions when necessary.


 Corrective and preventative actions:
   

  

* Lead and manage CAPA systems to ensure all issues and non-conformities are managed according to requirements and in timely manner including robust RCAs and adherence to PDCA cycle.
* Lead and participate in root cause analysis for food safety issues, working with the quality team to implement effective preventive measures.
* Ensure regular follow ups to identify continues improvement opportunities and lead implementation of those.


 Internal and external audits:
   

  

* Manage internal audit program and lead and participate in internal and external audits such as authority visits, FSSC 22 000 audits etc.


 Quality systems:
   

  

* Develop & support the maintenance of all aspects of the Quality & Food Safety Management System.
* Facilitate & coach compliance to Quality & Food Safety record keeping, retention & revision.


 Continuous improvement
   

  

* Participate in IL6S programs and lead standard work process for quality fundamentals within the Quality Management pillar.
* Manage quality KPIs by compiling and analysing data, identifying areas of improvement.
* Challenge status quo to increase efficiency.
* Identify gaps related to quality (e.g. routines, best practices, Quality Policies, specifications, quality and food safety documentation etc.).
* Contributing to achieve a high level of quality and food safety awareness throughout the production organization by conducting required training and coaching in relevant areas such as GMP, microbiology, hygienic design, pest control, sanitation.


**What You Will Bring**
 A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:
   

  

* Relevant experience in Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG)
* Experience in food safety management, including HACCP, Food Safety Plans, and CCP/OPRP programs.
* Deep knowledge of GMP, zoning, environmental monitoring, allergen and foreign matter control within food manufacturing environments.
* Experience in managing food safety risks: identification and management, HACCP and prerequisite controls, hygienic design.
* Deep knowledge of IL6S, Lean or similar.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to influence and educate cross-functional teams.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills to identify risks and implement corrective actions.
* Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to work independently and with cross-functional teams to ensure food safety standards are met.
* Take initiative with minimal direction.
* Possess strong verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal skills to act as a liaison.
* Fluent in English, and preferably in Swedish
