title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
We know it, you know it. Most companies ramble on about purpose and making the world a better place. And pretty often it feels a bit… well, forced. But we’d like to think that our story is special for real.
 



  





 Our founders, Shadi Bitar and Ninos Malki, came to Sweden from Syria when they were kids. Books became their compass, guiding them through the maze of life, and helping them shape their destinies in a new world.
 



  





 Their dream was bold: What if they could unlock the world of books for everyone, making knowledge and inspiration accessible to all? Fast forward a few years, and the tale of Nextory was born.
 



  





 At Nextory, we've crafted a revolutionary monthly subscription that empowers our users to devour books like never before, be it through reading or listening. It's not just a product; it's a passport to endless adventure and enlightenment.
 



  





 And now, we're on a quest to find our Marketing Coordinator, someone as passionate as we are about making the world a happier place and enriching lives through the world of reading. Join our extraordinary team, and let's script a future where every day is a chapter of discovery, and every book is a key to a richer life.
 



  





**WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING** 




 As our Marketing Coordinator, your main responsibilities are to support and lead the execution of Nextory's local marketing strategies and campaigns in the Netherlands. You will play a crucial role in assisting the essential work of the marketing team, coordinating various tasks, projects, and activities to ensure everything runs smoothly, efficiently, and within budget.
 



  





 You’ll also get to work hands-on with our social media channels in your local market—planning, creating, and publishing engaging content that connects with our audience. Whether it’s crafting the perfect post, keeping up with trends, or analyzing performance, you’ll be a key player in growing our brand’s presence.
 



 The position is based in Stockholm and you will be reporting to the Head of Marketing.
 



  





**WHO YOU ARE** 




 We believe passion and creativity flow through your veins, and drive is your middle name – you’re a master at combining and channeling these abilities into an organised and results-oriented working method. You have a can-do attitude and a broad understanding of creative communication and it's importance.
 



  





**SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS** 




 • We believe you have a university degree or diploma in marketing
 



 • We believe you have 2-3 years of experience working with various marketing and social media campaigns (even writing your own marketing plans) in your daily work
 



 • You’re a Dutch native with local market knowledge.
 



 • We believe you are a strong communicator with excellent writing skills in Dutch and a good command of English, both written and spoken.
 **We’ll be extra curious if you also master German!** 




 • We believe that you are a proactive and innovative person who’s not afraid to generate new ideas based on data-driven insights
 



  





 And if you share our love for books, consider us even more excited to meet you!
 



  





**WORK ENVIRONMENT AND IMPORTANT DETAILS** 




 At Nextory, we believe a strong and inclusive culture is key to our success - and that culture flourishes when we meet and collaborate in person as much as possible. That’s why we spend the majority of the working time at our beautiful office!
 



  





 We are based in Stockholm, Sweden, with offices in Paris and Bangalore. Our hybrid work policy includes four days in the office and Wednesdays as a work-from-home day.
 



  





 We apply a 6-month probationary period.
 



  





 We are looking forward to your application which should include a CV or LinkedIn profile. Also, we would love a pitch of why you are the marketing wiz we are looking for!

title: Preclinical Scientist to Chiesi
description:
QRIOS Life Science is recruiting a consultant, a scientist to join the Preclinical team at Chiesi, a global research-focused pharmaceutical company.
   

  

 Would you like to be part of a team in developing discovery projects in the field of rare diseases by working on characterization of animal disease models, in vitro cell assays as well as providing support to the team in contracting external labs for various services? This might be an opportunity for you, welcome with your application!
   

  

**About The Position**
 Chiesi is a global , research-focused family-owned pharmaceutical company that has established a strong heritage in developing innovative pharmaceutical solutions to improve the life of patients with high unmet medical needs.
   

  

 In this role, you will be a part of the Preclinical Research team in the unit, Global Rare Diseases (GRD) in Chiesi and join a great team with competent and dedicated colleagues working in discovery projects within the field of rare diseases.
   

  

 One focus disease area is lysosomal storage disorders where Chiesi develops therapies for enzyme replacement therapies.
   

  

 This is a 12-month position, and you will be hired by QRIOS Life Science and work on-site at Chiesi, based at Campus Solna in Stockholm.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 In this role the main responsibility will be to perform disease model phenotyping in primary tissues and cells utilizing IHC and ICC, including picture analyses and statistics.
   

  

 Supporting the team with setting up contracts with contract research labs (CROs), handling shipments of animals, tissues and drug products to service providers and research collaborators, as well as other administrative tasks, will be an important part of your role.
   

  

 Additionally, you may be involved in designing and conducting vitro assays, such as cell-based assays, biochemical assays, and enzymatic activity assays, to evaluate efficacy of drug candidates.
   

  

 You will utilize routine laboratory techniques, including IHC, ICC, cell culture, ELISA, qPCR, and Western blotting.
   

  

 Analyzing experimental data using appropriate statistical methods and presenting your findings during team meetings will be a critical part of your duties.
   

  

 Maintaining accurate and detailed laboratory records in compliance with standard protocols is essential.
   

  

 You will troubleshoot technical challenges and optimize assay protocols as needed.
   

  

 Collaboration with cross-functional teams is crucial to achieve project goals. You will also contribute to written reports, including study summaries, protocols, and presentations.
   

  

**Your profile**
 – The right candidate has a BSc or MSc or PhD in relevant scientific discipline.
   

  

 – You have experience from working in academic labs and/or in the industrial setting.
   

  

 Laboratory experiences sought for:
   

  

 Experience with Immunohistochemistry (IHC) and Immunocytochemistry (ICC). Experience with advanced imaging techniques (e.g., confocal microscopy, slide scanning).
   

  

 Familiarity with data analysis tools (e.g., GraphPad Prism, Microsoft Excel, ImageJ).
   

  

 Experience with cell culture techniques and culture of primary or immortalized cell lines.
   

  

 Interpersonal skills sought for:
   

  

 Strong organizational skills (i.e., ability to prioritize tasks, manage time efficiently, and maintain detailed records to ensure smooth workflows and adherence to deadlines) and documentation skills (i.e., attention to details, problem-solving attitude, great communication skills).
   

  

 Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced research environment.
   

  

 It is meritorious if you have:
   

  

 Experience from CNS research and the field of rare diseases is an advantage.
   

  

 Planning and execution of in vivo studies
   

  

 Handling and differentiation of iPSCs
   

  

 Awareness of drug discovery pipelines and preclinical research workflows.
   

  

 To be successful in this role you have a genuine scientific interest, strong interpersonal skills and you are used to work in a “collaborative mode” in multi-disciplinary and multi-nationally project teams. You have good communication skills and the ability to share your results, experiences and knowledge in meetings with internal and external partners.
   

  

 You are analytical, organized, and thorough and it is important that you are results driven and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment. Being able to handle multiple tasks independently and managing priorities in order to meet project timelines are important skill sets for this position. Fluent English both speaking and in writing is required.
   

  

**About The Organisation**
 About Chiesi – A GLOBAL FAMILY DEDICATED TO PEOPLE AND PATIENTS
   

  

 In Chiesi our approach as a Benefit Corporation is a way of being as well as a way of thinking. We redefine the way to do our business, to create a positive impact on people, environment and our global Chiesi Community, acting as a force for good.
   

  

 We are passionate and committed to improving and raising the quality of human life and making meaningful contributions that will have a positive long-lasting impact. Our entrepreneurial thinking, our sustainable and innovative ideas, transformative solutions and our personal chemistry are the key elements that bonds us and make us grow as one cohesive global Chiesi family.
   

  

 For information about Chiesi, please visit www.chiesi.com and for info about the Global Rare Diseases unit, please visit www.chiesiglobalrarediseases.com.
   

  

**Fakta**
* Bransch


 Life Science
   

  

* Stad Stockholm
* Anställningsform Visstidsanställning
* Uppdragstyp Heltid
* Sista ansökningsdag 2025-03-09
* Referensnummer 1205


**Har du frågor?**
 Hanna Peterson
   

  

 hanna.peterson@qrios.se

title: Technical Sales Manager - Citrix Solutions (Scandinavian Market)
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, and Wholesale
description:
****Position:****
 Technical Sales Manager - Citrix Solutions (Scandinavian Market)
   

  

****Job Description:****
**Arrow's Enterprise Computing Solutions (ECS)** 
 business is a global technology enablement company that brings innovative IT solutions to the market to solve complex business challenges. We deliver value-added distribution, business consulting, and channel enablement services to the world's leading technology manufacturers and their channel partners that serve commercial and government markets.
   

  

**Job Overview:**
 As a
 **Technical Sales Representative specializing in Citrix solutions in our Scandinavian market (Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden)** 
 , you will work with potential and existing customers to understand their IT needs and provide tailored Citrix solutions that optimize performance, security, and user experience. You will collaborate with the sales and technical teams to drive business growth, while ensuring that customers are fully equipped to meet their goals with Citrix products.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
**Sales Support & Solution Design:**
* Partner with sales representatives to identify business opportunities and qualify leads.
* Understand customers' requirements and recommend appropriate Citrix solutions such as Virtualization, Networking, Cloud, and Endpoint management.
* Present and demonstrate Citrix solutions and technical capabilities to customers.
* Customize solutions to meet the client's business and technical needs.


**Technical Expertise & Consultation:**
* Offer technical consultation to customers by discussing Citrix products' features, benefits, and implementation processes.
* Conduct product demos, POCs (Proof of Concepts), and workshops for clients in the whole Scandinavian country to showcase the capabilities of Citrix offerings.
* Provide insight and guidance on solution design, configurations, and deployments.


**Pre-sales Activities:**
* Develop and deliver technical presentations and webinars for prospective customers.
* Assist in crafting RFPs (Request for Proposals) and technical documentation for bids.
* Conduct system analysis to ensure proposed Citrix solutions meet customer specifications.


**Collaboration & Communication:**
* Collaborate with internal teams (sales, support, marketing, etc.) to deliver the best solution to clients.
* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of Citrix product offerings, competitive landscape, and industry trends.
* Work with product managers and engineers to convey customer feedback and suggest product improvements.


**Customer Support:**
* Provide ongoing support to customers (in face to face and remotely) during the pre-sales phase and assist in troubleshooting any technical queries.
* Help customers with initial setup, configuration, and integration of Citrix solutions into their environment.


**Training & Development:**
* Regularly update knowledge on Citrix products through training sessions, certifications, and continuous learning.
* Keep clients informed about new Citrix features, product updates, and best practices.


**Qualifications:**
**Technical Skills:**
* Proficiency in Citrix solutions, such as Citrix Virtual Apps, Citrix Virtual Desktops, Citrix ADC (NetScaler), and Citrix Workspace.
* Strong understanding of cloud computing, virtualization, networking, and IT infrastructure.
* Experience with Windows Server, Active Directory, and related technologies.
* Knowledge of Citrix licensing models and pricing


**Experience:**
* 3+ years of experience in technical sales, IT consulting, or solution engineering (preferably in the Citrix space).
* Experience in sales and/or technical roles involving cloud or virtualization solutions is a plus.


**Communication Skills:**
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to simplify complex technical concepts for non-technical audiences.
* Strong presentation and customer-facing skills.


**Certifications (preferred):**
* Citrix Certified Sales Professional (CCSP).
* Citrix Certified Associate (CCA) or Citrix Certified Professional (CCP).
* ITIL Foundation Certification (optional but beneficial).


**Other:**
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple sales opportunities simultaneously.
* Self-motivated and able to work under pressure to meet deadlines.
* A passion for technology and helping customers optimize their IT environments.


**WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU:**
* Fantastic working culture where you can make an impact
* Competitive package composed of a base salary plus bonus based on your performance with the car allowance included
* This position is a life changing opportunity to start and continue a key career move in a fast paced, international organization. Progression and investment are paramount in Arrow's ethos.


****Location:****
 SE-Kista, Sweden (Kronborgsgränd)
   

  

****Time Type:****
 Full time
   

  

****Job Category:****
 Sales

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Har du flera års erfarenhet och teknisk kompetens inom Data Science-projekt? Vi söker dig som är en passionerad och erfaren Data Scientist, där du blir en del av vårt satsningsområde där målsättningen är att bli ledande. Våra kunder har ett stort behov av automatisering genom intelligent automation och dataanalys, och vi behöver din expertis! Vill du forma framtidens digitala samhälle och ständigt utvecklas? Då har vi utmaningen för dig!
 



  





**Din roll på Atea** 




 Våra kunder genomgår en digital förändringsresa där du som Data Scientist kommer att ha en nyckelroll. I rollen som Data Scientist kommer du att arbeta med allt från externa faktorer, programmering, dataanalys, API:er, backend och leverans, till att leda projekt och säkerställa hög prestanda i skala.
 



 Konsultrollen erbjuder ett varierande arbete, ett längre uppdrag eller flera parallella, på egen hand eller i team med andra kollegor. Du möter nya människor och kontexter och som konsult ansvarar du för att driva projekt framåt och i mål, samt upptäcka ytterligare behov där både du och andra på Atea kan bidra för att skapa värde för kunden.
 



 Du kommer att vara en del av vårt affärsområde Information Management som omfattar strategi, arkitektur, information & data analytics (AI, BI, RPA och IoT), verksamhetsutveckling, förändringsledning, it-styrning, projektledning samt informations- och cybersäkerhet.
 



  





 Rollen som Data Scientist på Atea erbjuder:
 


* Möjlighet att leda och driva spännande data science-projekt
* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö där din goda affärsförståelse och starka kommunikationsförmåga, både internt och externt, kommer till sin rätt
* En plattform för att utveckla dina interpersonella färdigheter och optimera prestanda genom kod- och dataflödesoptimeringar



  





**Ditt team** 




 Christian Hedén, Konsultchef på Atea, kommer att vara din närmste chef i rollen. Du kommer ingå ett närmsta team på åtta drivna och ansvarstagande kollegor som jobbar tätt tillsammans och alltid ställer upp för varandra. Du kommer även jobba tätt med andra team inom området nationellt på Atea. Inom teamet är det högt i tak och prestigelöst och vi har en bred kunskap som består av både juniora och seniora personer.
 



  





**Vad vi söker hos dig** 




 Vi tror på dig och dina personliga egenskaper, som är viktiga för att lyckas och trivas hos oss. Du är drivande och resultatinriktad, analytisk och lösningsorienterad med lätt för att anpassa dig till nya förhållanden. Du är kommunikativ, skapar goda relationer och har ett affärsmässigt fokus där du förstår innebörden att leverera hög klass på service mot våra kunder. Med god erfarenhet är du självgående inom området och du strävar efter att utvecklas inom området.
 



  





 För rollen som Senior Data Scientist ser vi att du har med dig:
 


* Flertalet års erfarenhet av liknande roll med hög kompetensnivå inom statistisk modellering
* Djup förståelse för relationer mellan verkliga faktorer, modellparametrar och tolkningar av modellresultat
* Stark affärsförståelse och förmåga att skala upp prestanda, både internt och externt
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Python
* Erfarenhet av Machine Learning
* Obehindrad i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* Relevant akademisk utbildning inom IT, datavetenskap, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande



  





**Har vi väckt ditt intresse?** 




 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Christian Hedén, Konsultchef, via christian.heden@atea.se. Har frågor om rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta Annie Davnert, Talent Acquisition Partner, via annie.davnert@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag!
 



 Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.
 



 Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.
 



  





**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!** 




*Den här rekryteringen hanteras av oss på Atea och vi undanber oss därför samtal och mail från rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag.* 









**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Senior Health & Safety Engineer for Governance Safety
description:
Are you eager to take a leading role in shaping and developing Governance Safety at Scania on a global scale, while continuously improving our work environment?
   

  

 We are offering an exciting opportunity to join Scania’s global HSE organization in a role focused on work environment management. The organization emphasizes governance in the field of HSE on corporate, global, and local levels – with a worldwide scope across all business areas. The head office is located in Södertälje.
   

  

 We are undergoing an exciting transformation, and this role provides significant opportunities to shape and influence the way we work.
   

  

**Company Overview**
 Scania is currently transitioning from being a supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to becoming a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

 At Scania CV AB, we believe that change is vital for growth and innovation. As a leader in our industry, we are committed to staying ahead of market trends and adapting to evolving conditions. Our success hinges on our ability to manage change effectively, enabling our employees and stakeholders to embrace new strategies, technologies, and processes.
   

  

**Position Overview**
 In this global role, you will be part of a dedicated team where ideas and innovation are encouraged. Together, we strive to find the best solutions and foster growth both individually and as an organization. You will focus on statistics, reporting, specifically within CSRD (Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive) and governance
 **.** 
 This is an exciting opportunity to influence and shape the role as you contribute to Scania's work environment strategies.
   

  

 Some of the main responsibilities will include:
   

  

  

* Provide expert knowledge on a global level in compliance with current legislation, policy, and methods, ensuring adherence to relevant guidelines and regulations in collaboration with stakeholders.
* Work with ISO 45001 to ensure a high standard of safety management.
* Responsible for reporting related to CSRD (Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive) from a Health & Safety perspective, along with other relevant legislation.
* Develop, provide, and analyze statistical data in the field of work environment.
* Collaborate with Scania stakeholders and brand colleagues.
* Actively participate in internal networks and work cross-functionally within global and local structures.


**Qualifications**
* Senior-level Work Environment Engineer, or equivalent experience in a relevant field.
* Competence in ISO 45001 and its implementation and maintenance within large organizations.
* In-depth knowledge of legal compliance frameworks and regulations, including CSRD (Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive).
* Strong experience in data analysis and reporting related to work environment compliance.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills to work with stakeholders across different levels and locations.
* Ability to lead cross-functional teams, manage multiple priorities, and drive collaboration across departments to achieve safety and compliance objectives in a global environment.
* Experience in developing organizational structures and processes.
* Proven experience in method development.
* Knowledge of European and Swedish Health & Safety legislation.
* Fluent in English and Swedish.


**Meritorious**
* Strong analytical skills to interpret legislation and provide actionable insights.
* Certified Auditor in ISO 45001.
* Proficiency in relevant IT tools and pedagogical tools.


**Location:** 
 Sweden (Södertälje)
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible but no later than March 13th. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact Head of Governance Safety mia.linder@scania.com .
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Säljare inom foodtech - Svensktalande
description:
Vill du vara en del av ett globalt snabbväxande Scaleup med världens största plattform för matsvinn?
   

  

 Vi letar efter dig som är en fena på att knyta kontakter och drivs av att identifiera strategiska möjligheter med fokus på tillväxt.
   

  

 På Too Good To Go drömmer vi om en planet utan matsvinn. Vår app har sedan 2016 blivit en av de snabbast växande apparna och är idag den största digitala marknadsplatsen för matsvinn i Europa, med över 111 miljoner användare och mer än 410 miljoner räddade måltider.
   

  

 Vi är stolta över vad vi har uppnått hittills, men i Sverige är vi bara i början av vår resa.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en driven säljare med passion för att bygga starka relationer och sluta affärer.. Du kommer att ingå i vårt Independent sales team och rapportera till Head of Independent Partners.
   

  

**Erbjudande**
* Stark personlig såväl som professionell utveckling i en intensiv och snabbväxande Scale Up miljö.
* Attraktiv grundlön + bonus utan tak
* Vara en stor drivkraft till vår framtida utveckling genom att bidra med dina idéer, kunskaper och färdigheter.
* En unik möjlighet att arbeta i ett snabbväxande Social Impact företag (vi är även B Corporation certifierade)
* Du får vara del av ett internationellt företag med stark gemenskap och över 1300+ engagerade kollegor i 19 länder – som alltid redo att dela med sig av kunskap och stöd!
* Kontor i ett härligt coworking space mitt på Södermalm i Stockholm.
* En stark teamkultur där vi firar framgångar tillsammans.


**Rollen**
* Driva och optimera din sälj-pipeline, med andra ord: prospektering, boka in och leda möten och förhandlingar, och sluta affärer med beslutsfattare i alla segment, samt onboarda nya partners i appen. Våra möten är mestadels digitala.
* Analysera marknaden och identifiera växande segment.
* Utmana och driva intern utveckling för att utveckla våra befintliga processer genom ett tätt samarbete i teamet.
* Stötta och coacha dina kollegor i ‘best practises’ då vi starkt tror på ‘One Team’ som även är en av våra värdegrunder.


**Kompetenser Och Erfarenhet**
* Du har tidigare försäljningserfarenhet av B2B och är inte rädd för att knyta nya kontakter.
* Du är prestationsorienterad och drivs av att nå och överträffa mål.
* Du har en stark kommunikationsförmåga och känner dig bekväm när du kontaktar beslutsfattare via e-post, telefon, och digitala möten .
* Professionella svenska och engelska språkkunskaper.
* Du arbetar på ett organiserat och fokuserat sätt.
* Du har en passion för vårt uppdrag.
* Erfarenhet inom telesales, och livsmedels-, restaurang- eller techbranschen är en bonus!


**Låter detta som rollen för dig?**
 Ansökan
   

  

 Sök genom att skicka in ditt CV och personliga brev på engelska, samt att svara på några korta frågor.
   

  

 Observera att vi endast tar emot ansökningar som kommer in via vår plattform. Inget CV eller personligt brev accepteras via e-post eller LinkedIn direkt meddelanden.
   

  

 Se även vår webbplats och internationella medier för att få en bra överblick över Too Good To Go.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!
   

  

 Vi vill inspirera och ge alla möjligheten att bekämpa matsvinn tillsammans. Med det uppdraget är det bara naturligt att vi vill bygga ett mångsidigt och inkluderande team av skickliga individer som brinner för att göra saker på ett bättre sätt. Vi tror starkt på att alla utmärker sig och att vi är mer kreativa när vi får vara oss själva. Vi är engagerade i en kultur där alla känner sig välkomna. Vi är en arbetsgivare som står för för lika möjligheter, och all rekrytering och urval bedöms utifrån kvalifikationer, meriter och affärsbehov.
   

  

*A Movement for Everyone*
*We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.*
*We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.*

title: Distribution Partner Account Manager
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
Splunk, a Cisco company, is building a safer and more resilient digital world with an end-to-end full stack platform made for a hybrid, multi-cloud world. Leading enterprises use our unified security and observability platform to keep their digital systems secure and reliable. Our customers love our technology, but it's our caring employees that make Splunk stand out as an amazing career destination. No matter where in the world or what level of the organization, we approach our work with kindness. So bring your work experience, problem-solving skills and talent, of course, but also bring your joy, your passion and all the things that make you, you. Come help organizations be their best, while you reach new heights with a team that has your back.
   

  

 Role
   

  

 We are seeking an outstanding “Distribution Partner Account Manager” for our North EMEA region to help Splunk support and grow our distribution partners. The role has the primary responsibility to meet and exceed, quarterly and annual revenue quota assignments for specified distributor(s) and growing Splunk's business in the distribution channel. This includes the understanding of distributor business goals and requirements, and being involved in the presentation of Splunk product, solution and technology propositions to distribution salespeople.
   

  

 Responsibilities I want to and can do that!
   

  

* Meet and exceed revenue and bookings quotas in assigned channel.
* Consistently deliver aggressive license, support and service revenue targets – commitment to the number and to deadlines
* Account planning and opportunity management with the distribution and distribution managed channel
* Lead sales efforts with distribution and distribution managed channel
* Enable distributor & partners in our selling and product methodology
* Recruit onboarding and training to new partners
* Execute partner/sales marketing activities aligned with sales quota (marketing, campaign, cross-selling, pipeline generation and quota retirement)
* Manage interface between Splunk and channel/distributor. Manage channel conflict.
* Interact with Splunk direct sales team
* Work with Splunk Sales RSMs and Channel PSM´s to build and manage demand generation and marketing efforts
* Drive marketing activities with complementary technology partners
* Ensure partners are driving towards certification requirements and Partnerverse compliance metrics


 Ensure channel/distributors meet and exceed goals by
   

  

* Understanding channel/distributors business strategies
* Communicating channel/distributors business strategies to relevant departments in Splunk
* Understanding and presenting Splunk value proposition (corporate, positioning, products, technologies, capabilities) to distributors and VARs.
* Managing channel/distributors product focus.
* Managing quarterly and ad-hoc promotional activities at channel/distributors.
* Training channel/distributors salespeople.
* Monitoring and reporting competitive activities and sales.
* Monitoring and reporting on distributor POS sales
* Adjusting sales activities and product mix as needed based on POS sales.
* Managing co-marketing opportunities with channel partners and third-party allies.
* Satisfy internal reporting requirements by submitting reports and records in accordance with company policies and practices.
* Participate in trade shows and make presentations, as required.
* Travel to distributor locations for mindshare, enablement and training


 Requirements I've already done that!
   

  

* 5+ years of Distribution Partner Account Manager in a fast-growing software company
* 5+ years of Distributor and VARs experience within a technology company that is similar to Splunk’s industry
* Recent and previous success exceeding revenue and bookings quotas in a distribution channel
* Experience identifying new resellers and prioritizing Distribution’s for a company’s team
* Success and references to prove the success from working with direct sales teams and sales leaders
* Experience strategizing and managing Distributors and exceeding goals
* Experience with analyzing and reporting actives related to sales and revenue activities
* Forecasting commitments and forecasting accuracy
* Fluent in Swedish and English (both written and spoken)


****Splunk is an Equal Opportunity Employer****
****Splunk, a Cisco company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.****

title: Product Marketing Lead
description:
**Xensam: SAM Disrupters** 




 Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
 



  





 We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
 



  





**About the role** 




 Are you a master storyteller who can transform complex technology into compelling customer value? As the guardian of our product positioning, you'll shape how we communicate the value of our fast-growing Software Asset Management platform to the world.
 



  





 As our Product Marketing Lead at Xensam, you'll be the storyteller who bridges our R&D innovations with customer needs. Working within our dynamic marketing team and reporting to the CMO, you'll own our product narrative across all channels.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Guard our product positioning to ensure consistent product messaging in collaboration with R&D and marketing teams.
* Craft compelling content that transforms technical features into business value.
* Drive product launch campaigns and regular release communications across multiple channels.
* Design lifecycle marketing messages within product notifications and communications.
* Conduct market research and customer interviews to shape our narrative.
* Transform technical documentation into customer-friendly communications.
* Co-create brand awareness campaigns for product positioning.



  





**Qualifications** 



* 2-3 years of product marketing experience, ideally in B2B SaaS.
* Bachelor in marketing, business or tech, with additional education (course, certification, or diploma) in writing.
* Exceptional writing skills in English with the ability to simplify complex technical concepts.
* Strong analytical capabilities for market and customer insights.
* Proactive approach and structured working style.
* Excellence in cross-functional collaboration and stakeholder management.



  





**Bonus points if you have** 



* Technical writing background.
* Confidence in front of the camera for video content.
* Presentation and webinar experience.
* Previous experience in Software or SaaS Asset Management.



  





**What you get** 



* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* Free access to beverages, snacks, gym facilities, on-site massage, shuffleboard, and other games.
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Join an ambitious and diverse team, and work with cutting-edge technology in the fastest-growing SAM software on the market.
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.



  





**At Xensam, our core values define our culture** 




**Rebellious** 
 : We encourage a spirit of freedom and initiative within responsibility.
 



**Humane** 
 : We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
 



**Harmonious** 
 : We promote work-life balance, creating a pleasant, supportive workplace.
 



 Ready to own our product story?
 **Apply now with your resume and a writing sample that showcases your ability to transform technical concepts into compelling narratives.** 




  





 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.

title: DevSecOps Manager
description:
About Kindred


Kindred Group is a digital entertainment pioneer bringing together nine successful online gambling brands, forming one of the largest online gambling groups in the world. Our purpose is to transform gambling by being a trusted source of entertainment that contributes positively to society. Our goal is that 0% revenue is derived from harmful gambling.



Our global team of more than 2000 people represents 70+ nationalities. When you join Kindred, you'll be part of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive team that has your best interest at heart. We are a trusting company that knows the value of a healthy work-life balance. We offer a wide range of benefits, along with annual bonus, which is tied to both company and your individual performance.


The role



As the DevSecOps Manager at Kindred Group, you will lead a team dedicated to securing both modern and traditional infrastructure. Your primary responsibility will be to create and implement the overarching DevSecOps strategy while ensuring governance and alignment with security best practices. You will be providing an enterprise support to all of our platforms. You will act as a key resource and support for all areas, driving security initiatives and ensuring robust protection across the groups platforms.



The DevSecOps team is part of Cyber Security, which also includes Product Security and Offensive Security. As manager, you will oversee security practices across the SDLC, cloud environments, CI/CD pipelines, and critical infrastructure, working closely with engineering and DevOps teams to integrate secure solutions throughout the development lifecycle.



Responsibilities


* DevSecOps Strategy & Governance: Develop and implement the overarching strategy for securing infrastructure, ensuring governance and adherence to security controls across all platforms.
* Platform Focus Areas: Provide group level strategic direction to DevSecOps specialists who focus on our specific platforms, while ensuring cross-platform collaboration when required.
* Cross-Platform Expertise: Ensure that DevSecOps specialists work across different platforms when their expertise is needed, such as in implementing new enterprise security tooling or policies.
* Infrastructure Security: Lead efforts to secure modern and traditional infrastructure, including Kubernetes, OpenStack, AWS, Docker, network, databases, and SDLC security.
* Pipeline & Tooling Security: Oversee the implementation and maintenance of security tooling within the development pipeline, for example Snyk, SonarQube, and Burp Suite Enterprise.
* Collaborative Security Initiatives: Partner with DevOps teams to assist with hands-on security implementations and develop security policies, for example as Kubernetes or AWS hardening.
* Security Awareness & Training: Promote a culture of security awareness through training and best practices, ensuring alignment with the latest DevSecOps standards.
* Team Leadership: Oversee day-to-day operations of the DevSecOps team, set objectives, and monitor key results to ensure successful project delivery.
* Resource & Budget Planning: Manage team resources, allocate budgets, and ensure efficient use of solutions and services within your scope.
* Performance & Development: Provide coaching, training, and performance feedback to team members, fostering their professional growth.

Requirements


* Experience:
	+ 5+ years of experience in security-related domains such as cloud security, infrastructure security, or Kubernetes security.
	+ 3+ years of experience managing a team, with a proven track record in driving security initiatives.
	+ Hands-on knowledge in securing cloud environments (AWS, OpenStack), modern infrastructure (Kubernetes, Docker), and traditional infrastructure (network, databases).
	+ Hands-on knowledge in securing the CI/CD and the SDLC.
	+ Familiarity with development/scripting experience (Java, Python, Bash).
	+ Familiarity with GenAI
* Technical Skills:
	+ Expertise in implementing security controls within the SDLC.
	+ Proficiency in cloud-native security tools and infrastructure-as-code.
* Communication & Leadership:
	+ Excellent communication skills, able to engage technical and non-technical stakeholders.
	+ Strong leadership abilities, able to coach and develop a high-performing team.
* Organizational Skills:
	+ Skilled in managing resources, setting objectives, and ensuring successful cross-platform collaboration.
	+ Ability to prioritize tasks, manage budgets, and make key decisions.
* Certifications:
	+ GCLD, GSEC, GCPN, GSCA, AWS Certified Security Specialist, or equivalent certifications.

LI-HYBRID #LI-ML1 #LI-MM1


Our Way Of Working


Our world is hybrid.



A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.


Application Process


Click on the “” button and complete the short web form. Please add your CV and covering letter in English to let us know your motivation for applying and your salary expectation. Our Talent Acquisition team will be in touch soon. Kindred is an equal opportunities employer committed to employing a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture. As such we oppose all forms of discrimination in the workplace. We create equal opportunities for all our applicants and will treat people equally regardless of and not limited to, gender, ages, disability, race, sexual orientation. We are committed not only to our legal obligations but also to the positive promotion that equal opportunities bring to our operations as set out in our sustainability framework. Kindred has an ESG rating of AAA by MCSI.

description:

title: Test Automation Engineer - Axis Video Management Systems
description:
Job Title
Test Automation Engineer - Axis Video Management Systems
Job Description*Are you a passionate Test Automation engineer who thinks creatively, prioritizes quality and has the ability to see the big picture in order to drive collective success? Do you want to have fun at work, be part of an innovative team working with the latest technology and be driven by product and customer perspectives? Do you enjoy being involved in planning, design, implementation, testing, feedback, and follow-up, all within a self-managing team where everyone’s voice is heard? Now you have the opportunity to join an exciting journey for Axis Video Management System at our HQ in Lund, Sweden.*  

Your future team  

In our teams, you will help drive the testing of Axis Video Management System (VMS), which connects end-users with our growing range of cameras, video recorders, cloud services, web and desktop. You will belong to a QA department, but on daily basis, we work closely together in small self-managing agile development teams responsible for the entire development cycle, which means we continuously exchange knowledge and contribute to each other’s development and continuous improvements. We make sure to stay at the forefront in terms of technology choices and test methodology, CI/CD flow, and we primarily develop in C# and Go.  

We seek data-driven decisions and continuously develop our ability to understand user behavior to learn more about how our products and solutions are used, which also gives the teams great opportunities to influence our products!  

What you’ll do here as a Test Automation Engineer  

We are now looking for an experienced and driven Test Automation engineer for one of our teams, focusing on cloud services and web development. As an important part of the team, you will work with developers and testers in order to secure the right quality throughout the development process, from feature analysis to production of cloud services offering and Axis Video Management Software.  

Tasks are focused on test development and execution, mainly through test automation. You take an active part in our DevOps pipeline as well as developing our capability to monitor, analyze and react to the status of our cloud services. As you are part of our QA community, you naturally share and learn best practices from your fellow QA colleagues.  

Who are you?  

We are looking for someone who has several years of experience in software automation testing and has good knowledge of agile development methods. You have a Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or other relevant work experience. You have previous experience with testing at different levels, manual and automated testing, functional and non-functional testing, and preferably experience with operation and monitoring of cloud services in Azure/AWS.  

We work with various tools/skills, in order of priority you have competence in several of these:* Test Automation development using C#, Go, .NET, Python and TypeScript
* Cloud competence in Azure / AWS, with ability to design and implement automated test solutions
* Hands-on experience with OTEL (OpenTelemetry) / Datadog
* DevOps in GitHub and TeamCity
* Security Testing
* Testing of individual components and larger systems
* Test strategies and methods
* Data and user-driven testing
* Driving the test 'agenda' in the team
* IP Networks

  

As a person, you are curious, quick to learn, and have a strong and genuine interest in testing. You enjoy developing with the team and the business, sharing experiences, and coaching developers in testing. You have the ability to understand the customer's perspective and to both see the big picture and dig into details when needed. You are responsible, proactive, structured, and driven by good collaboration with your development and testing colleagues to constantly develop together and improve.  

What Axis has to offer?  

With us, you will work with colleagues with expertise from various parts of the organization, which is enriching and facilitates knowledge sharing. There are also great opportunities for skill development and to develop in the direction you are interested in. At Axis Video Management Systems we also devote 10% of our time to work on your own projects, learn something new or to fix that bug that was never prioritized but you care about.  

You should enjoy working with us, and therefore we offer benefits such as flexible working hours, daily morning coffee, Friday cakes, a bonus program, wellness grants, health insurance, and a company bicycle, to name a few.  

We also provide a brand new training facility free for every Axis employee. You can see it here Axis HQ.  

We believe in sustainability, equality and inclusion Read more here
Axis is an organization that values creativity and promotes teamwork and openness. With us you will grow both personally and professionally. You will be part of a team of great colleagues that enjoy going to work in the morning.  

Curious to discover more?
We have a host of places where you can learn more about Axis, our products, solutions, company culture, and what working at Axis is really like.
Check out:
Life at Axis blog
Engineering at Axis blog
Innovation at Axis  

Ready to Act?
Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications.  

We go through applications continuously so don’t wait – send in your application today!  

If you have any questions, please reach out to recruiting manager, Kristian Larsen, at +46 46 761 75 46 46. *This recruitment is handled solely by Axis Communications AB, and we politely but firmly decline all calls from recruitment and consulting companies regarding this position.*
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-03-27*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 4500 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast

title: Teknisk testare
description:
**Vill du utveckla testautomation och kvalitetssäkra innovativa lösningar inom bank och finans? Bli en del av Skandia, Stockholm!**



Hos Skandia får du en central roll i att säkerställa kvaliteten på våra lösningar inom värdepappersaffären. Du kommer att arbeta med den senaste tekniken, driva testautomation och påverka utvecklingen av våra processer. Vi erbjuder en miljö där nytänkande, samarbete och kundfokus står i centrum – en arbetsplats där du verkligen kan göra skillnad.


**Vi erbjuder dig:**


* Ett kundägt företag där vi har samma intressen som våra kunder. Det innebär till exempel att vi tänker långsiktigt, oavsett om det är bra tider eller tider av osäkerhet.
* Uppskattade personalförmåner som försäkringar, förmånliga bolån, subventionerade luncher, gym på kontoret, utökad föräldraersättning
* En modern teknisk miljö med verktyg som bland annat Playwright, Bruno och Azure DevOps
* Ett nära samarbete med andra team och att vara del av de nätverk där vi tillsammans driver kvalitetsarbetet framåt


**Det här gör du hos oss:**

Teamets applikationer sträcker sig över hela stacken – frontend, backend och databaser – vilket ger dig en varierad och utvecklande arbetsdag. Du kommer bland annat:


* Automatisera och kvalitetssäkra testprocesser
* Bygga och vidareutveckla API-, prestanda-, smoke- och systemtester
* Skapa testdata och stötta affärssidan vid acceptanstester
* Arbeta både med manuella och automatiserade tester
* Delta i kravarbete och skapa testfall utifrån user stories


Du blir en del av ett agilt team på Skandia i Stockholm där du arbetar nära både utvecklare och inom värdepappersområdet . Här får du möjligheten att påverka och utveckla testautomation i en tekniskt avancerad miljö med stort fokus på kvalitet och innovation.



Kontoret ligger centralt beläget på Kungsholmen och möjlighet till distansarbete några dagar i veckan.


  
**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av testning och testautomation samt ett stort intresse för att förbättra testprocesser. Som person och kollega är du analytisk, noggrann med ett stort driv att utvecklas. Har du erfarenhet av verktyg som Playwright, Azure DevOps och Javascript/Typescript är det meriterande, men viktigast är din inställning och vilja att växa tillsammans med oss.



Vi använder oss av externpart för den här rekryteringen. Vid frågor kontakta Sofie Nordvall på Ada Digital: sofie.nordvall@adadigital.se



Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!


Vårdförsäkringar och hälsoförsäkring


Vår företagskultur styrs av engagemang


Balans i livet och ett bra friskvårdserbjudande


Förmånlig tjänstepension


Bidrar till att göra skillnad


Förmånlig ränta på bolån


Extra semesterdagar


3 flexibla lediga dagar varje år

title: Tester
DevOps Engineer
description:
We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our development team and play a key role in optimizing and maintaining our software delivery pipeline. This role is ideal for an individual who thrives in dynamic environments and enjoys collaborating with developers to ensure seamless deployment, testing, and continuous improvement of applications.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

– Work closely with a development team to ensure that applications and deployment pipelines align with business and operational requirements.
  
– Develop, enhance, and maintain automation scripts and features to streamline build, test, and deployment workflows.
  
– Proactively monitor system performance, troubleshoot operational interruptions, and resolve network connectivity or infrastructure-related issues.
  
– Collaborate with other DevOps team members to enhance pipeline performance, security, and scalability in line with best practices.
  
– Continuously research and integrate new technologies, tools, and methodologies to improve the efficiency and reliability of software deployment.
  
Required Qualifications & Skills
  
  

**To excel in this role, candidates should possess:**  

– ✔ Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines, including working knowledge of tools such as Jenkins, Maven, Gradle, Kubernetes, Vault, Bitbucket, Git, Artifactory, and SonarQube.
  
– ✔ Experience in software development with Java, ensuring a strong understanding of coding principles, debugging, and application deployment.
  
– ✔ Proficiency in scripting languages such as Bash, Python, Groovy, or Golang for process automation and system integrations.
  
– ✔ Strong familiarity with Linux/Unix-based systems and the ability to manage infrastructure efficiently.
  
– ✔ Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies, such as Docker, Rancher, K3S, and Kubernetes.
  
– ✔ Excellent problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail and troubleshooting capabilities in complex systems.
  
– ✔ Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to convey technical concepts to cross-functional teams.
  
– ✔ A team-oriented mindset, with the ability to collaborate effectively in an agile development environment.
  
Who Should Apply?
  
This role is ideal for self-motivated, detail-oriented individuals who have a passion for DevOps, automation, and continuous integration and delivery. If you enjoy working on cutting-edge software pipelines and take pride in delivering robust, scalable, and efficient deployment processes, we encourage you to apply!
  
About Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Test Automation Specialist
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*

 **Role:**

  

* Developing and maintaining automated test scripts to validate functionality, performance, and system integration.
* Implementing suitable test frameworks such as Selenium, JUnit, TestNG, or Pytest.
* Collaborating with developers, system managers, and stakeholders to define testing requirements and ensure coverage.
* Analyzing test results, identifying issues, and driving improvements.
* Continuously optimizing automated testing strategies in line with best practices and emerging technologies.

**Essential requirements:**

  

* You have proven experience in software development, with a strong foundation in Java, C#, or similar programming languages.
* Experience with test automation frameworks (e.g., Selenium, JUnit, TestNG, Pytest) and tools for CI/CD pipelines.
* Familiarity with testing methodologies, including functional, integration, and performance testing.
* Experience working with Lumera

  

**Meritorious:**

  

* Analytical and solution-oriented – You have a keen eye for detail and excel at identifying and solving problems.
* Clear and structured communicator – You adapt your communication style to different audiences, ensuring effective collaboration with both technical and non-technical teams.

  

**Last day to apply**: 03-03-2025

 **About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!  


  



**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior Test Manager
description:
**Role:**

  

* Interview and analyze the team (7-9 testers, along with 1 AC, 1 PO, and several developers) to understand the current state of the testing process.
* Identify gaps and areas for improvement in test strategy, working methods, and technology.
* Develop a transformation plan to streamline the testing process and introduce automation.
* Provide technical guidance on implementing Python-based test automation and modernizing the test environment.
* Assess the need for recruiting test developers with Python expertise.
* Report directly to the R&D Manager and CTO, presenting strategic recommendations.

**Essential requirements:**

  

* At least 8 years of experience in testing and test management in complex development environments.
* Experience in reviewing and improving test teams within large IT projects.
* Deep technical knowledge of test automation, particularly in Python and automation frameworks such as Robot Framework, Selenium, JMeter, and Postman
* Proven experience in change management and strategic improvement initiatives within testing.
* Ability to coach and interview testers and propose a competency development plan for the team.
* Experience in testing within agile environments (Scrum, SAFe, Kanban).
* Solid background in security testing and API testing.
* Experience with CI/CD and DevOps test automation in modern software development environments.
* Strong consultative skills to communicate effectively with both technical teams and management.

**Good to have:**  

Experience in AI-based test automation and predictive test models.
  

Previous work within the industry, banking/finance, or the public sector.  

Competence in IAM, authentication, and security testing (OWASP Top 10, CVSS, PKI, OAuth, LDAP, Certificate Management, SSO).  

  

**Please explain how you meet all the requirements** **when applying.**  

  

**Utilization****:** 100**%**  

**Location:** Landskrona  

**Period**: 10-03-2025-07-04-2025  

**Last day to apply**: 05-03-2025  

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Test Automation Engineer
description:
**Position Description:**
-------------------------


At CGI, you get the opportunity to be involved and make real changes. You get to create solutions together with our clients, which contributes to creating sustainable results for the society we live in. It can involve creating efficient and innovative solutions that help our clients deliver better service, increase their security or streamline their business.  

  

We are looking for talented individuals to join our growing Test practice in CGI Financial Services unit, in Stockholm. We specialize in Test Automation but also continuously evaluate the market. You will join a growing team of experts with various backgrounds and industry knowledge.


**Your future duties and responsibilities:**
--------------------------------------------


Working with us means a varied everyday life. We offer you the opportunity to develop as a consultant both in local customer deliveries and in major global commitments. You can work in small, short projects in a few months to large, long commitments. We participate in and run projects and commitments on site at our clients, but mainly from our local offices.  

  

We work both individually and together with other colleagues in our projects. Our assignments are carried out with the support of established methods and models based on industry standards.


**Required qualifications to be successful in this role:**
----------------------------------------------------------


We are looking for experts having knowledge in test automation. We will prioritize candidates have an academic degree on top of relevant work experiences and minimum 6 years experience as a Test Automation Engineer.  

  

Required Skills :  

Strong hands-on experience in designing and developing automation test cases using different automation frameworks.  

Proficiency in pipeline automation/Source Code Repositories like Azure DevOps, Bitbucket, GitHub and Jenkins.  

Experience with OOP scripting languages such as Java / C# / Python.  

Hands-on experience in any test automation tools like UiPath, Katalon etc.  

Knowledge in API test automation.  

  

**Test Automation Engineer**  

You come with extensive profiency in test automation, including the ability to design and execute the test scripts by your own and you are very effective in both written and verbal communication. We are looking for a candidate who can work with minimum mentorship and function well within a team, and is flexible, self-motivated, curious, and passionate about his role.  

  

**Want to know more?**  

We look forward to hearing from you! If there is still something you are wondering about, feel free to contact Vishal Khaparde, vishal.khaparde@cgi.com. Good Luck!  

  

**What you can expect fom us**  

CGI's combination of global and local presence, with offices in more than 28 locations in Sweden, provides satisfied clients and also means that you as an employee always have an office near you.  

  

At CGI, there are also great opportunities for internal career paths where you can choose to become a specialist in your field, broaden yourself in new areas or take a senior position. Through our internal networks, projects and commitments in global and national industries, we offer you competence development and committed leaders who support you in your development.  

  

**CGI**  

CGI is leading the digitalisation of Sweden and is a world leader in transforming innovation, information and technology. Through deep industry knowledge and an understanding of the client's challenges, we contribute insights to create sustainable results. We are located in 40 countries with 76,000 employees. In Sweden, our 4,000 employees are located in 30 locations with headquarters in Stockholm. Read more about CGI on our website: www.cgi.se.  

  

#LI-SNCE2


**What you can expect from us:**
--------------------------------


**Together, as owners, lets turn meaningful insights into action.**  

  

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, youll reach your full potential because  

  

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. Thats why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our companys strategy and direction.  

  

Your work creates value. Youll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.  

  

Youll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. Youll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.
  

  

Come join our teamone of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.
