title: Senior Site Reliability Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.** 




  





 We are looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) with a proven track record of driving reliability and scalability in dynamic, growth-oriented environments. In this central role, you will bring deep expertise to architect and implement resilient systems, mentor teams on operational excellence, and embed best practices across our infrastructure. Your experience in navigating similar journeys will be instrumental as we elevate our cloud platforms, enhance observability, and set new benchmarks for scalability and performance. Join us in building a world-class, robust infrastructure for the future!
 



  





**How You Will Make An Impact** 



* Champion a Platform Engineering mindset: Developers own their own infrastructure, and we provide the tooling and platform to make it effortless.
* Architect and build scalable, resilient, and observable infrastructure, working closely with development teams to enable seamless delivery and robust testing.
* Foster a collaborative environment through code reviews, pair programming, and mob programming.
* Lead Kubernetes and container management, simplifying operations, optimizing performance, and promoting best practices.
* Coach engineering teams on cloud-native principles, promoting continuous learning and knowledge sharing.



  





**What We're Looking For** 



* Platform Engineering: Play a key role in creating a developer-first platform that streamlines workflows and accelerates productivity.
* Product mindset: Track record of building great products with a user-centric approach to technology choices.
* Architectural knowledge: Deep understanding of modern web architectures, system design, and engineering principles for building scalable and reliable platforms.
* Cloud Native: We are fully cloud-native in GCP (Google Cloud Platform), running our services on GKE with managed databases. Hands-on experience with GCP and managing multiple Kubernetes clusters is essential.
* Observability skills: Expertise in troubleshooting distributed systems, building dashboards (e.g., Grafana), and instrumenting metrics, logs, and traces for monitoring and performance analysis.
* CI/CD proficiency: Strong experience with CI/CD and GitOps operational frameworks. We use GitHub Actions, ArgoCD, and manage all our infrastructure as code using terraform.
* Programming skills: Strong programming skills in Go or Typescript, the primary languages used within our team.
* Mentorship: Experience in mentoring and guiding engineering teams, promoting operational excellence through documentation and best practices.



  





**It would also be music to our ears if you have** 



* Experience with Progressive Delivery and Canary Releases using tools like Argo Rollouts.
* Expertise in managing an Observability stack (We run Thanos, OpenTelemetry with Grafana Tempo, Loki, Grafana, Prometheus).
* Proficiency in defining and tracking Service Level Objectives (SLOs) and Service Level Indicators (SLIs) to enhance system reliability.



  





**Equal Opportunity Employer** 




 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
 



  





**Application** 




 Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
 



  





 We embrace a hybrid work setup that offers the freedom and flexibility to balance your personal and professional life. At the same time, we value the collaboration, creativity, and connection that comes from spending the majority of our time together in the office. This approach allows us to innovate as a team while giving you the autonomy to work in a way that suits you best.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Stillfront is a global gaming company. We develop a wide range of digital games that attract over 50 million players each month. From well-established franchises like Supremacy, Big Farm, and BitLife to niche games, we span many different genres, including strategy, simulation, RPG and action, and casual and mash-up games.
 



 We believe gaming can be a force for good. And we want to create a gaming universe that is digital, affordable, equal, and sustainable. So, we focus on developing games that are all about having a rewarding hobby, a great social experience, or a strategic challenge.
 



 Serial entrepreneur, Jörgen Larsson, founded the company in 2010, and since then, we’ve grown rapidly. Our professionals thrive in an organization that embodies the spirit of entrepreneurship. And we’re proud to connect and empower game teams around the world through our operational platform, Stillops.
 



 Our HQ is in Stockholm, Sweden, but our game development is done by teams and studios all over the world. Our main markets are the US, Japan, MENA, Germany, and the UK. We’re proud that our company shares are listed on the Nasdaq Stockholm Large Cap.
 



  





  





 We are looking for a
 **Senior DevOps Engineer (all genders)** 
 with experience working with a heavily distributed and senior engineering group to join our IT Hub to support DevOps and engineering projects across the
 **Stillfront** 
 group.
 



 Stillfront’s
 **IT Hub** 
 is a multi-disciplinary department, paving the road for the rest of the group by providing technological solutions and engineering guidance.
 



  





**YOUR MISSION** 




  




* Lead the design and implementation of DevOps across IT Hub projects
* Lead by example best practices to team and game studios/franchises
* Contribute to player delight by reducing complexity and technical debt
* Identify and action opportunities to reduce cost
* Coordinate and collaborate with a talented network of engineers at each studio/franchise
* Be inquisitive about current DevOps strategies and eager to evaluate alternatives



  





**YOUR BACKSTORY** 




  




* 5+ years of professional experience in DevOps with high interest in gaming
* Comfortable being a first responder to infrastructure issues
* Bachelor degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
* Well-acquainted with AWS, but also experienced with GCP, Azure, and even on-premise infrastructure
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines and with common development tools and practices, including Python environments
* Hands-on experience building infrastructure from the ground up with Infrastructure-as-a-Service tools like Terraform or Pulumi
* Experience architecting and managing applications at scale using Kubernetes
* Experience with Git, with bonus points for experience converting codebases from competing version control systems into Git
* Passion for monitoring and logging with tools like Grafana and Kibana
* Eye for security and data privacy both from a policy perspective and practical engineering tooling
* Fluent English, both verbal and written



  





**SOUNDS GREAT? MORE REASONS TO TAKE THIS MISSION** 




  




* Work from one of our modern offices around the world
* Opportunity to define and build the culture of a team
* Work with an international team and in close collaboration with 22 game studios
* Participate in a broad range of projects from IT, to data science, finance, and analytics
* Build a team culture from the ground up folding best practices as needed
* Flexible work schedule that embraces the fact we all are in different parts of the world
* Unique opportunities to travel and connect in person with the entire team and group

title: Platform Engineer - Kubernetes / Openshift
description:
*Är du en erfaren Platform Engineer med djup kunskap inom Kubernetes och OpenShift? Vill du vara med och vidareutveckla en robust, säker och skalbar containerplattform? Då kan du vara den vi söker!*
**Om jobbet**
 Vi söker nu en Platform Engineer till vårt team på Länsförsäkringar AB. I rollen kommer du att arbeta med drift, utveckling och automation av vår containerplattform byggd på OpenShift. Du kommer att spela en central roll i att säkerställa en stabil och effektiv plattform för utvecklingsteam och applikationsdrift.
   

  

 Som Platform Engineer kommer du att:
   

  

* Underhålla och vidareutveckla vår Kubernetes/Openshift-baserade containerplattform
* Arbeta med CI/CD-pipelines och GitOps för att förenkla och automatisera deployment och drift
* Samarbeta med utvecklare och arkitekter för att optimera plattformens prestanda och säkerhet
* Stötta med expertis i incident- och felsökningsarbete
* Arbeta med att utöka vår on-prem installation till molnet, med fokus på ARO (Azure Red Hat OpenShift) och ROSA (Red Hat OpenShift Service på AWS)
* Arbeta med onboarding och utbildning av våra DevOps-team för att säkerställa att de effektivt kan använda plattformen


**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av Kubernetes och containerorkestrering
* Erfarenhet av OpenShift och dess ekosystem (ARO och/eller ROSA är meriterande)
* Kunskap om CI/CD-pipelines, GitOps och automation
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i molnmiljöer, gärna Azure
* Grundläggande förståelse för nätverk, lagring och säkerhet i Kubernetes-miljöer
* Vana vid att arbeta i agila team och en DevOps-orienterad kultur


 Meriterande är även:
   

  

* Kunskap inom observability-verktyg
* Erfarenhet av infrastrukturell automation med verktyg som Terraform eller Ansible


 Som person är du lösningsorienterad, nyfiken och har en stark vilja att automatisera och förbättra arbetsflöden. Du trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team och har en kommunikativ och samarbetsinriktad inställning.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Välkommen till Containerteamet på Länsförsäkringar AB! Vi jobbar med modern plattform i framkant gällande både Kubernetes, container, monitorering med mera. Vi befinner oss på en spännande resa där vi ser ett stort verksamhetsfokus på denna typ av DevOps-plattform. Då vi genomför 3 rekryteringar samtidigt kommer du få vara med och sätta mycket av hur denna grupp kommer att agera och uppfattas, och vi ser det som en stor möjlighet för rätt personer.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-17**

title: DevSecOps Manager
description:
**The role**
 As the DevSecOps Manager at Kindred Group, you will lead a team dedicated to securing both modern and traditional infrastructure. Your primary responsibility will be to create and implement the overarching DevSecOps strategy while ensuring governance and alignment with security best practices. You will be providing an enterprise support to all of our platforms. You will act as a key resource and support for all areas, driving security initiatives and ensuring robust protection across the groups platforms.
   

  

 The DevSecOps team is part of Cyber Security, which also includes Product Security and Offensive Security. As manager, you will oversee security practices across the SDLC, cloud environments, CI/CD pipelines, and critical infrastructure, working closely with engineering and DevOps teams to integrate secure solutions throughout the development lifecycle.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* DevSecOps Strategy & Governance: Develop and implement the overarching strategy for securing infrastructure, ensuring governance and adherence to security controls across all platforms.
* Platform Focus Areas: Provide group level strategic direction to DevSecOps specialists who focus on our specific platforms, while ensuring cross-platform collaboration when required.
* Cross-Platform Expertise: Ensure that DevSecOps specialists work across different platforms when their expertise is needed, such as in implementing new enterprise security tooling or policies.
* Infrastructure Security: Lead efforts to secure modern and traditional infrastructure, including Kubernetes, OpenStack, AWS, Docker, network, databases, and SDLC security.
* Pipeline & Tooling Security: Oversee the implementation and maintenance of security tooling within the development pipeline, for example Snyk, SonarQube, and Burp Suite Enterprise.
* Collaborative Security Initiatives: Partner with DevOps teams to assist with hands-on security implementations and develop security policies, for example as Kubernetes or AWS hardening.
* Security Awareness & Training: Promote a culture of security awareness through training and best practices, ensuring alignment with the latest DevSecOps standards.
* Team Leadership: Oversee day-to-day operations of the DevSecOps team, set objectives, and monitor key results to ensure successful project delivery.
* Resource & Budget Planning: Manage team resources, allocate budgets, and ensure efficient use of solutions and services within your scope.
* Performance & Development: Provide coaching, training, and performance feedback to team members, fostering their professional growth.


****Requirements****
  

  

* Experience:
+ 5+ years of experience in security-related domains such as cloud security, infrastructure security, or Kubernetes security.
+ 3+ years of experience managing a team, with a proven track record in driving security initiatives.
+ Hands-on knowledge in securing cloud environments (AWS, OpenStack), modern infrastructure (Kubernetes, Docker), and traditional infrastructure (network, databases).
+ Hands-on knowledge in securing the CI/CD and the SDLC.
+ Familiarity with development/scripting experience (Java, Python, Bash).
+ Familiarity with GenAI

* Technical Skills:
+ Expertise in implementing security controls within the SDLC.
+ Proficiency in cloud-native security tools and infrastructure-as-code.

* Communication & Leadership:
+ Excellent communication skills, able to engage technical and non-technical stakeholders.
+ Strong leadership abilities, able to coach and develop a high-performing team.

* Organizational Skills:
+ Skilled in managing resources, setting objectives, and ensuring successful cross-platform collaboration.
+ Ability to prioritize tasks, manage budgets, and make key decisions.

* Certifications:
+ GCLD, GSEC, GCPN, GSCA, AWS Certified Security Specialist, or equivalent certifications.


 LI-HYBRID

title: Test Engineer -  B2B self service solutions.
description:
**🚀 Join Our Team VIPAS AB as a Test Engineer 🚀
   

  

 Do you have what it takes to thrive in the vibrant world of IT consulting? VIPAS AB, a burgeoning company, proudly invites you to embark on your next engaging project as our**
**About VIPAS**
 Imagine a world where your business technology perfectly aligns with your goals—efficient, scalable, and innovative. At VIPAS AB, that’s exactly what we strive to create. As an IT consulting company, we don’t just offer services; we deliver tailored solutions using cutting-edge technologies like Java and Python. Our team is well-versed in software development, DevOps, and engineering, bringing years of experience and expertise. Think of us as your trusted guide, leading your organization through the landscape of modern tech adoption, ensuring every step is taken with confidence and foresight.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are looking for a highly skilled
 **Test Engineer** 
 to join our team and play a key role in ensuring the quality of our
 **B2B self-service solutions** 
 . The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with
 **web testing, end-to-end (E2E) testing, test automation, and API testing using Postman**

 processes will be highly beneficial.

title: Platform Engineer
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**Join the Pioneers**
 At the outset of our journey, we're not just building software; we're laying the groundwork for our technology solutions and how we’ll operate as an engineering team. As we expand, the organisation of our teams and the specialisation into product areas hinge on these formative decisions. Coming on board now means you're not just coding — you're contributing directly to how we set ourselves up for success, how we tackle challenges, and how we define our engineering culture. This isn’t just a job; it's a chance to leave an indelible mark on our technology, teams, culture, and ethos.
   

  

**What You'll Tackle**
* Build and design the foundational infrastructure for other engineering teams and customers to build on. Our team is responsible for automating the provisioning and setup of evroc's platform to ensure speed, reliability, and scalability.
* Create Infrastructure-as-Code deployments and large scale cluster configurations for managing our networking, storage, and compute resources.
* Seamlessly integrate and upkeep open-source components within our evolving tech stack.
* Team up with fellow engineers to craft tailored solutions meeting our unique challenges.
* Forge and refine tools that power team efficiency - this includes CI/CD, local development setups, build toolchains, and essential infrastructure.
* Plot the roadmap for software component development, aligning with team priorities and vision.
* Lead the charge in defining and achieving our technical benchmarks.


**Skills We Value**
* Proficiency in distributed systems and Linux systems engineering.
* Strong understanding of various infrastructure technologies, including virtualization, containerization, and cloud computing.
* Coding in programming languages such as (but not exclusively) Golang or Rust.
* Experience in building and enhancing compute, storage, and data platforms with exposure to open source products like Kubernetes, Knative, Ceph, Rook and the like.
* Hands-on with infrastructure-as-code tools and automation, such as Terraform, Ansible, or Helm.
* Familiarity with software build processes and secure supply systems, like OpenSSF.
* Strong problem-solving and communication skills to effectively address complex platform engineering challenges.


 We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.
   

  

 Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: Data Scientist till Data och Analys
description:
***Var med och driv innovation och frigör kraften i SJs data. Genom traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI kan du skapa betydande affärsvärde och forma framtiden för SJ!***




  





 Vi söker dig som brinner för att förvandla data till insikter och möjligheter. Hos oss får du chansen att forma framtiden som en del av vår resa mot att bli ännu mer datadrivna. Du kommer att utforska, identifiera och frigöra potentialen i SJs data över hela verksamheten med hjälp av traditionell BI, avancerad analys, maskininlärning och AI. Rollen är en nyckel i att skapa värde och innovation som verkligen gör skillnad – både för SJ och våra kunder.
 



  





 SJs övergripande mål är att bidra till Skandinaviens tillväxt- och klimatmål genom att leverera 50% mer resor till 2030. För att kunna realisera denna tillväxtresa gör vi historiska investeringar på 19 miljarder i nya snabbtåg, nya regionaltåg och uppgraderingar av vår befintliga fordonsflotta.
 



 Som en viktig del av vår spännande resa satsar vi också på vår förmåga att skapa värde genom användning av data och analys. Enheten Data & Analys etablerades 2023 och ska nu skala upp förmågan för att kunna leverera brett inom koncernen. Förmågan är viktig för att framtidssäkra verksamheten och maximera nyttan från större investeringar, inte bara på fordonssidan, utan även i nya IT-system för bland annat boknings- och säljsystem, personalplanering, operativ trafikledning och intelligent fordonsunderhåll.
 



  





  





**Din kommande roll** 




 Som Data Scientist blir du en central del av vårt nybildade team Data & Analys. Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas i en roll där du kommer att:
 



  




* Driva spännande projekt från idéstadiet till färdig lösning, med direkt påverkan på företagets framgång
* Arbeta med hela datahanteringsprocessen, inklusive insamling, förberedelse, modellering och visualisering av data
* Implementera innovativa lösningar i produktionsmiljöer och hantera stora datamängder för att upptäcka värdefulla insikter
* Kommunicera dina fynd till olika intressenter och hjälpa till att omvandla tekniska insikter till konkreta affärsstrategier
* Utforska och experimentera med modern teknik för att förbättra våra processer. Du kommer balansera snabb experimentell utveckling med skapandet av strukturerad och underhållsbar kod för produktion



  





 Enheten Data & Analys är en del av Ekonomifunktionen och arbetar tillsammans med IT-divisionen, samt nära med Strategi & Verksamhetsutveckling och Business Control som båda återfinns inom Ekonomi.
 



  










**Förväntningar på den vi söker** 



* En akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, statistik, matematik, fysik eller liknande område
* Stark programmeringskompetens i Python och SQL
* Erfarenhet av molnbaserade miljöer; kunskap om Azure Databricks är ett stort plus
* Förståelse för agila arbetsmetoder och moderna utvecklingsprinciper som DevOps och CI/CD
* En analytisk och nyfiken natur, med en passion för att lösa komplexa problem
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmåga att göra tekniska koncept begripliga för icke-tekniska intressenter
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift
* Meriterande är erfarenheter av prediktivt underhåll



  





  





**Ansökan och information** 




 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar SJ med Jefferson Wells och Experis. Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta ansvariga rekryteringskonsulter Malin Magnusson, 076-7806864, malin.magnusson@jeffersonwells.se, och Anki Snis, 0703-775969, anki.snis@se.experis.com
 ***.***




  





 Urval sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast den 15 mars 2025.
 



  





  





***Om SJ AB***




 SJ är ett svenskt reseföretag som erbjuder hållbara tågresor i egen regi och i samarbete med andra. SJ är ett av Sveriges grönaste varumärken och en del av lösningen för att klimatmålen ska nås. Koncernens drygt 6 600 medarbetare i Sverige och Norge bidrar alla till ökat tågresande – SJ för Sverige framåt.

title: Senior IAM Engineer| SEB, Solna
description:
Are you passionate about new technology and making a difference? Join our digital transformation!
   

  

 The IAM Platform team is now looking for their new team member. The team consists of about 4 people. We work closely together and share the passion for great technology and creating a smooth engineering experience. Our group consists of people with different expertise, experiences, age and background. We have an open and friendly approach towards each other.
   

  

**About the role:**
 At this position within Hosting & Integration, you will be a part of a highly skilled team working with modern technology, security and developing of the IAM platforms, which are integrated in SEB DevOps toolchains. As a senior IAM Engineer you will create and evolve our IAM platform by investigating, developing, and implementing different technical solutions. This area is highly prioritized which creates many collaborations with various parts of the SEB organization. You will also be involved in SEB cloud journey.
   

  

 Your tasks will include designing, implementing and managing IAM solutions, deploying and managing the IAM Infrastructure, troubleshooting and resolving issues, ensuring compliance with security policies and best practices. In this role you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve the overall security posture of the organisation
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
* Extensive experience on identity federation technology (OpenID Connect, OAuth2).
* Extensive experience with Single Sign-On and Multi Factor Authentication solution (FIDO2).
* Hands on experience with the DevSecOps tools (e.g. managing platforms with Kubernetes, Git, Github actions).
* Experience of programming languages, such as Python, Java, go and Javascript.
* Hands on experience with different cloud platforms.
* Attention to Detail
* CriticalThinking


**What we offer:**
* Agile and modern ways of working
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Extensive training and learning opportunities


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 10th of Mars 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Anton Hänni via email at anton.hanni@seb.se
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB here** 
 : www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Infrastructure Lead
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is a critical part of our platform strategy. As a leader of the SRE team, you will focus on guiding your team in providing technical expertise and support to our engineering teams to enable them to deliver high-quality software solutions efficiently.
   

  

 Your team will be responsible for providing continuous support to other departments, overcoming major technical hurdles, improving performance , implementing system monitoring and building highly available software.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Providing support and leadership for our SRE team to solve operational challenges.
* Managing the assignment of tasks for the team according to priorities and capacity.
* Having a positive attitude and the ability to understand the critical urgency of topics and strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ensuring non-functional requirements for all applications and tools are met and clearly communicated.
* Providing counsel to our internal software engineering team and proactively suggesting improvements on how to operate our microservice-based solution.
* Provide informal feedback on an ongoing basis and formal feedback in the annual performance evaluation process to identify and develop talent.
* Coaching Payments Product team members in achieving goals and developing necessary skills.
* Organise team trainings and initiatives.
* Identify team goals and evaluate team progress.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

**Essential Skills**
* Minimum 5 years of software engineering or devops experience.
* Minimum 2 years of experience as a team lead or manager.
* Practical experience in using common cloud APIs.
* Strong knowledge of Linux and shell scripting, as well as higher level protocols and patterns like HTTP/3, REST, JSON and gRPC.
* Expertise in systems integration and distributed large scale microservice deployments.
* Experience in operating and monitoring container workloads and similar technologies.
* Strong code reading and understanding skills with at least one high level programming language


 NICE TO HAVES
   

  

* Experience from the iGaming industry is meriting


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy.
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply).
* 30 annual vacation days.
* Occupational Pension.
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually.
* Parental Leave Top-Up.
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner.
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance.
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts.
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

* As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**
**We are looking for Senior Backend Engineers**
 The Payments Team is focused on enhancing seamless payment experiences and subscription management while tackling the challenge of migrating from a legacy monolithic to an event-driven architecture. Through collaboration across engineering, product management, and stakeholders, we aim to optimize user journeys and drive Epidemic Sound’s growth.
   

  

 As a team, we value open collaboration, tackling complex technical challenges together, and sharing knowledge through pair and mob programming as well as regular hack weeks. Your insights will shape and influence the team’s roadmap, so we're looking for someone who thrives in a dynamic environment and embraces uncertainty.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Develop and maintain high-performance backend systems with a focus on payment and subscription services
* Design and implement REST APIs and microservices using Kotlin (Ktor) or Python (FastAPI), ensuring scalability and reliability
* Collaborate with frontend engineers, product managers, and data teams to create cohesive, impactful solutions
* Champion best practices in CI/CD, DevOps, and testing, leveraging tools like Kubernetes and Google Cloud Platform (GCP) for robust deployment pipelines
* Drive experimentation through A/B testing and growth-focused methodologies to iteratively improve user engagement and experience


**Who You Are**
* System Design Expertise: You have a solid understanding of system design principles and distributed architecture, enabling you to build scalable and reliable backend services
* Experienced Developer: You bring 5+ years of experience in backend development with expertise in Java with Kotlin or Python
* DevOps Knowledge: Familiarity with Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or AWS


**Nice to Have:**
* Go
* Terraform


**Soft Skills**
* Adaptability: Quickly adjust to changing priorities and evolving technologies in a fast-paced scaleup environment
* Collaboration: Strong teamwork abilities for effective cross-functional engagement and knowledge sharing
* Problem-Solving Mindset: Proactively identify challenges and devise innovative solutions to drive progress and improve processes


**Equal Opportunity Employer:**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Systemutvecklare till Sogeti Stockholm
description:
**Vi söker nu systemutvecklare som vill vara med och bygga både nya molnbaserade lösningar och förbättra befintliga system.**
 I rollen som systemutvecklare hos oss kommer du att arbeta i en spännande och dynamisk miljö där innovation och teknisk utveckling står i fokus. Som systemutvecklare inom molnet kommer du att designa, utveckla och implementera molnbaserade lösningar, där du skriver och underhåller kod samt bidrar till att automatisera och effektivisera arbetsflöden. Du kommer att arbeta med att utveckla skalbara och säkra molnmiljöer och delta i både nyutveckling och förbättring av befintliga system. Tillsammans med teamet löser du komplexa problem och säkerställer att lösningar möter verksamhetens krav på funktionalitet och kvalitet.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Minst 5 år relevant erfarenhet som utvecklare
* God erfarenhet av Azure och molnbaserad utveckling samt erfarenhet av utveckling i C# och/eller Java.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Kubernetes och Docker för containerorkestrering och Terraform, ARM eller Bicep för infrastruktur som kod.
* Kunskap och praktisk erfarenhet av CI/CD-pipelines och automatisering med Azure DevOps, GitHub, Jenkins eller Ansible.
* Förmåga att kommunicera effektivt på både svenska och engelska, med intressenter från olika delar av organisationen.


**Vi Tror Att Du Är**
* En problemlösare med stark analytisk förmåga och en passion för teknik.
* Van vid att arbeta både självständigt och som en del av ett team.
* Strukturerad och noggrann, med ett starkt driv att leverera högkvalitativa lösningar.


 ,
   

  

**Nyfiken på fler anledningar till att jobba hos oss? Kika in här:**
* Ditt Sogeti - Lär känna din framtida arbetsgivare!
* Dina förmåner - Få koll på vad vi erbjuder våra medarbetare!
* Medarbetarnöjdhet - Hur betygsätter våra egna sogetiare livet hos oss?


**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande.
   

  

 Hoppas vi ses!
   

  

 /Team Manager, Simon Karlsson

title: Är du data scientist och vill vara med på vår digitaliseringsresa?
description:
Vill du vara med och utveckla Finansinspektionens (FI:s) förmåga att arbeta med analyser av granulära datamängder och datainsamling. Kom till oss på FI och bidra med din kompetens!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som data scientist arbetar du med fokus på att utveckla, implementera och kommunicera aktiviteter inom bland annat avancerad analys av granulära datamängder. Du tillhör enheten Datainnovation på avdelning Utveckling som har ett övergripande ansvar för att leda och samordna FI:s dataleverans med digitalisering, innovation och verksamhetsnytta i fokus. Vi arbetar i hög utsträckning med utvecklande effektiviserande förändringsaktiviteter och utifrån ett agilt arbetssätt.
   

  

 Du arbetar i ett nybildat tvärfunktionellt team i tät samverkan med behovsägare på FI. Teamet du ingår i arbetar för att möjliggöra datainsamling och analyser av granulär data från interna och externa källor, publika API och inköpt data.
   

  

 Detta innebär att du kommer vara med i arbetet att utveckla FI:s förmåga att arbeta med att ta fram värdeskapande analyslösningar för stora datamängder. I arbetet ingår det att utveckla, koordinera och implementera machine learning modeller, samt att utveckla och implementera nya metoder för avancerad analys. Du kommer dessutom kommunicera och presentera analyslösningar för interna intressenter och behovsägare.
   

  

**Din utbildning och erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* har akademisk examen inom teknisk fysik, matematik, statistik, datavetenskap eller motsvarande kunskaper förvärvade på annat sätt
* har några års erfarenhet i rollen som data scientist
* har goda kunskaper i programmeringsspråk Python
* har erfarenhet av SQL och arbete med stora datamängder
* har erfarenhet av att utveckla, implementera och dokumentera machine learning modeller
* uttrycker dig väl på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


 Det är meriterande om du
   

  

* har erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt
* har erfarenhet av Suptech
* har erfarenhet av finansiell sektor och av att arbeta med finansiella data
* har erfarenhet av att skala upp innovativa lösningar
* har erfarenhet av att produktionssätta analyslösningar genom pipelines, exempelvis med hjälp av Azure DevOps eller GitLab CI/CD
* har erfarenhet av att leda projekt eller produktutveckling
* har erfarenhet av kravställning.


**Om dig**
 I det här jobbet behöver du
   

  

* bidra till ett gott samarbete
* ha en god analytisk förmåga och kunna lösa komplexa uppgifter
* ta egna initiativ
* se framåt och planera ditt arbete utifrån långsiktiga mål.


**Om oss**
 FI bidrar till ett stabilt finansiellt system, välfungerande marknader, en hållbar utveckling och ett högt skydd för konsumenter. Vi erbjuder dig att arbeta med samhällsviktiga uppgifter, där du är med och påverkar den finansiella marknaden.
   

  

 På FI arbetar cirka 600 personer och våra värderingar präglas av att vi är engagerade, beslutsamma, målinriktade och hjälpsamma. Vår arbetsplats ligger centralt i Stockholm. Det finns även möjlighet att delvis arbeta på distans. För mer information om vår organisation: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/organisation/
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Vi baserar vår rekrytering på kompetens. Det innebär att vi noggrant definierar vilka kvalifikationer som efterfrågas och sedan utgår från dem genom hela rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Vi arbetar aktivt för mångfald och likabehandling och välkomnar därför medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 På FI arbetar vi aktivt för att vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare där du som medarbetare trivs och utvecklas. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på FI och vad vi erbjuder: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/lediga-jobb/vi-erbjuder/
   

  

 En anställning på FI kan innebära att säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll görs enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

**Sök jobbet**
 Välkommen med din ansökan som ska innehålla cv och relevanta intyg eller examensbevis. Vi använder urvalsfrågor för en objektiv bedömning på lika villkor och du kan på så vis enkelt söka tjänsten.
   

  

 Vi avböjer all hjälp med rekrytering och annonsering.
   

  

**Anställningsform:**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Omfattning:**
 Heltid
   

  

**Kontaktperson:**
 Sesselía Árnadóttir, enhetschef, 08-408 984 47
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:**
 2025-03-17

title: Power Platform Architect
description:
Unlock the potential of Power Platform as a visionary engineer, transforming challenges into cutting-edge solutions. Embrace continuous learning and collaborate with global teams to shape the future of technology-driven excellence. Join us at Avanade, where creativity, innovation, and career growth thrive.
   

  

**Come join us**
 Are you a visionary Power Platform Engineer with a track record of designing and implementing cutting-edge solutions? You thrive on transforming business challenges into powerful automated solutions, and your attention to detail sets you apart. Embrace your passion for continuous learning and seize the opportunity to deliver top-tier results under pressure. Join us as we shape the future with technology-driven excellence!
 **Together we do what matters.**
**Skills And Experiences**
 You have previous and solid experience with:
   

  

* Designing and developing Power Automate flows.
* Applying strong business analysis methodology and requirements-gathering skills.
* Implementing agile development practices.
* Showing a critical thinking problem-solving and troubleshooting skills approach.
* Creating, analyzing, and visualizing data with Power BI.
* Using Dataverse with Power Platform solutions.
* Securing apps and data with the latest and most robust techniques.


**About You**
 You’re a natural communicator who wants to help our partners on their Power Platform implementation journey. You will help improve employee mobility, efficiency, teamwork, and security demonstrating your experience in Microsoft 365 suite. Your interpersonal and communication skills help technical and non-technical clients engage with often complex information.
   

  

**Characteristics That Can Spell Success For This Role Are**
* Embrace challenges with a keen intellect and a thirst for knowledge.
* Collaborate seamlessly, fostering open and effective communication.
* Embrace creativity and explore groundbreaking solutions.
* Stay ahead of the curve, anticipating what lies ahead and adapting to the latest advancements.


**What You'll Do**
 As a Power Platform Architect, your focus is on Power Platform solutions within the Workplace services field. Day to day you will design and develop Power Platform applications to meet client requirements. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams under challenging circumstances to deliver high-quality solutions. You will apply your expertise in the Power Platform and Microsoft 365 suite of products translating business requirements into technical deliverables, estimating and managing timing, workforce and demand supply process, and addressing task backlog as well as unit testing phasis for continuous improvement of client solutions. You will share best practices for Power Platform solutions with global Avanade team members and attend partner events for knowledge and delivery model sharing.
   

  

**Learn more**
 To learn more about the types of projects our Modern Workplace team works on check out these case studies:
   

  

* Why now is the time to modernize your communications capabilities
* Workplace experience: Why evergreen is everything


 Interested in knowing what’s going on inside Avanade? Check out our blogs:
   

  

* Avanade Insights – exchange ideas that drive tomorrow’s innovation
* Inside Avanade – explore what life is like working at Avanade


**Enjoy your career**
 Some of the best things about working at Avanade
   

  

* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year, with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
* Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth
* Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you


  

  

 Find out more about some of our benefits Employee Benefits at Avanade | Avanade
   

  

**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!
   

  

 We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page.
   

  

  

  

 Create a future for our people that focuses on
   

  

* Expanding your thinking
* Experimenting courageously
* Learning and pivoting


  

  

 Inspire greatness in our people by
   

  

* Empowering every voice
* Encouraging boldness
* Celebrating progress


  

  

 Accelerate the impact of our people by
   

  

* Amazing the client
* Prioritizing what matters
* Acting as one

title: Rendering Engineer – Streamed Open World
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media, Spectator Sports, and Entertainment Providers
description:
**The chance to deliver a visually impressive gaming experience that reaches players on multiple platforms!** 




  





**WANT TO REVOLUTIONIZE GOLF?** 




  





**Our mission** 
 is to help people enjoy the wonderful game of golf even more by developing tracing technology for TV and gamification to ranges. Our product brings people together and encourages them to get active which enables a healthier lifestyle. Our range technology is used globally and millions of people spend their quality time bonding and playing with their family and friends. Our broadcast technology is aired worldwide and makes the tournaments really enjoyable for the TV viewers. ⛳️ 📺 🎥
 



  





**At our new office** 
 , you can expect to meet humble, helpful and driven colleagues. You will join an organization where everyone has a voice and can make an impact. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to something meaningful as we undergo exciting changes and growth. We are committed to creating an environment where you can grow professionally and individually. As well as creating a social work environment by creating fun activities like morning fika, gym sessions, mob programming, after-work, table tennis, and golf simulator sessions to name a few! 🥳 🏓 ☕️
 



  





**We are proud** 
 to be on a journey where we're focused on helping people worldwide improve their golf game which leads to healthy, active and social lifestyles. All of our products are developed, tested and deployed from our newly renovated R&D office in Stockholm, Sweden. Join us at Toptracer Technologies and be part of a team dedicated to creating positive change through technology and innovation! 🚀 💻 💙
 



  





**THE ROLE** 




 We are looking for a driven and versatile Rendering Engineer who wants to join us in developing our streamed open-world solution for a golf game. In this role, you will work on everything from building internal tools and pipelines to optimizing rendering and creating high-quality experiences on multiple platforms (Linux, iOS and Windows). You will be part of a team where we combine creative ideas with technical expertise to deliver a seamless and visually impressive gaming experience.
 



  





**Uniqueness of this role** 



* Opportunity to influence and shape an advanced open-world streaming solution.
* Varied tasks that combine rendering, pipeline, tooling, and system development.
* Collaboration in a creative and non-prestige team where all voices matter.
* The chance to deliver a visually impressive gaming experience that reaches players on multiple platforms.
* Fixed hardware as main target (monitor) - you know exactly what you are testing against and can therefore create an optimal product
* The main platforms are Linux, iOS and Android
* Streamed open-world renderer
* We use a method that means we render in real time
* Creative problem solving
* Work more broadly, not a niche role



  





**POSSIBILITIES** 



* Rendering & Optimization: Work with shaders (e.g. custom PBR), forward rendering and runtime terrain rendering to maximize performance and maintain high graphic quality.
* Pipeline Development & Automation: Develop and maintain tools that transform edit scenes into optimized runtime scenes, including handling prefabs and asset packing (e.g. with Unity Addressables).
* System & Tool Development: Create and improve internal tools (such as our “Assembler” and spline-based region tools) to support artists and designers in production.
* Platform Support: Ensure that our solutions are robust and effective on multiple platforms, including fixed hardware.
* Collaboration: Work closely with graphic designers, designers and other developers to identify needs and drive innovative technical solutions.
* Troubleshooting & Maintenance: Profile, debug and optimize both tools and runtime systems and contribute to a sustainable code base.



  





**WE BELIEVE YOU HAVE** 



* Experience with game engines (preferably Unity) and pipeline management.
* Knowledge of real-time rendering, shaders and optimization of graphics flows.
* Strong understanding of C# or C++ and good insight into asset management (e.g. Addressables).
* Experience working in cross-functional teams and communicating technical solutions.
* Interest in developing own tools, building automated workflows and improving pipelines.



  





**Also good if you have** 



* Experience creating or optimizing forward rendering, PBR, terrain systems, or multi-platform builds.
* Knowledge of DevOps, e.g. GitLab CI/CD, Verdaccio, build servers, Amazon S3, and Kubernetes.
* Experience with scripting (e.g. Python) for tooling or pipeline automation.



  





  





**MORE ABOUT TOPTRACER** 




  





**Workplace** 




 We value fully engaged associates who come to work because they enjoy their work and the colleagues they have. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment where everybody can reach their full potential. We provide opportunities for all the colleagues to develop internally and to meet each other. We have a strong commitment and dedication at Toptracer. That comes from the activities and moments we share together and the product we are developing.
 



  





 In addition to that, our technology is unique and world-leading which makes the journey extra exciting. We create a product that encourages people to be outside and get activated which enables a healthier lifestyle. As a colleague at Toptracer, you can either go to a range near your home to experience the product you have developed or just turn on the TV to see it in the biggest golf tournaments.
 



  





**Culture** 




 Our culture is driven by our mission to create moments that matter for everyone and our values for Caring, Courage, One Team, Fun and Excellence.
 



  





**Activities** 



* After-work
* Pair/Mob programming
* Conference
* Dart
* Gym sessions
* Table-tennis
* Golf simulator
* Golf tournaments



  





**Benefits** 



* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies and projects.
* Collaborative and innovative work environment.
* Professional development and growth opportunities.
* A hybrid work environment with the primary workplace at our cozy and welcoming office in Mörby Centrum, Danderyd.
* And of course, play golf!



  





 The position is permanent and full-time, located at our office in Stockholm. We hope to hear from you soon!

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Description**  



  

**What We're Looking For:**  

  

We are looking for a passionate Data Scientist specializing in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML) to contribute to Data Enrichment efforts within Meltwater. As a part of this role, you will work with experienced team members and product managers to design, test, and implement machine learning solutions.  

  

Through Meltwater's innovative social listening platform, we ensure our clients never miss any mention of their brand or essential topics across various platforms, automating the entire social listening process.  

  

Partner with us and be part of a diverse community that values your unique contributions, empowering you to reach new heights. Join us in crafting something extraordinary.  

  

**What You’ll Do:*** Contribute to the development of scalable algorithms for processing large datasets, implement and evaluate machine learning and deep learning algorithms for tasks such as text classification, sentiment analysis, entity recognition, and summarization.
* Assist in the design, development, and testing of ML models for real-time processing of unstructured data.
* Collaborate with senior team members to analyze the impact of algorithm changes.
* Learn and grow under mentorship, gaining exposure to industry-standard NLP tools and techniques.

  

**What You’ll Bring:*** Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field, with 2-4 years working experience OR a Master’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field, with 0-2 years working experience.
* Programming Language: Proficiency in Python.
* Solid understanding of data structures and algorithms.
* Proficient in Machine Learning, including understanding Neural Networks and foundational concepts of NLP tasks such as Tokenization, Named Entity Recognition (NER), Sentiment Analysis, Part-of-Speech (POS) Analysis.
* Experience or coursework in Deep Learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a curiosity for learning new technologies.
* Good verbal and written communication skills.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure (preferable), AWS, or Google Cloud).
* Basic knowledge of containerization tools like Docker and orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
* Interest in infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform.
* Passion for exploring the intersection of NLP and emerging fields such as generative AI or multimodal systems.

  

**What We Offer:*** Enjoy 25 days of annual paid time off plus an additional day off on your birthday!
* Gain exclusive access to Avanza Avanza, enhancing your financial opportunities and investment options
* Enjoy automatic enrollment into the comprehensive PlanSjuk Silver and PlanLov, ensuring seamless access to healthcare benefits and financial security.
* Complimentary CalmApp subscription for you and your loved ones, because mental wellness matters.
* Energetic work environment with a hybrid work style, providing the balance you need
* Benefit from our family leave program, which grows with your tenure at Meltwater.
* Thrive within our inclusive community and seize ongoing professional development opportunities to elevate your career.

  

**Where You'll Work:** Brahegatan 10, 11437 Stockholm  

  

**Our Story**  

  

The sky is the limit at Meltwater.  

  

At Meltwater, we believe that when you have the right people in the right working environment, great things happen. Our best-in-class technology empowers our 27,000 customers around the world to analyze over a billion pieces of data each day and make better business decisions.  

  

Our award-winning culture is our north star and drives everything we do – from striving to create an environment where all employees do their best work, to delivering customer value by continuously innovating our products — and making sure to celebrate our successes and have fun along the way.  

  

We’re proud of our diverse team of 2,300+ employees in 50 locations across 25 countries around the world. No matter where you are, you’ll work with people who care about your success and get the support you need to reach your goals.  

  

So, in a nutshell, that's Meltwater. We love working here, and we think you will too.  

  

**Equal Employment Opportunity Statement**  

  

*Meltwater is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: At Meltwater, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and empowered. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity and strive to provide a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment.*  

  

*All employment decisions at Meltwater are made based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by the applicable laws and regulations.*  

  

*Meltwater does not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, and we actively promote a culture of respect, fairness, and inclusivity. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities to apply and join us in our mission to drive innovation and make a positive impact in the world.*

title: AI Engineer
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



**About us**



At Sigma Industry Evolution, we strongly believe in a future driven by technology and innovation. We are dedicated towards developing cutting-edge technologies including, among others, mechatronics, embedded systems and artificial intelligence. We collaborate with some of the industry leaders in the world to solve challenges of the future.



**Job description**



We are seeking a highly motivated AI engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in machine learning, natural language processing, Large Language Models (LLM), Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) and AI agents.


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



**Responsibilities**



* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize, integrate and deploy LLMs and other AI oriented solutions.
* Design, develop and deploy advanced and scalable generative AI pipelines, optimize search strategies and build custom algorithms.
* Analyze complex datasets and develop efficient data storage and cleaning strategies
* Conduct research and experiments with different stages of AI/ML pipelines to improve performance, user experience and cost efficiency


**Skills**



* MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or equivalent.
* 3+ years proven experience in a previous role as a Data scientist, Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision Engineer or equivalent.
* Experience in developing (data collection, model creation and calibration) and deploying Machine Learning applications.
* Strong understanding of Large Language Models, generative AI, RAG and agentic AI.
* Strong understanding of semantic search and Natural Language Processing (NLP) concepts.
* Strong programming skills in Python.
* Experience working with PyTorch and/or Tensorflow/Keras.
* Experience with AI frameworks such as Langchain, Haystack, LlamaIndex etc
* Experience with embeddings and vector databases such as Weaviate, Pinecone, ChromaDB etc
* Familiarity with containerization (docker, Kubernetes)
* Familiarity with cloud integration and deployment with platforms like Azure, AWS or GCP. Skills in Azure is a plus.
* Familiarity with knowledge graphs.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to present complex technical concepts to a non-technical audience

### **MORE INFORMATION**



For more information please contact



Ivan Kertan,  

+46 761287807  

Ivan.Kertan@sigma.se

AI Engineer

Sigma Industry Evolution

Software development

2025-02-27

2025-04-30

Ivan Kertan, Ivan.Kertan@sigma.se, +46761287807

title: AWS Cloud Platform Expert
description:
Are you an expert in AWS Cloud with a passion for designing, implementing, and optimizing cloud platforms at scale? Do you thrive in complex environments and enjoy driving automation and operational efficiency? We are looking for an AWS Cloud Platform Expert to join our team, playing a critical role in enabling Public Cloud adoption while ensuring a secure, scalable, and cost-effective cloud infrastructure.


**As an AWS Cloud Platform Expert…**

You will take ownership of designing, developing, and implementing AWS cloud solutions that align with Telia’s cloud roadmap especially for enterprise landing zone setup, IAM, enforcing security guardrails, compliance and cost controls. You will lead cloud adoption efforts, staying ahead of the latest AWS advancements and evaluating their potential for driving efficiency and performance improvements. Your expertise will ensure the development of a highly automated, resilient, and cost-optimized cloud infrastructure.


The role involves working closely with cross-functional teams and business units to align cloud strategy with operational needs, ensuring seamless integration of AWS services into existing platforms. You will focus on automation to enhance cloud operations, security configurations, and account management while optimizing cloud costs. You will drive best practices, provide technical guidance for the team, and ensure compliance with security and regulatory standards. Your ability to translate high-level strategic cloud initiatives into scalable technical implementations will be key to success in this role.


**Who We’re Looking For…**

We are looking for a highly skilled AWS cloud professional with extensive experience in enterprise cloud architecture, automation, and cloud-native development. You should have deep knowledge of AWS services and the ability to design scalable, secure, and cost-efficient cloud solutions while ensuring operational stability. Strong problem-solving skills, a hands-on approach to automation, and the ability to collaborate across teams are essential.


Your expertise should include AWS cloud architecture and best practices, with hands-on experience in infrastructure automation, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud-native technologies. You should have very good knowledge and experience with **AWS enterprise landing zone setup, AWS control tower, IAM, automation, terraform, native IaC tools, cloud security.** A strong background in cloud security and cost optimization is required, ensuring compliance with industry best practices.


Fluency in English (spoken and written) is essential, along with excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively across technical and business teams. Experience with other cloud providers such as Google Cloud or Azure, as well as knowledge of FinOps and cloud cost management, would be an advantage.


**We are more than a workplace**

Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn an annual bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.


**Ready to make better happen?**

We are looking forward to your application by 2025-03-13. If you are selected for the next stage in the process, you'll be contacted by our Hiring Manager/Talent Acquisition Partner. Required controls will be performed.


If you want to know more about this position, please contact me at muthu-meera.arunachalam@teliacompany.com .


**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**
