title: Cortex Cloud Sales Specialist
description:
**Company Description** **Our Mission**


At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:


Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.  

Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

**Who We Are**


We take our mission of protecting the digital way of life seriously. We are relentless in protecting our customers and we believe that the unique ideas of every member of our team contributes to our collective success. Our values were crowdsourced by employees and are brought to life through each of us everyday - from disruptive innovation and collaboration, to execution. From showing up for each other with integrity to creating an environment where we all feel included.


As a member of our team, you will be shaping the future of cybersecurity. We work fast, value ongoing learning, and we respect each employee as a unique individual. Knowing we all have different needs, our development and personal wellbeing programs are designed to give you choice in how you are supported. This includes our FLEXBenefits wellbeing spending account with over 1,000 eligible items selected by employees, our mental and financial health resources, and our personalized learning opportunities - just to name a few!

 **Job Description** **Job Summary**


We seek a dynamic and experienced Sales Specialist to drive the growth of our Cortex and Cloud business across the region. The ideal candidate will operate in a high-growth environment at scale, thrive in driving innovation, have a solid background in cybersecurity sales, and a deep understanding of security solutions. They will have a proven track record of developing strong customer relationships and executing strategies that support rapid expansion and success. This role requires a strategic thinker who excels in collaboration with internal teams, engages effectively with customers, and drives revenue growth by selling complex solutions.

**Your Impact:**

* Join the fastest-growing team where experience meets cutting-edge solutions
* Build and cultivate strong customer relationships, driving business growth within the region.
* Partner with the core sales team to align customer strategies and engagements with Cortex and Cloud business objectives.
* Take full ownership of leading strategic sales campaigns and forecasting, utilizing in-depth knowledge of sales cycles from initial contact through procurement.
* Engage in deep technical discussions beyond standard sales presentations and pitches while translating complex technical cybersecurity solutions into clear business value propositions for customers.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including sales engineers, to provide tailored customer-centric solutions.
* Partner with Alliances to develop joint strategies, enhance customer engagement, and deliver innovative solutions for existing and prospective clients.
* Travel domestically as needed to meet with customers and attend key business events.

 **Qualifications** **Your Experience**

* 5+ years of field sales experience focusing on key customer accounts and delivering value to Enterprise or Major-level accounts in the cybersecurity industry.
* Extensive platform selling experience in complex sales with multiple buying centers.
* Experience selling SIEM, EDR, or CNAPP (DevSecOps, CloudOps) solutions is highly preferred.
* Established trusted relationships with CIOs and CISOs with the ability to influence and drive strategic conversations
* Expertise in applying complex solution sales methodologies to drive results.
* Experience working with channel partners and a deep understanding of a channel-centric go-to-market strategy.
* Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment while collaborating effectively with sales engineers and cross-functional teams.
* Experience operating in a continuous adoption, expansion, and upsell sales motion within a matrixed sales organization is preferred
* Willingness to travel domestically as necessary to meet business needs.

 **Additional Information** **The Team**


Our sales team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire, and empower our potential clients in their journey to security.


As part of our sales team, you are empowered with unmatched systems and tools, constantly updated research and sales libraries, and a team built on joint success. You won't find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn't committed to your success with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our sales team, you are driven by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredibly complex cyberthreats. You are an amazing salesperson - you are just looking for something more substantial and challenging as your next step.

**Our Commitment**  

  

We’re problem solvers that take risks and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.


We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.


Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
company_description: Your career will have a global impact: one that protects our way of life in the digital age by preventing successful cyberattacks.

title: AI and Data Enterprise Architect
description:
**AI and Data Enterprise Architect –**
======================================

**Be a Key Player in Our AI and Data Journey**
==============================================

  


*Are you fascinated by the power of data and AI? Do you want to be part of a team where your skills can transform the way we work, innovate, and create business value? If so, GlobalConnect wants to hear from you!*

  

**About the Role**
------------------


As an AI and Data Architect at GlobalConnect, you will be instrumental in shaping and implementing the architectural vision for our data and AI landscape. Your knowledge will significantly contribute to generating business value, promoting a culture centered around AI and data, and optimize existing systems to enhance data quality, governance, and integration to support business processes. You will work closely with stakeholders across various teams, ensuring seamless data-driven decision-making and innovation.

  

**Some of the things you’ll be working on:**
--------------------------------------------


* Evaluate and analyze existing systems to identify data and AI-related opportunities and challenges, develop solutions to optimize quality, performance, and reliability.
* Optimize data management by developing and implementing strategies for master data management, data integration, and quality improvement to enhance accuracy and accessibility.
* Document and communicate complex data concepts, ensuring comprehensive documentation and clear communication with stakeholders across the organization.
* Work closely with security and risk leaders to anticipate and mitigate risks, while also developing and enforcing robust data governance frameworks, ensuring compliance with industry’s best practices and regulatory requirements.
* Work alongside IT architects, Data Engineers, AI Engineers, and business leaders to efficiently advance data and AI initiatives.
* Advocate for data literacy and knowledge sharing, empowering teams to leverage data and AI effectively.
  


**Why Join GlobalConnect?**
---------------------------


You’ll be part of a diverse and highly skilled team based in Northern Europe, where collaboration and continuous learning are at the core of our culture. We offer a rare opportunity to shape how we handle data and AI, directly contributing to our strategic growth.

  

We at GlobalConnect are making significant strides in the digital transformation of the telecom industry in Northern Europe. This is your chance to be directly involved, contribute to innovation, and shape the future of data and AI.

  

**To thrive in this role, we think you have:**
----------------------------------------------


* Experience with enterprise-level master data management, including data governance and quality improvements.
* Experience with developing and operating data-driven and AI-driven systems in production.
* In-depth knowledge of data warehousing, data lakes, data modeling, and data governance principles.
* Proficiency in data science and advanced analytics, and experience with languages and tools like Python, DBT, and different AI techniques.
* Comprehensive knowledge of data security, compliance, and privacy regulations.
* Practical experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and related data and AI frameworks.
  


Do you have the ability to communicate effectively and bridge the gap between technical teams and business stakeholders? Are you motivated to find creative solutions, explore new technologies, and contribute to impactful AI and data projects? If so – we’d be keen to hear from you!

  


We don’t need a personal letter—your CV or LinkedIn profile is enough unless there’s something specific you’d like to explain. **Apply now and be a part of our data-driven journey!**

GlobalConnect is owned by EQT and is the fastest growing provider of connectivity solutions and digital infrastructure across Northern Europe. We are the result of recent mergers between Broadnet, GlobalConnect and IP-Only - now operating as one company in Norway, Denmark, Sweden, Germany and Finland. Our 1 600 employees ensure that we are the main challenger on each market by delivering secure and future proof solutions to some of the world’s largest companies as well as to private households. And everything in between.


We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.


Location:
Stockholm, SE, 111 34
Location:
Stockholm, SE, 111 34
With GlobalConnect being present in both Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland and Germany we have employees from many nationalities. We connect people and organizations across society. It starts with the foundation of our digital infrastructure and ends with all the things we enable. We strive to simplify the complicated and live by our customer promise and internal value-led behaviors - being E A S Y to work with (Expertise, Available, Speed, You).

title: Biträdande Butikschef till 3Butiken Tuna Park
description:
Vi ser fram emot att välkomna vår nästa Biträdande Butikschef till 3Butiken Tuna Park. Vi söker dig som vill ta nästa steg i karriären och utvecklas inom ledarskap och försäljning tillsammans med oss.
  
  

Om rollen
  
Som Biträdande Butikschef är du en viktig del av teamet i 3Butik och en kulturbärare. Du leder och motiverar säljteamet i det dagliga arbetet, med fokus på både din egen och teamets försäljning. Du spelar en central roll i att skapa hög kundnöjdhet, både genom att själv möta kunder och genom att coacha och följa upp teamets prestationer. Tillsammans strävar ni efter att nå butikens mål och leverera kundupplevelser i toppklass.
  
  

En vanlig dag i 3Butiken
  
Jag heter Petter Björk och är din närmsta chef. Jag vill gärna ge dig en inblick i hur en vanlig dag hos oss kan se ut. Dagen börjar med att teamet ser till att butiken är i ordning, välkomnande och redo att ta emot kunder. Du sätter upp försäljningsmål, planerar dagen och håller dig uppdaterad om produktnyheter och kampanjer. Kanske har du ett möte med mig, för att gå igenom resultat och prioriteringar, eller så håller du ett coachande samtal med en kollega. Sedan är det dags att välkomna dagens första kund.
  
  

Vi erbjuder dig
  
  

En heltidsanställning med fast månadslön och provision.
  
Möjligheten att vara en del av en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser enligt Great Place To Work. Vi är också stolta samarbetspartners till Women in Tech och Tjejer Kodar.
  
Kontinuerlig utbildning och utveckling för att du ska kunna växa i din roll.
  
En företagskultur vi värnar om och är stolta över.
  
En arbetsplats där vi har roligt tillsammans, bland annat genom kvartalsvisa tävlingar med chans till fina priser!
  
Några av våra medarbetare
  
Julia Maxén
  
Gruppchef
  
"Jag vill att mitt team ska få de bästa förutsättningarna för att göra sitt jobb på bästa sätt. Det är så vi utvecklar oss som team, men även utvecklar Tre framåt."
  
Henrik Sundvall
  
Digital projektledare
  
"Det absolut bästa med att vara projektledare på Tre är jag får jobba brett med kollegor från alla delar av organisationen och få lära mig nya saker varje dag. Jag har friheten att vara mig själv – och bli uppskattad för det!"
  
Jayasri Battola
  
Utvecklare
  
"The great work culture and the technology made me choose Tre. Working alongside great people in mixed team setups, with both experienced and new talents, along with the latest and greatest tools and technologies like Cloud and Azure."
  
  

Vem är du?
  
  

Vi tror att du har erfarenhet inom service eller försäljning och är redo för nästa steg i karriären. Du är en naturlig ledare som motiverar och inspirerar andra, samtidigt som du är strukturerad, målinriktad och har en god förmåga att prioritera. Du trivs med att bygga relationer och har lätt för att skapa kontakt med både kunder och kollegor. Dessutom har du en lösningsorienterad inställning och drivs av att få saker att hända.
  
  

Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av lagerhantering i butik eller av att coacha andra.
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan!
  
  

Vi tar emot ansökningar via denna annons och kommer hålla intervjuer löpande. Personligt brev behövs inte, men vi vill gärna att du bifogar CV och svarar på några frågor i samband med att du söker. Vi tror på din potential och dina förmågor, och för att säkerställa en rättvis och objektiv urvalsprocess använder vi tester som en del av vår bedömning. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Bakgrundskontroll genomförs på slutkandidat.
  
  

Vi har riktigt bra förmåner
  
  

Friskvårdsbidrag, föräldrarlön, pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal
  
  

Subventionerad lunch
  
  

Förmånliga rabatter på cyklar, kollektivtrafik och elbilar
  
  

Generösa bonusmodeller eller provisioner
  
  

Vi drivs av att hela tiden försöka göra saker bättre, på nya och annorlunda sätt. Vi ser oss själva som en avgörande del av Sveriges samhällsstruktur, eftersom vi vet att pålitlig uppkoppling är en viktig grundsten i dagens digitala värld.
  
  

Tre föddes som utmanare och är en organisation i ständig rörelse. Vi strävar efter att vara i framkant i allt vi gör. Vi är övertygade om att det är människorna och kulturen på Tre som är avgörande för vår utveckling.
  
  

När du startar din resa på Tre finns det oändliga möjligheter att växa och utvecklas med oss.
  
  

WE THINK LIKE CHALLENGERS - I en föränderlig värld, är vi på Tre nyfikna och ständigt öppna för nya lösningar. På Tre anpassar vi vägen framåt allt eftersom vi provar och lär oss vad som funkar bäst.
  
  

WE WORK LIKE CHAMPIONS - På Tre gör vi alltid vårt bästa. Vi känner ägandeskap för vår uppgift, sätter tydliga mål och håller fokus på det som gör mest nytta för affären.
  
  

WE ACT LIKE BUDDIES - På Tre är vi schyssta kollegor. Vi samarbetar med varandra över team och funktioner, vi bollar idéer, ger och tar emot feedback.
  
  

2003
  
Tre först i Sverige med videosamtal och strömning av mobil video. Att se personen som du ringer upp i ögonen är en helt ny upplevelse vid den här tidpunkten.
  
  

2006
  
Tre lanserar mobilt bredband som tredje operatör i världen. Under de kommande fem åren vinner Tre pris för Sveriges snabbaste mobila bredband.
  
  

2013
  
Tre’s systerbolag Hallon startas med en vision att vara den enkla mobiloperatören utan onödigt krångel.
  
  

2019
  
Ett händelserikt år! 3Världen lanseras som innebär att kunder kan surfa i 80 länder till samma pris som inom Sverige. Därefter lanseras 3Samla som gör att alla kunder kan lägga till fler användare till sitt abonnemang och sist men inte minst är Tre först i Sverige med ett lansera ett publikt 5G-nät.
  
  

2025
  
Tele2 Arena byter från 1 januari namn till 3Arena. Med vår starka passion för innovation, uppkoppling och upplevelser ska vi medverka till arenans och områdets utveckling.
  
  

Petter Björk | Kontaktperson

title: Delivery Lead - Platform
description:
About Sinch
  
Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch’s Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
  
Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
  
At Sinch we “Dream Big”, “Win Together”, “Keep it simple”, and “Make it Happen”. These values are our foundation!
  
Description
  
As Delivery Lead you will own and ensure cross team and cross domain deliveries. You will have the overview perspective and own the progress and all project related communication and planning.
  
  

**As Delivery Lead you will:**  

* Work closely with stakeholders across Engineering, Product, Operations, and Infrastructure to plan and coordinate software projects with high quality and at speed.
* On a daily basis provide direction and guidance of scaled agile practices across multiple teams and continuously focus on improving and maintaining deliveries across teams.
* Take care of the overall milestone planning, execution, delivery and release of our largest and most complex Engineering cross-team initiatives and projects.
* Effectively monitor project progress and present project updates and status to relevant stakeholders and project team members.
* Identify, diagnose and remove cross-team impediments so teams can deliver.
* Set up, implement and evolve cross-product line processes for managing initiatives, projects and dependencies with optimal output and progress whilst keeping autonomy in the product teams.


Requirements
  
We are looking for a person who is great at leading deliverables in an agile environment – not through reporting lines or “owning resources” but by creating trust, structure, overview and through enabling good collaboration and communications. You instill energy in the people you work with and have a knack for building report with both technical and non-technical colleagues, at all levels. You don’t accept the status quo and welcome challenges to change and improve. You easily grasp the technical details from the holistic company-wide perspective.
  
* At least a few years of relevant background from software organizations such as Delivery Lead, Project Manager, Engineering Manager, Entrepreneur, Scrum Master or Agile Coach
* Experience with Agile methodologies e.g., Kanban, Scrum, Agile
* Excellent communication and presentation skills in English - both verbal and written.


Our Hiring Process
  
We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
  
We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page:  https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
company_description: We help companies to communicate with customers via messaging, voice and video using multiple channels. Simplifying life by bringing all people and businesses together using technology is our purpose.

title: Nattreceptionist sommaren 2025 till Scandic Värnamo!
description:
Nu söker vi inför vår och sommar en Nattreceptionist till Scandic Värnamo!
  
  

Vad är innebär rollen som Nattreceptionist?
  
Du som arbetar inom ansvarsområdet Front of House är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i backfikan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby och frukostmatsal. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete, städning av allmänna ytor och arbete med försäljning.
  
Arbetet i Front of House innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus. När du jobbar natt i receptionen städa du även publika ytor och dukar fram och förbereda vår frukost.
  
Vem är du?
  
För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.
  
Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.
  
Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning
  
Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.
  
Information om tjänsten
  
Tjänsten är en visstidsanställning i vår & sommar. Därefter finns goda möjligheter att fortsätta jobba extra vid behov. Du bör vara över 20 år.
  
Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdagen.

title: Back-endutvecklare
description:
Vi söker en Back-endutvecklare
  
  

Välkommen till CTC! Vi är ett svenskt bolag i internationell toppklass. I Ljungby, mitt i de småländska skogarna, hittar du vårt huvudkontor och vår fabrik. De första värmeprodukterna utvecklade vi redan 1923. Det är nu med hundra års samlad erfarenhet som vi tar steget vidare till nästa generations värmepumpar och innovativa lösningar. Med kunskap och handling skapar vi förutsättningar för en hållbar och bättre värld.
  
  

Vi söker nu en Back-endutvecklare till CTC – utveckla hållbara digitala lösningar!
  
  

På CTC tror vi på innovation och hållbarhet. Vi utvecklar smarta, energieffektiva lösningar som förbättrar människors liv och bidrar till en grönare framtid. Nu söker vi en passionerad back-endutvecklare som vill vara med och forma morgondagens digitala lösningar!
  
  

Som en del av vårt Digital Solutions-team får du en nyckelroll i utvecklingen av robusta, säkra och skalbara backend-system. Du kommer att arbeta med att förbättra och utveckla system inom produktinformations- och livscykelsystem, affärssystem, kundsystem och dimensioneringsprogram. Dessutom får du möjlighet att arbeta med databaser och datahantering både lokalt och i molnet, samt bidra till utvecklingen av Business Intelligence-lösningar och AI-initiativ.
  
  

OM JOBBET
  
  

**I den här rollen kommer du att:**  

Utveckla och underhålla backend-lösningar för våra digitala tjänster och uppkopplade värmepumpar.
  
**Skapa robusta API:** er och integrationslösningar för smidig kommunikation mellan system och plattformar.
  
Säkerställa effektiv och säker datahantering mellan enheter och molntjänster.
  
Samarbeta med frontendutvecklare och andra team för att skapa en sömlös användarupplevelse.
  
Arbeta med databashantering och optimering av backend-systemens prestanda och säkerhet.
  
Engagera dig i utvecklingen av AI-lösningar och Business Intelligence-initiativ.
  
Hålla dig uppdaterad kring nya teknologier och bidra med idéer och innovation.
  
  

OM DIG
  
  

Vi söker dig som brinner för teknik och innovation, och som vill vara en del av ett företag som gör skillnad!
  
  

Du har en relevant utbildning inom datavetenskap, systemutveckling eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
  
Du har flera års erfarenhet av backendutveckling, gärna inom industriella system.
  
Goda kunskaper i Python, Java, C# eller Node.js.
  
Erfarenhet av databashantering (SQL och/eller NoSQL).
  
Kunskap om molntjänster som AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud.
  
Erfarenhet av att utveckla och konsumera REST- och GraphQL-API: er.
  
Förståelse för säkerhet inom mjukvaruutveckling och datahantering.
  
Erfarenhet av containerteknologier (Docker, Kubernetes) och CI/CD är meriterande.
  
Intresse för AI, Business Intelligence och framtidens digitala lösningar.
  
Lösningsorienterad och analytisk med en stark samarbetsförmåga.
  
  

OM OSS
  
  

Hos oss får du arbeta med banbrytande teknik i en innovativ miljö där din insats gör skillnad. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk och inkluderande arbetsplats med stora möjligheter till utveckling och en kultur där vi uppmuntrar nyfikenhet och kreativitet.
  
Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och utveckla framtidens digitala lösningar tillsammans med oss? Ansök idag!

title: Information Security (GRC) Specialist
description:
Are you passionate about security, risk, and compliance? Do you want to play an active role in securing financial technology by ensuring compliance with industry standards? Quartr is now looking for a hands-on Infosec (GRC) specialist to help us build a strong security foundation for compliance to ensure that we achieve and maintain the crucial certification SOC2.
  
About the team This is a new cross-function role in Quartr involving close collaboration with both technical and non-technical teams in Stockholm.
  
What you'll do
  
As an Infosec specialist (GRC), you’ll play a key role in developing and optimizing Quartr security and compliance strategies. You’ll collaborate closely with engineering, product, and leadership teams to establish policies, conduct risk assessments, and ensure adherence to security best practices.
  
What will help you succeed 3-5 years of experience in security compliance framework SOC 2
  
Experience in working hands-on with governance, risk, and compliance roles within a SaaS or fintech environment.
  
Strong knowledge in cloud security (preferably AWS) and security frameworks (ISO 27001, NIST, CIS, etc.).
  
Experience working with security tools like SIEM, vulnerability management, and risk assessment platforms.
  
Ability to work independently and drive security initiatives in a fast-paced start-up or scale-up environment.
  
Excellent communication skills to collaborate across technical and non-technical teams.
  
Security certifications (e.g., CISSP, CISM, CISA) are a plus but not required
  
It's a plus with experience from security incident response and security awareness training, and DevSecOps principles
  
  

**Note:** This role is based in Sweden with a valid work permit. We are also not looking for consultants or help from recruitment agencies.
  
Why join Quartr?
  
  

Do your life's work
  
We focus passionately on doing things with very high quality across our entire organization
  
  

Join the foundational team
  
We are still in the very early innings of what we believe to be a multi-decade journey.
  
  

Remote-first culture
  
Work from where you are most productive. Fully remote, from one of our two offices in central Gothenburg or Stockholm, or a combination of both.
  
  

Skin in the game
  
We truly believe in the power of incentives and in sharing the company's success with the team, so every employee is offered qualified stock options.
  
  

Competitive salary & options
  
To deliver at the highest level, we of course need the best people. This is reflected in our compensation.
  
  

Wellness allowance
  
We want to encourage health and exercise through a generous wellness allowance.
  
About Quartr
  
Quartr is a software company serving the world of finance. The Quartr ecosystem gives millions of investors and corporate professionals worldwide easy access to first-party information from public companies through various services – including a web app, a mobile app, and an API solution. Recognized as one of Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies for 2024, Quartr is also backed by top investors.
  
Learn more about Quartr
  
Quartr x Perplexity our partnership with Perplexity
  
Quartr secures Investment from Altos Ventures partnering with respected San Fransisco-based VC firm to further accelerate growth and continue transforming qualitative market research
  
Fourth Most Innovative Company in Personal Finance 2024 as recognized by Fast Company

title: DATA SCIENTIST
description:
Scandinavian Airlines System SAS
  
  

Our purpose
  
  

At SAS we are passionate about revolutionizing the aviation industry through cutting-edge technology. We aim to become Scandinavia's preferred airline with your help. As part of our AI Team, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of air travel by developing and deploying innovative solutions. If you’re excited about driving machine learning projects to enhance network efficiency and revenue optimization, this role is for you!
  
  

About the team
  
  

We are a central machine learning team that collaborates closely with stakeholders across various business units, identifying business challenges and opportunities that can be addressed through advanced analytics.
  
We work with diverse machine learning projects, collaborate and contribute to the machine learning practice to ensure that we have a solid foundation for SAS to scale and realize the full potential of machine learning.
  
We are now strengthening our team with an experienced Data Scientist focused primarily on optimization projects within Revenue Management and Network, enhancing our advanced analytics capabilities to drive continuous business optimization.
  
  

Data Scientist - Focused on Revenue Management and Network Optimization
  
  

In this role, you’ll work closely with the Commercial team, collaborating with Data Analysts and System Specialists on cross-functional initiatives within Revenue Management and Network.
  
Your primary responsibilities will include translating business questions into analytical requirements and actionable data science use cases, developing and maintaining machine learning models, and applying innovative analytical approaches to drive business value.
  
You’ll bring a fresh perspective to problem-solving by exploring advanced analytical techniques to address business challenges and uncover valuable insights. Your contributions will strengthen our data-driven approach, building a foundation for SAS to scale and unlock the full potential of machine learning.
  
We believe you share our passion for data and algorithms. In this dynamic, fast-evolving environment of digital transformation, your curiosity and enthusiasm for using algorithms to solve complex problems and inspire others will be invaluable.
  
  

**To be successful, we believe you should have:**  

* Master’s Degree or higher with strong mathematics focus (Data Science, Statistics, Econometrics, Applied Mathematics, Optimization, Computer Science) or related field.
* At least 3 years of industry experience within Data science domain
* Proven record of taking on loosely defined problems and translating into practical application
* Strong mathematical background (e.g., linear algebra, calculus, statistics, optimization)
* More than 3 years’ experience with Python, SQL and popular machine/deep learning libraries
* Proficient with statistical- and machine learning models (both supervised learning and unsupervised learning)
* Well-versed in cloud computing, prior experience with Azure is a big plus


We believe you share our passion for data and algorithms. You’re self-driven, persistent, creative, and curious, with a strong passion for learning. You seek to understand both the big picture and the intricate details that make it up. Like us, you get excited by commercial opportunities and proactively strive to create business value.
  
  

Why SAS?
  
  

At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
  
* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Central Station, Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply already today with your CV and a short personal letter. Last day for application is January 26th, 2025. For questions relating to this position, please contact responsible Talent Acquisition Specialist rakhi.romarker@sas.dk.

title: Product Manager Integration Platform
description:
**Securitas Group**


Securitas is a world-leading safety and security solutions partner that **helps make your world a safer place**. By leveraging technology in partnership with our clients, we offer a broad portfolio of value-enhancing services and solutions integrated across the security value chain – from on-site services to advanced monitoring, comprehensive risk prediction and advisory services.


With around 341 000 employees in 44 markets, our innovative, holistic approach with local and global expertise makes us a trusted business partner to many of the world’s best-known companies. Benefitting from almost nine decades of deep experience and guided by our values of **integrity**, **vigilance**, and **helpfulness**, we create sustainable value by helping our clients optimize their operations and protect what matters most - their people and assets.

**Securitas** has adopted a global strategy approach for the mid and long-term. This approach will deliver global IT solutions and platforms to further improve, streamline and optimize the cost of IT services across the business.


The **Product Manager Integration Platform** is a function within **Securitas intelligent services (SIS)**. You are responsible for managing the product roadmap for integrations and its backlog, and to ensure that the roadmap and backlog represents the priorities of the business. The objectives of the role are to further mature the offering and contribute to rapid implementation and adoption of the solution while ensuring that the development resources are directed to the highest business value.


In addition, you are accountable for continuity and delivery performance of service operations, quality assurance and operational readiness. You manage service delivery vendors, and the team that provides support.


**Key Responsibilities:**
* Overall quality of backlog items.
* Ensure each User Story in the backlog describes the supposed business value.
* Participate in Global Business Product Owners’ prioritization work.
* The Demand-to-Production end-to-end process for converting business demands to deployed code.
* Determine the roadmap of the platform and initiate and drive the initiatives accordingly.
* Own the Service Description document, that describes the offering from Securitas IT to the business.
* Leading the Platform Core Team consisting of an Integration Architect, a Development Lead and other roles.
* Ensure 3rd party solution provider follows best practices and maintains service level agreements.
* Lead different streams of the solution, rectifying reliability issues, monitoring progress, tracking KPIs, and managing budgets.
* Develop problem management process and service improvement plans.
* Ensure business and technical parties are represented in the definition and evolution of services via the Business and IT Product Owners.
* Ensure AMS Vendor follows best practices and maintains service level agreements.

  

**Key Deliverables:**


* Demand prioritization.
* Service description document.
* Service status report.
* Service improvement plans.

  

**Key Partnerships:**

* **IT Transformation Director** – align on the overall status of the Platform, escalate any issues to the Director as necessary.
* **Enterprise architecture** – align on applicable architectural guiderails and principles.
* **Integration Architect & Development lead** – alignment on integration development and dependencies.
* **IT Product Owners** – align on the priorities for the backlog.
* **Solution Architects** – discuss priority conflicts, if necessary.
* **Business Analyst** – collaborate on product issues, performance and future strategy.

**Requirements:**  



  

**Technical Skills:**

* Experience with integration platforms, middleware solutions, and enterprise service buses (ESBs).
* Experience from delivering integration services in a global environment.
* Experience of managing mission critical integration platforms with exceedingly high resilience requirements.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Oracle and Azure for integration purposes.
* Knowledge of data formats and transformation (JSON, XML, CSV, etc.).
* Experience with authentication and security protocols (OAuth, JWT, SAML).
* Strong project and product management skills (product lifecycle management, IT services pricing).
* Strong analytical and financial skills.
* Strong project and product management skills.

  

**Leadership & Soft skills**

* Strong understanding of business needs, targets, and processes, as well as the technology opportunities to improve business and the platform.
* Leadership – Exhibit strong results orientation; change leadership; adaptability; ability to drive collaborative behaviour.
* Experience from a matrix organizations and virtual teams in a global setting.
* Communication skills – Exhibits strong skills in listening, spoken and written communication; ability to establish credibility, trust and influence.
* Drive to generate higher client value through the service/solution delivery.
* Good communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to make decisions and execute.
* Strong people management skills.
* Fluent in English.

  


**What we offer:**


At Securitas we believe in doing the right thing and doing it well. For our customers and our employees. Our employees come from all walks of life and bring with them a multitude of talents and perspectives. We aim for diverse representation throughout the company, and we are committed to equal pay, safe working conditions, gender balance and an inclusive work environment with a wide range of skills and development opportunities.


If it all **sounds good** to you, don’t hesitate to **apply**!

title: Technical Sales Manager - Citrix Solutions (Scandinavian Market)
description:
**Position:**  

Technical Sales Manager - Citrix Solutions (Scandinavian Market)  

  

**Job Description:**  

  

**Arrow's Enterprise Computing Solutions (ECS)** business is a global technology enablement company that brings innovative IT solutions to the market to solve complex business challenges. We deliver value-added distribution, business consulting, and channel enablement services to the world's leading technology manufacturers and their channel partners that serve commercial and government markets.  

  

**Job Overview:**  

As a **Technical Sales Representative specializing in Citrix solutions in our Scandinavian market (Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden)**, you will work with potential and existing customers to understand their IT needs and provide tailored Citrix solutions that optimize performance, security, and user experience. You will collaborate with the sales and technical teams to drive business growth, while ensuring that customers are fully equipped to meet their goals with Citrix products.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

  

**Sales Support & Solution Design:**  

* Partner with sales representatives to identify business opportunities and qualify leads.
* Understand customers' requirements and recommend appropriate Citrix solutions **such as Virtualization, Networking, Cloud, and Endpoint management.**
* Present and demonstrate Citrix solutions and technical capabilities to customers.
* Customize solutions to meet the client's business and technical needs.

  

**Technical Expertise & Consultation:**  

* Offer technical consultation to customers by discussing Citrix products' features, benefits, and implementation processes.
* Conduct product demos, POCs (Proof of Concepts), and workshops for clients in the whole Scandinavian country to showcase the capabilities of Citrix offerings.
* Provide insight and guidance on solution design, configurations, and deployments.

  

**Pre-sales Activities:**  

* Develop and deliver technical presentations and webinars for prospective customers.
* Assist in crafting RFPs (Request for Proposals) and technical documentation for bids.
* Conduct system analysis to ensure proposed Citrix solutions meet customer specifications.

  

**Collaboration & Communication:**  

* Collaborate with internal teams (sales, support, marketing, etc.) to deliver the best solution to clients.
* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of Citrix product offerings, competitive landscape, and industry trends.
* Work with product managers and engineers to convey customer feedback and suggest product improvements.

  

**Customer Support:**  

* Provide **ongoing support to customers (in face to face and remotely)** during the pre-sales phase and assist in troubleshooting any technical queries.
* Help customers with initial setup, configuration, and integration of Citrix solutions into their environment.

  

**Training & Development:**  

* Regularly update knowledge on Citrix products through training sessions, certifications, and continuous learning.
* Keep clients informed about new Citrix features, product updates, and best practices.

  

**Qualifications:**  

  

**Technical Skills:**  

* Proficiency in Citrix solutions, such as Citrix Virtual Apps, Citrix Virtual Desktops, Citrix ADC (NetScaler), and Citrix Workspace.
* Strong understanding of cloud computing, virtualization, networking, and IT infrastructure.
* Experience with Windows Server, Active Directory, and related technologies.
* Knowledge of Citrix licensing models and pricing

  

**Experience:**  

* 3+ years of experience in technical sales, IT consulting, or solution engineering (preferably in the Citrix space).
* Experience in sales and/or technical roles involving cloud or virtualization solutions is a plus.

  

**Communication Skills:**  

* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to simplify complex technical concepts for non-technical audiences.
* Strong presentation and customer-facing skills.

  

**Certifications (preferred):**  

* Citrix Certified Sales Professional (CCSP).
* Citrix Certified Associate (CCA) or Citrix Certified Professional (CCP).
* ITIL Foundation Certification (optional but beneficial).

  

**Other:**  

* Ability to work independently and manage multiple sales opportunities simultaneously.
* Self-motivated and able to work under pressure to meet deadlines.
* A passion for technology and helping customers optimize their IT environments.

  

**WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU:**  

* Fantastic working culture where you can make an impact
* Competitive package composed of a base salary plus bonus based on your performance with the car allowance included
* This position is a life changing opportunity to start and continue a key career move in a fast paced, international organization. Progression and investment are paramount in Arrow's ethos.

  

#LI-JC1 #LI-HYBRID #LI-REMOTE  

  

**Location:**  

SE-Kista, Sweden (Kronborgsgränd)  

  

**Time Type:**  

Full time  

  

**Job Category:**  

Sales

title: Solution Engineer- Swedish Speaker
description:
**Our Purpose**

*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*

**Title and Summary**


Solution Engineer- Swedish Speaker
Who is Mastercard?
  

  

Mastercard is a global technology company in the payments industry. Our mission is to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart, and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments, and businesses realize their greatest potential.
  

  

Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. With connections across more than 210 countries and territories, we are building a sustainable world that unlocks priceless possibilities for all.
  

  

Overview
  

We’re looking for a talented Sales Engineer that would be excited to put multiple skill sets to use on a daily basis. As a Solutions Engineer at Dynamic Yield by Mastercard, you’ll be a trusted advisor responsible for driving all aspects of the technical sales process. With prospects, that means leading product demos and presentations, providing input on implementation of the platform to anyone from end-users to c-suite, and technical scoping. Behind the scenes, you’ll have the opportunity to get creative. This includes anything from developing front-end and API based custom demos that showcase personalization on our prospects’ websites or mobile applications, to building tools that support the sales process. Combined with your superb communication abilities, your specialized technical skills will be key in signing new deals, so you’ll have a direct impact on our bottom line.  

  

The Task-at-Hand:  

  

* Delivering technical and/or product presentations and demonstrations that show the value of the platform
* Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and Javascript code necessary to power sales demos and other demo-related activities
* Use of POSTMAN to leverage REST APIs to demonstrate platform capabilities
* Communicating highly technical concepts to a variety of audiences, from software engineers to executive-level decision-makers
* Sharing findings to the Sales team on the topics of Product, Technology, and Competitive Positioning
* Writing answers to and being generally accountable for RFPs and Security Questionnaires
* Supporting Sales Directors with your product and technical knowledge as you pitch to commerce and financial institutions
* Constantly learning, to stay up-to-date on competitive solutions, products, and services
* Working cross-functionally between teams, including sales, marketing, product, and engineering

  

Optimal Skills for Success:  

  

* 4+ years of experience as a Sales Engineer with a focus in digital marketing and/or eCommerce solutions (mobile, web, analytics, optimization, email); combined with a SaaS product environment
* Ability to sell to a wide variety of sized prospects from small to enterprise
* Ideal to have knowledge of a broad range of web technologies and concepts: REST APIs, Node.js, App Development, CMS and CDP platforms, eCommerce platforms, Personalization and/or A/B testing platforms, tag management, Product Recommendations, Email Marketing
* Business fluent English and any other Nordic language is a must
* An ability to simplify complex topics, and always relate technical explanations back to the business value of the product
* Problem-solving skills that enable you to identify the best solutions, given a list of business requirements from the prospect
* Must be comfortable working day-to-day with cloud-based workflow tools, such as Salesforce, Google Apps, and Slack
* Ability to travel up to 30%

**Corporate Security Responsibility**

  

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.
company_description: We are a global technology company in the payments industry.

title: Solution Architect for Tech Sustainability
description:
**Job Description**
 At H&M Group, sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. As part of Tech Sustainability, our mission is to build a platform for real-time sustainability data, helping us achieve ambitious environmental goals and reduce our carbon footprint. We aim to connect sustainability data across our entire value chain—from production to logistics—enabling advanced calculations, predictions, and visualizations through reports and dashboards. Our vision is to fuel a positive impact on our ecosystem by leading the way in sustainability.
   

  

 We are looking for a Solution Architect to join our team in our mission to build a world-class sustainability platform for external reporting of ESG legislation. You will be responsible for driving end-to-end architecture solutions for sustainability with close collaboration to the business and other stakeholders within tech. As a solution architect you are responsible for translating business- and tech requirements into architecture blueprints and identifying areas in need of improvements, holistically evaluate the architecture and use deep technical expertise to understand the business impact of a technical components, recommending and implementing new solutions. Provide leadership related to the solution development by being responsible for the architecture and delivery of a solution or portfolio of solutions. The Solution Architect needs to ensure alignment with enterprise architecture standards, advancing the architecture towards the target state.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Contextualize business strategy and objectives into capabilities and architectural vision and strategy
* Develop architecture roadmaps and blueprints, creating design artifacts such as Logical Information Models
* Translate business and technical requirements into architecture that guides solution development and supports efficient collaboration with data analysts and data engineers
* Evaluate technologies for strategic fit, contributing to business cases for tech shifts.
* Identify opportunities for improvement, addressing technical debt and enhancing value.
* Provide technical design reviews at various milestones to ensure alignment with architectural principles and organizational goals.
* Embed architecture thinking across the team and support less experienced individuals.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field.
* Experience in architecting/designing solutions built on Cloud (ideally Google or Azure).
* Proficiency in BigQuery, APIs, and other data-driven technologies to support real-time analytics.
* Ability to create both high-level and low-level design documentation and technical specifications, with hands-on experience in programming or software engineering.
* A strong problem-solver who can analyze complex issues, visualize concepts not yet concrete, and develop innovative solutions aligned with H&M’s sustainability goals.
* Demonstrated adaptability and creativity to navigate a fast-paced and evolving environment.
* Ability to provide architecture leadership, collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure a smooth handoff from design to implementation, and conducting technical design and quality reviews throughout project milestones.
* Experience evaluating and developing governance structures, methodologies, and compliance measures to ensure security and regulatory alignment (e.g., GDPR) in data handling.
* Commitment to quality and detail-oriented execution, with the drive to identify and address both current and potential obstacles or opportunities.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English


**Additional Information**
 This is a
 **full-time permanent position** 
 , starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is an on-site position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden and requires
 **on-site presence** 
 3-4 days a week.
   

  

 We have an ongoing selection, so send in your application today! Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
*At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.*
**Company Description**
 H&M Group is a family of brands; H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET and Afound. At H&M Group, our people are the driving force behind our commitment to creating meaningful growth and more sustainable lifestyles. Help us re-imagine fashion and together we will re-shape our industry. Learn more about H&M Group here.

title: AWS Cloud Platform Expert
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you an expert in AWS Cloud with a passion for designing, implementing, and optimizing cloud platforms at scale? Do you thrive in complex environments and enjoy driving automation and operational efficiency? We are looking for an AWS Cloud Platform Expert to join our team, playing a critical role in enabling Public Cloud adoption while ensuring a secure, scalable, and cost-effective cloud infrastructure.
   

  

**As an AWS Cloud Platform Expert…**
 You will take ownership of designing, developing, and implementing AWS cloud solutions that align with Telia’s cloud roadmap especially for enterprise landing zone setup, IAM, enforcing security guardrails, compliance and cost controls. You will lead cloud adoption efforts, staying ahead of the latest AWS advancements and evaluating their potential for driving efficiency and performance improvements. Your expertise will ensure the development of a highly automated, resilient, and cost-optimized cloud infrastructure.
   

  

 The role involves working closely with cross-functional teams and business units to align cloud strategy with operational needs, ensuring seamless integration of AWS services into existing platforms. You will focus on automation to enhance cloud operations, security configurations, and account management while optimizing cloud costs. You will drive best practices, provide technical guidance for the team, and ensure compliance with security and regulatory standards. Your ability to translate high-level strategic cloud initiatives into scalable technical implementations will be key to success in this role.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For…**
 We are looking for a highly skilled AWS cloud professional with extensive experience in enterprise cloud architecture, automation, and cloud-native development. You should have deep knowledge of AWS services and the ability to design scalable, secure, and cost-efficient cloud solutions while ensuring operational stability. Strong problem-solving skills, a hands-on approach to automation, and the ability to collaborate across teams are essential.
   

  

 Your expertise should include AWS cloud architecture and best practices, with hands-on experience in infrastructure automation, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud-native technologies. You should have very good knowledge and experience with
 **AWS enterprise landing zone setup, AWS control tower, IAM, automation, terraform, native IaC tools, cloud security.** 
 A strong background in cloud security and cost optimization is required, ensuring compliance with industry best practices.
   

  

 Fluency in English (spoken and written) is essential, along with excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively across technical and business teams. Experience with other cloud providers such as Google Cloud or Azure, as well as knowledge of FinOps and cloud cost management, would be an advantage.
   

  

**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn an annual bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We are looking forward to your application by 2025-03-13. If you are selected for the next stage in the process, you'll be contacted by our Hiring Manager/Talent Acquisition Partner. Required controls will be performed.
   

  

 If you want to know more about this position, please contact me at muthu-meera.arunachalam@teliacompany.com.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: CRM Salesforce Operations Manager
description:
We are Sinch. Join us and be a part of a global leader in Communication Platforms as a Service (CPaaS) and mobile customer engagement. With presence in more than 60 countries, we leverage innovative technology to enable companies to engage and interact with their users across voice, messaging, and video.
   

  

****The essence of the role****
 We are looking for an experienced CRM Salesforce Operations Manager to lead a team of Salesforce Administrators and Developers. In this role, you will oversee our Salesforce ecosystem across multiple modules, including CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote), RLM (Revenue Lifecycle Management), DataCloud, and AgentForce, focusing on operational performance, scalability, and optimization to align with our business objectives. You will drive the continuous improvement of our Salesforce architecture and lead transformation initiatives across multiple business units.
   

  

 This role is based in Stockholm and offers a hybrid work model, reporting to the VP Sales and Marketing Applications.
   

  

**As Our CRM Salesforce Operations Manager, You Will**
* Team Leadership:
+ Mentor and guide your team, define team objectives, critical metrics, and foster collaboration to streamline workflows.
+ Daily manage tasks across the team fairly, ensuring equal distribution of workload.
+ Work on optimizing BAU tasks and change requests to improve efficiency across the team.
+ Run sprints and manage story points, ensuring the team adheres to Agile methodologies.

* Salesforce Platform Management:
+ Lead all aspects of the configuration and maintenance of Salesforce CRM, ensuring system stability and performance.
+ Drive implementations and optimization of Salesforce modules, particularly CPQ, RLM, DataCloud, and AgentForce, and ensure integration with other systems.

* Operational Excellence:
+ Own operational KPIs, drive continuous process improvements and collaborate with cross-functional teams to align Salesforce capabilities with business needs.

* Project and Change Management:
+ Direct Salesforce projects from inception to delivery, ensuring timelines, budgets, and deliverables are met.
+ Facilitate change management efforts related to upgrades, new features, or migrations.

* Technical Leadership:
+ Provide technical guidance on best practices, ensuring compliance with governance and security protocols.
+ Resolve complex troubleshooting issues and stay updated on the latest Salesforce technologies.

* Vendor and Stakeholder Management:
+ Cultivate relationship with Salesforce vendors and consultants, ensuring effective communication and support for cross-departmental projects.


****Who you are:****
 We believe you possess strong project management skills, allowing you to prioritize tasks and handle competing deadlines with ease. Your excellent communication and interpersonal abilities enable seamless collaboration with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. You bring strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a clear focus on driving operational improvements.
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience managing Salesforce platforms, with hands-on experience in CPQ, RLM, DataCloud, and AgentForce, and other modules (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, etc.).
* Demonstrated success in encouraging and leading teams and driving them toward achieving shared goals.
* Deep understanding of Salesforce architecture, data models, and integration best practices.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Salesforce certifications (e.g., Salesforce Administrator, Salesforce Advanced Administrator, Salesforce CPQ Specialist).
* Familiarity with Agile or other project management methodologies.


****Benefits:****
 At Sinch, we support employees with benefits that adapt regionally, ensuring you have the resources need to thrive. These include health and life insurance, flexible work environment, retirement savings plans, and more.
   

  

****Are you ready? Join us on our journey!****
 We will review applications on a rolling basis. Apply soon by submitting your application in
 **English** 
 .
   

  

 At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we can only consider applicants who hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship or have a valid work permit for Sweden.

title: Engagement Program Manager - Fixed Term Contract
description:
**We are EA** 




 And we make games – how cool is that? In fact, we entertain millions of people across the globe with the most amazing and immersive interactive software in the industry. But making games is hard work. That’s why we employ the most creative and passionate people in the industry.
 



  





 Our games are played everywhere in the world, on any kind of gaming device (PC, web, console, mobile, smart TV’s, etc), and support a wide range of business models (digital downloads, PDLC, F2P, subscriptions, and more).
 



  





**The Challenge Ahead** 




 Production Infrastructure and Engineering’s charter is to make EA's games and services available to all players anytime and anywhere. To do this, we focus on the high availability of infrastructure, core services, and studio services. We strive to enable developers to experiment and build new games quickly with infrastructure services on-demand and workflows that enable rapid development in the cloud. In all of this, we focus on being there for players where and when they want to play.
 



 The Engagement Program Manager role is to facilitate successful launches and live operations of game titles and services as well as communicate, plan, report, and track partner requests. This role focuses on EA studios in Europe, including Codemasters and Criterion, as well as EA Sports App.
 



  





**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:** 



* Facilitating launches and live operations of game titles and services: ensuring all PI&E domain owners and PMs have outlined tasks required for launches; understanding the business impact of partner and PI&E choices related to online infrastructure, product and services; assisting in troubleshooting issues related to tech, budget and execution by finding the right PoCs and SMEs, mediating meetings, building consensus on priorities and timelines; participating in RCAs.
* Managing partner requests: bringing opportunities and partner requests to PI&E following established intake and triage processes; reporting on PI&E deliverables to the partners via monthly reports; driving quarterly portfolio reviews with partners using the common template.
* Aligning partner needs with PI&E product and services: gathering and distributing customer feedback to PI&E product and services team, creating and regularly updating PI&E tech dependencies matrix for each partner, organize and maintain PI&E internal knowledge hub where PI&E team members can self-serve information about each partner, including its games, points of contacts, links to the tech dependencies; tracking partner engagements via an accessible CRM-like system
* Evangelizing PI&E products and services to partners: representing PI&E products and services to PI&E partners, regularly updating and reviewing PI&E Hosting Guidelines and other documentation.



  




* **EXPERIENCE / EDUCATION:**
* BS in Computer Science or comparable technical degree, or commensurate experience. Minimum 5 years of technical program/project management experience.
* Experience with Infrastructure and Cloud deployments, migrations, and upgrades across data center related technologies (eCommerce, Network, Security, Systems Administration, Database Administration, Storage).
* Experience managing projects with geographically distributed and culturally diverse work-groups.
* Experience with documentation and work tracking tools like: JIRA, Monday.com, Service Now, Confluence, GitLab, Sharepoint.
* Proficient with G-Suite tools. Excel advanced reporting capabilities for building, tracking and analyzing data.
* Experience working with multiple teams and partners across organizations.
* Delivery track record across multiple large-scale cross group programs, including scrum/team prioritization.



  





**SKILLS** 



* Bring clarity to project scope and ensure shared understanding across business teams and project stakeholders.
* Create enthusiasm and an environment where everyone can do great work.
* Passionate about achieving goals and obtaining results.
* Aim to bring imagination, original ideas, and excitement to everything you do.
* Pioneer and act with the curiosity and courage that it takes to experiment and try new things.
* Listen and be open to new ways of thinking.
* Teamwork and being committed to each other
* Speak up when needed and be a collaborator. Ask questions.
* Excellent organizational, analytical and communication skills: detail oriented.
* Ability to translate business issues into system solutions, with a demonstrated proficiency in evolving and managing systems development.
* Ability to manage risks and conflicts through timely reporting with detailing of a mitigation plan to ensure that the project stays on track, or is brought back on track in the event of delays or blockers.
* Define various key metrics related to process, project and partner that need to be tracked to communicate to stakeholders.
* Ability to listen to engineering updates and translate into business status updates.
* Understanding of and a passion for the digital gaming space would be considered a huge plus.
* High degree of emotional intelligence and tailors interaction and communication styles to be effective.
* Ability to engage business partners professionally and establish strong relationships based on passion, exceptional communication skills, work ethic, action follow-up and the delivery of technical requirements.

title: Windows server
description:
Är du en duktig på Windows Server och brinner för att optimera IT-miljöer? Vill du vara en del av ett team som värdesätter gemenskap, enkelhet och entreprenörskap? Då kan B3 Cloud vara din nästa arbetsplats!
   





**Om rollen – Din möjlighet att göra skillnad i spännande projekt!** 




 Som
 **Windows Server-konsult** 
 hos oss kommer du att:
 


* **Delta aktivt i olika projekt** 
 där du förbättrar, utvecklar och underhåller våra kunders IT-infrastruktur.
* **Vägleda kunder i teknikval** 
 och implementera ny teknik för att möta deras behov.
* **Arbeta med design och implementering** 
 av större servermiljöer.
* **Använda dina kunskaper inom scripting, Active Directory, VMware och Backup** 
 för att optimera system.
* **Bidra med din förståelse för säkerhetsaspekter** 
 och hålla dig uppdaterad inom området.



**Vi söker dig som… 🌟** 



* Har
 **minst 5 års erfarenhet** 
  att arbeta med Windows Server som konsult.
* Är skicklig på att designa och implementera omfattande servermiljöer.
* Har erfarenhet av
 **scripting, Active Directory, VMware och Backup** 
 .
* Är lösningsorienterad och tar initiativ för att förbättra och utveckla processer.
* Värdesätter en arbetsmiljö präglad av gemenskap, enkelhet och entreprenörskap.



 Extra meriterande är om du har kunskaper inom
 **System Centers ekosystem** 
 , inklusive SCOM, SCSM, Intune och Orchestrator, och förstår hur dessa samverkar ur ett service management-perspektiv.
 



**Vad vi erbjuder 🎁** 



* **En inkluderande och energifylld företagskultur** 
 där vi värdesätter olikheter och erfarenheter.
* **Möjligheter till kompetensutveckling** 
 och att hålla dig i framkant inom ditt expertisområde.
* **Flexibilitet och frihet** 
 att påverka dina uppdrag, arbetstider och utveckling.
* **Regelbundna wellness-aktiviteter** 
 som yoga, simning, musikquiz och föreläsningar om mental hälsa.



**Vem är vi?** 




 Vi är
 **B3 Cloud** 
 , en del av B3 Consulting Group – ett av Sveriges ledande konsultbolag. Vi hjälper våra kunder att bygga framtidens IT-miljöer genom modern molnteknik och cybersäkerhet. Vi är ett
 **team på cirka 40 experter inom moln och säkerhet** 
 , och vi älskar att samarbeta, utvecklas och lösa komplexa utmaningar tillsammans! 💡
 



**Om B3 Consulting Group** 




*B3 Consulting Group är ett expansivt konsultbolag med cirka 1000 medarbetare. Vi brinner för innovation och hjälper Sveriges ledande företag och organisationer att skapa framtidens möjligheter genom digital transformation. B3 finns på* 
 tolv orter i Sverige samt i Polen, med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Bolaget grundades 2003, är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm Small Cap och omsatte 1 141 MSEK 2023.
 



*Vi är stolta över vår prisbelönta företagskultur, där olikheter, erfarenheter och gemensam energi värdesätts. Som ett etiskt och transparent bolag strävar vi efter att ha en positiv påverkan på samhället, människor och miljön. Vi är även engagerade i Women in Tech och initiativ för att stärka AI-utbildning för kvinnor. 2024 utsågs vi till Årets Employer Branding-företag, och vår HR-chef vann titeln Årets HR-chef.*
 💌
 **Låter det spännande?** 
 Hör av dig! Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!
