title: Cloud Pre-Sales Specialist - Azure
company_industry: Computer and Network Security and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Join the Cloud Business Team in Belgium, Netherlands, and the Nordics (BTN)**
 Be part of the exciting growth of our cloud services, delivering innovative solutions and a top-notch customer experience.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Atos’ Cloud Enterprise Solutions (CES) is a key player in the digital transformation market. CES offers secure, full-stack cloud solutions that help businesses thrive in a fast-changing, decarbonized world. To drive growth in BTN, we’re looking for a
 **Cloud Pre-Sales Specialist** 
 focused on
 **ATOS Azure services** 
 .
   

  

**The Role**
 As a
 **Cloud Pre-Sales Specialist** 
 , you will play a key role in expanding the
 **Azure Cloud Business** 
 in BTN. You will work with clients on their cloud journeys, from migration to application development and data services. Your role combines
 **commercial** 
 and
 **technical expertise** 
 in cloud services, allowing you to communicate the value of our solutions to various levels within client organizations.
   

  

**What You Need**
 We’re looking for someone with experience in cloud solution sales. You should have a solid understanding of
 **cloud journey models** 
 ,
 **migration services** 
 , and
 **Azure** 
 (or other similar platforms). You should be able to work at the intersection of
 **business** 
 and
 **technology** 
 , helping clients achieve their goals. You’re passionate about your work, take ownership, and show perseverance to reach the desired results.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Drive the growth of ATOS Cloud Enterprise Solutions (Azure) in your region.
* Collaborate closely with Azure teams to identify, pursue, and serve customers.
* Build a strategic sales plan to develop business opportunities across industries.
* Understand complex customer requirements from both business and technical perspectives.
* Create tailored proposals based on ATOS and Azure offerings to address customer challenges.
* Support Azure opportunities in other regions and global services as needed.
* Work with other Cloud Sales Specialists to ensure consistent alignment with Microsoft across BTN.


**The Right Person**
 To succeed in this role, you should be able to demonstrate
   

  

* At least 10 years of experience in technical sales or relationship management.
* A strong ability to build long-term strategic relationships at senior levels.
* A consultative approach to analyzing and solving customer problems.
* Experience leading contract negotiations alongside the core sales team.
* Proven experience with Azure sales (preferred certifications or practitioner experience).
* Proactive, organized, with excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Experience with other hyperscalers or private cloud, as well as application or data services.
* Experience working with cross-cultural teams.
* Willingness to travel.
* Fluent in English.


**Location**
 This role is based in your country/region, with regular travel required.
   

  

**Education & Experience**
* At least 10 years in technology sales or relationship management.
* A Bachelor’s degree in a related field is required.


**We offer**
 At Atos, technology and innovation are central. Atos wants to be an inspiring and facilitating employer, so that you continue to develop and improve yourself professionally and personally. Because even if you are an experienced professional, it is essential to keep up and develop yourself. Our Atos University offers many possibilities for this. The benefits we offer are
   

  

* A good salary and attractive benefits (such as an end-of-year bonus and a pension scheme)
* An informal working atmosphere with result-oriented colleagues and an involved manager
* A lease car or mobility budget (depending on your country)
* Flexible working comes in many forms at Atos. From part-time work arrangements to flexibility in where you work, when you work and how you work. For this position Remote working is posible.
* The opportunity to work on complex projects for appealing clients where you can develop yourself
* Excellent (international) career opportunities
* Extensive training and development programs
* Competency groups where you can learn from others and share your own experiences.

title: Supporttekniker IT
description:
*Vi på Iver ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till våra kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara ”beside you”, ”behind you” och ”before you”. Vi kallar det för ”The Iver way”.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en
 **Supporttekniker IT** 
 som vill bli en del av Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Är du vår nya kollega?*
**Din roll på Iver?**
 Du arbetar som del i Ivers affärsområde Bank & Fintech med ansvar för tjänsteleverans av kritisk kundinfrastruktur. Våra kunder är ofta stora nordiska företag inom bank och finans eller myndigheter, med krav på hög nivå av informationssäkerhet och infrastruktur som kod. Vissa av dem utgör samhällskritisk verksamhet och/eller har en särskild hotbild.
   

  

 Du arbetar i vår Technical Assistance Center med ansvar för Ivers tjänsteleverans, så som infrastruktur, system- och applikationsdrift, användarnära tjänster och cybersäkerhetstjänster. Du arbetar strukturerat och är van att planera ditt arbete samt är mycket noggrann i det du gör och gillar att arbeta i team.
   

  

**Exempel På Dagliga Arbetsuppgifter**
* Utförande av Service Requester: exempel är uppsättning av servrar, ändring av konfiguration samt server-, system- och kontoadministration
* Monitorering av olika system i drift
* Dokumentation
* Kundkontakt via telefon och i ärenden
* Ärendehantering


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
**Iver - Where technology meets business.** 
 Hos Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Iver är ett bolag med entreprenöriella rötter och en kultur som präglas av flexibilitet och samarbete. Vårt mål är att våra kunder – här i Norden och internationellt – ska se oss som en ledande partner för digital transformation.
   

  

 På Iver är vi inkluderande och strävar efter genuint samarbete där vi arbetar mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden.
   

  

 Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas.
 **We’re not big blue. We’re yellow.** 
 Stora nog att skala och agila nog att innovera.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
**För att lyckas i rollen vill vi att du har kunskaper inom:**
* För tjänsten relevant eftergymnasial utbildning
* Ca 1-2 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT
* Erfarenhet av arbete på en teknisk Servicedesk, NOC, driftavdelning eller liknande med erfarenhet av ITIL-baserade ärendehanteringssystem
* God erfarenhet av Windowsmiljöer inklusive Active Directory, AAD, Windows Server med mera
* Förståelse och medvetenhet inom tekniskt och processmässigt informationssäkerhetsarbete
* Övervakning och datavisualisering med exempelvis Zabbix, Prometheus och Grafana/Kibana
* Grundläggande kunskaper inom nätverk och brandvägg
* Du talar och skriver såväl svenska som engelska obehindrat


**Meriterande Kunskaper**
* Erfarenhet av Linuxmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av switching- och routingprotokoll samt virtualiseringsmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av klienthantering med exempelvis Intune och Configuration Manager
* Vana av produktionsmiljöer med särskilda krav på informationssäkerhet
* Erfarenhet av NGFW, lastbalansering, WAF med mera


 För den här tjänsten ställer vi höga krav på IT-säkerhet vilket innebär att vi kommer göra bakgrundskontroller som en del av rekryteringsprocessen. Utöver det är det krav på svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Vi finns på 26 kontor runt om i Sverige och Norge. Placeringsort för denna roll är på vårt kontor i Solna.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Du är välkommen att kontakta Maria Skoglund-Robertsson (maria.skoglund-robertsson@iver.se) vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**We empower our Nordic society** 
 . Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation.
   

  

**Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort.** 
 Vi säkerställer att sjukvården har tillgång till rätt patientdata, att samhällskritiska system aldrig ligger nere och att flygplanen landar säkert. Som en lyhörd och affärsnära helhetspartner möjliggör vi våra kunders innovation – idag och imorgon.

title: System Engineer – Observability
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in eHealth with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our eHealth solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish healthcare. We are growing continuously and now have about 900 employees in several countries.
   

  

**The position**
 We are looking for someone to help establish the infrastructure behind Sweden's largest electronic medical records system. As a member of the IT Operations and Infrastructure team, you will be part of a team responsible for operating and maintaining the medical records system as a service to our customers.
   

  

 Cambio is a company with employees from many countries, with many cultural backgrounds and creeds. We think that you share our belief that this diversity is a key building block in creating successful teams. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
 We are looking for you who have analytical and technical skills and believe you are a team player, but you also have the capability to work with tasks independently. You have excellent communication skills and have no problem having several dialogues with different stakeholders simultaneously.
   

  

 We are looking for you that can perform full lifecycle engineering activities (design, develop, test, implement, maintain) for existing observability platform (Dynatrace) in an enterprise environment with on-premises and cloud-integrated systems/applications/infrastructure.
   

  

 We also expect you to proactively design strategies to gain real-time insights and identify potential issues before they escalate. To do that we believe you have a genuine interest in understanding the service we provide for our customers and how to identify improvements.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Experience from working with Dynatrace or similar tool to set up monitoring
* Excellent understanding of how monitoring and event systems tie together
* Experience and knowledge within data collection, analysis, and implementation to derive meaningful insights from various sources including metrics, events, logs, and traces.
* Experience and knowledge within distributed systems including those with microservices and hybrid infrastructure (cloud/on-premises) to effectively design pipelines, build monitoring systems, and implement observability practices
* Fluent in written and spoken English.


**It's a bonus if you have**
* Knowledge of Grafana, Prometheus
* Experience in OpenShift monitoring
* Knowledge of NXLog
* Knowledge of log aggregation tools like OpenSearch
* Knowledge of Cambio applications and/or domain
* Fluent in written and spoken Swedish.


**Place of employment** 
 : Linköping or Stockholm
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Other:** 
 We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in
 **Sweden.** 
 We will ask for verification during the process.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Read more about us
 **here!**
 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site
 **here!**
 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Business Intelligence Specialist
description:
**Role Description:** 



* Install, configure, and upgrade QlikSense servers, ensuring system stability, security, and optimal performance.
* Manage user roles, permissions, and security rules to ensure data confidentiality and compliance with security policies.
* Establish and maintain data connections with various sources (e.g., SQL databases, cloud storage) for accurate and consistent data availability.
* Monitor system performance, resolve technical issues, and optimize application loading times and data refresh schedules.
* Collaborate with QlikSense developers and business users to understand reporting requirements and provide technical support and training.



  





**Essential Skills** 



* 5+ relevant experience in QlikSense Administration
* Understanding of QlikSense architecture, including QMC (Qlik Management Console) and QAP (Qlik Analytics Platform).
* Experience with QlikSense installation, configuration, maintenance, and troubleshooting.
* Proficiency in managing data connections to various data sources (e.g., SQL databases, cloud storage).
* Knowledge of scripting languages used in QlikSense for data transformation and loading.
* Experience with user management, security rules, and access control in QlikSense.

title: Big Data Engineer (Scala/Spark/Hadoop)
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Banking
description:
**About Us:** 




 Dabster excels in matching top talent with leading global companies. Our goal is to be the premier recruitment specialist for securing top-tier roles across various global clients.
 



  





**Who will you work with:** 




 A global technology and digital solutions company that helps businesses transform digitally. The company offers a range of IT services, including software development, cloud computing, data analytics, enterprise resource planning (ERP), artificial intelligence (AI), and automation, serving clients across various industries such as banking, insurance, manufacturing, retail, and telecommunications
 



  





**About client:** 




 One of the largest financial services groups in Sweden, offering a wide range of banking services to individuals, businesses, and institutions. With a strong presence in
 **Finland** 
 ,
 **Sweden** 
 ,
 **Denmark** 
 , and
 **Norway** 




  





**Job Description:** 




**Big Data Scala Spark/ SparkSQL/Hadoop** 




  





**Key responsibilities** 




 • Develop Scala/Spark programs, scripts, and macros for data extraction, transformation and analysis
 



 • Design and implement solutions to meet business requirements
 



 • Support and maintain existing Hadoop applications and related technologies
 



 • Develop and maintain metadata, user access and security controls
 



 • Develop and maintain technical documentation, including data models, process flows and system diagrams
 



  





**Description of knowledge and experience** 




 • Minimum 4-8 years of experience from Scala/Spark related projects and/or engagements
 



 • Create Scala/Spark jobs for data transformation and aggregation as per the complex business requirements.
 



 • Should be able to work in a challenging and agile environment with quick turnaround times and strict deadlines.
 



 • Perform Unit tests of the Scala code
 



 • Raise PR, trigger build and release JAR versions for deployment via Jenkins pipeline
 



 • Should be familiar with CI/CD concepts and the processes
 



 • Peer review the code
 



 • Perform RCA of the bugs raised
 



 • Should have excellent understanding of Hadoop ecosystem
 



 • Should be well versed with the below technologies
 



 o Jenkins
 



 o HQL(Hive Queries)
 



 o Oozie
 



 o Shell scripting
 



 o GIT
 



 o Splunk
 



  





**Preferred** 




 • Relevant certifications (e.g., Scala, Spark, Hadoop, Performance)
 



 • Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g., Python, R)
 



 • Insight to cloud-based solutions such as Snowflake
 



 • Experience in Financial Services, preferably in the Credit risk domain"
 



  





**What We Offer:** 




 • Competitive pay offered for FTE positions
 



 • Opportunity to work with a leading company
 



 • An opportunity to be part of impactful projects that shape the future of the IT industry.
 



  





**Interview Process:** 




 You can expect one or two technical interviews, followed by a round focused on business aspects.
 



  





**How to Apply:** 




 Apply by submitting your resume today, showcasing your relevant experience and passion for the position via LinkedIn Easy Apply or directly to santosh.hiremani@dabster.net

title: Engineering Manager - Site Reliability Engineering
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.** 




  





 We are looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to lead one of our core platform teams, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE). In this role you’ll oversee the team’s people, processes, delivery, technical product, and cross-team collaborations. Collaborating closely with the team, neighbouring teams, and Staff Engineers, you’ll drive critical infrastructure that impacts the entire company.
 



  





 You’ll guide a collaborative, inclusive, and high-performing team that thrives on shared decision-making, knowledge-sharing, and fostering a psychologically safe environment. Your role will include refining team processes, building and prioritizing backlogs, clarifying requirements, and engaging with stakeholders across the company. Your experience in crafting technical platforms in other organizations will bring valuable insights, while your open-mindedness will help shape our approach.
 



  





**How You Will Make An Impact** 



* Lead and grow a high-performing team by providing mentorship, coaching, and technical guidance while fostering a culture of collaboration, trust, and continuous improvement.
* Drive infrastructure excellence by ensuring the platform is scalable, reliable, and optimized for fast, efficient product delivery.
* Partner with other teams and stakeholders to align the platform’s development with organizational priorities and technical goals.
* Enhance team processes by refining workflows, prioritizing backlogs, and clarifying technical and product requirements to maximize efficiency and impact.
* Shape the vision for the platform’s future, inspiring the team to innovate and successfully bring that vision to life.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* Solid technical background with expertise in modern SRE practices and cloud technology.
* Proven experience managing and growing SRE teams.
* Extensive understanding of technical platforms, team dynamics, software delivery and system design.
* Ability to foster a psychologically safe work environment for your team.



  





**It would also be music to our ears if you have** 



* Experience with technical product development, focusing on Developer Experience.
* Hands-on familiarity with tools and technologies like Go/TypeScript, GKE, Terraform, Observability stacks, and CI/CD pipelines (ArgoCD, GitHub Actions).



  





**Equal Opportunity Employer** 




 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
 



  





**Application** 




 Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
 



  





 We embrace a hybrid work setup that offers the freedom and flexibility to balance your personal and professional life. At the same time, we value the collaboration, creativity, and connection that comes from spending the majority of our time together in the office. This approach allows us to innovate as a team while giving you the autonomy to work in a way that suits you best.

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Customer Solutions Engineer
description:
**Job Title**
 Customer Solutions Engineer
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a
 **Customer Solutions Engineer,** 
 you will be a key member of the implementation project and service team, servicing and implementing Patient Monitoring solutions at our customer sites. The main goal of your role is to ensure successful implementations and positive customer experiences.
   

  

 The majority of this position is targeted geographically within either Storstockholm/Mälardalen, Lund or Region Västra Götaland, but as a natural part of the service organization, travel outside this main focus area will be required, consequently willingness to travel is necessary for this role.
   

  

**Your role:**
* Install, deploying, servicing and/or integrating patient monitoring hardware and software solutions.
* Configuring, maintaining, and testing our products at customer sites and/or Philips Delivery Center in Upplands Väsby.
* Responsibility for the whole implementation process, from planning through installation, go-live and handover.
* Managing detailed quality documentation in adherence to medical directive standards.


**You're the right fit if you have :**
* Relevant working experience with DICOM, HL7 and Hospital Communication standards
* A minimum of 2-3 years of related working experience with medical devices and understand the special character working in the hospitals is preferable.
* Have a strong interest and affinity for IT solutions including knowledge on networking (CCNA, CCNP, CWNA, CWTS or equivalent) and IT infrastructures (VMWare, Hyper V, SQL Server) is preferable
* Self-motivated, task-forced team player who is persistent in achieving the goals set.
* Highly professional and knowledgeable approach to solving customer problems and ownership of own projects.
* Driver's license (Swedish B) and willingness to travel


**How We Work Together**
 We believe that we are better together than apart.
   

  

 Field roles are most effectively done outside of the company’s main facilities, generally at the customers’ or suppliers’ locations.
   

  

**About Philips**
 We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help the lives of others.
   

  

* Learn more about our business.
* Discover our rich and exciting history.
* Learn more about our purpose.
* Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.


 If you’re interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.

title: Senior Partner Solution Engineer
description:
Build the future of the AI Data Cloud. Join the Snowflake team.
   

  

 We are looking for a
 **Senior Partner Solution Engineer** 
 in Stockholm, who is accustomed to working with Systems Integrators. In this role, you will work directly with our consulting & SI partners, enabling them on key platform features and their business benefits and helping them to grow their Snowflake services business and shape their go-to-market.
   

  

 As a Snowflake Senior Partner Solution Engineer, you must share our passion for innovating through the AI Data Cloud, thrive in a dynamic environment, and have the flexibility and willingness to jump in and get things done. You are equally comfortable in both a business and technical context, interacting with executives and inspiring technical audiences.
   

  

**IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL GET TO:**
* Present Snowflake technology and vision to decision makers and technical contributors at partners, prospects and customers
* Work hands-on with partners and customers to demonstrate and communicate the value of Snowflake technology throughout the sales cycle
* Build technical champions within our partners and grow the local Snowflake technical community
* Immerse yourself in the ever-evolving industry, maintaining a deep understanding of competitive and complementary technologies and vendors and how to position Snowflake in relation to them.
* Collaborate with Product Management, Engineering, and Marketing to continuously improve Snowflake’s products and marketing


**ON DAY ONE WE WILL EXPECT YOU TO HAVE:**
* 7-8 years of industry experience with a minimum of 3 within a pre-sales environment working directly with consulting & System Integration (SI) partners
* Outstanding presenting skills to both technical and executive audiences, whether impromptu on a whiteboard or using presentations and demos
* Broad range of experience within large-scale Database and/or Data Warehouse technology, ETL, analytics and cloud technologies
* Hands-on expertise with SQL
* Experience in data science is highly desirable as is hands-on Python experience
* Ability to connect specific business problems and Snowflake’s solutions
* University degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or related fields, or equivalent experience preferred
* Fluency in Swedish and English are required


 Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.
   

  

 How do you want to make your impact?

title: Nätverkstekniker
description:
Har du erfarenhet inom nätverk och infrastruktur och är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär? Hos Amendo Tech får du möjligheten att arbeta med ledande företag inom bank, finans, retail, myndigheter, produktbolag och innovativa startups. Vi söker just nu engagerade konsulter för kommande interimsuppdrag som kan stärka våra kunders tekniska landskap och säkerställa deras infrastruktur och nätverk på högsta nivå.
   

  

 Din kompetens & profil
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är kunnig inom nätverksarkitektur och säkerhet och som har erfarenhet av att designa, implementera och övervaka nätverkslösningar i komplexa miljöer. Du har arbetat med några av följande tekniker:
   

  

* Nätverksprotokoll och teknik: Stark kompetens inom TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VLAN, VPN och routingprotokoll (t.ex. OSPF, BGP).
* Brandväggar och säkerhet: Erfarenhet av brandväggar, IDS/IPS, och andra säkerhetslösningar, exempelvis Cisco ASA, Palo Alto eller Fortinet.
* Trådlösa nätverk: Erfarenhet av att konfigurera och hantera trådlösa nätverk (WLAN) och Wi-Fi-lösningar.
* Lastbalansering och redundans: Kunskap om lastbalanserare och failover-lösningar för att säkerställa hög tillgänglighet.
* Nätverksövervakning och felsökning: Vana vid att använda övervakningsverktyg.
* Certifieringar: Gärna certifieringar inom Cisco (t.ex. CCNA, CCNP) eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Molnplattformar: Gedigen erfarenhet av AWS, Azure, eller Google Cloud Platform samt arbete med hybridmoln-arkitektur.
* Virtuella miljöer: Erfarenhet av virtualiseringsteknologier som VMware, Hyper-V eller KVM.
* Serveradministration: Kompetens inom Windows- och Linux-servrar, inklusive säkerhetspatchning och hantering av Active Directory.
* Lagring och backup: Kunskap om SAN, NAS och backuplösningar som Veeam eller Commvault.
* Automatisering och scripting: Förmåga att effektivisera och automatisera arbetsflöden med hjälp av PowerShell, Python eller Ansible.
* Säkerhet och övervakning: Förståelse för säkerhetspraxis och vana vid övervakningsverktyg för driftssäkerhet, exempelvis Zabbix eller Splunk.


 Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.
   

  

 Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och för olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.
   

  

 Om Amendo Tech
   

  

 Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.
   

  

 Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.
   

  

 Frågor och kontakt
   

  

 Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Engineering Manager - Ubuntu Security
description:
As the most widely used Linux distribution, Ubuntu underpins the security of the entire internet. The role of Security Engineering Manager directly impacts the safety and security of millions of users worldwide. Join a team of security experts dedicated to protecting the open-source ecosystem and driving innovation. Your leadership will be instrumental in addressing emerging threats, developing robust security measures, and ensuring the continued integrity of Ubuntu. This is an opportunity to make a tangible difference and leave a lasting legacy on the digital landscape. The security engineering team's first responsibility is to respond to emerging threats and aim to secure the open source ecosystem for community and enterprise use. Your work will improve the security of millions of people, by addressing potential CVEs and vulnerabilities alongside the lifecycle of Canonical products such as Ubuntu. You will engage directly with our community and customers, as well as coordinating efforts across multiple engineering teams and projects to make this happen.
   

  

 An Engineering Manager is responsible for line management and career guidance. The ability to develop engineering talent, to represent your team and product from a technical perspective, and to drive collaboration with other teams and customers are all critical to success in this role.
   

  

 What you will do in this role
   

  

* Lead and develop a team of engineers, ranging from graduate to senior
* Provide technical guidance on vulnerability remediation
* Drive the development of new security engineering projects
* Work with upstream open source projects on vulnerability lifecycle handling
* Coach, mentor, and offer career development feedback
* Identify and measure team health indicators
* Implement disciplined engineering processes
* Represent your team and product to stakeholders, partners, and customers
* Develop and evangelise great engineering and organisational practices
* Plan and manage progress on agreed goals and projects
* Be an active part of the security engineering leadership team, collaborating with other leaders


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
* Drive, and a track record of going above-and-beyond expectations
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
* A love of developing and growing people and a track record of it
* Organised and able to ensure your team delivers timely, high quality results
* Professional manner interacting with colleagues, partners, and community
* Solid background in software development, including expertise in support and maintenance
* Mastery in any programming language (Go, Java, C, Python, ...)
* Knowledgeable and passionate about software and application security
* Solid experience working in an agile development environment
* A demonstrated drive for continual learning
* Builds trust, relationships and confidence
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks each


 Optional things we value
   

  

* Strong technical understanding of the inner-workings of Linux distributions (ideally Ubuntu or Debian)


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Security Strategist (EMEA North)
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Security Specialist (EMEA North)**
*Open to locations in Sweden, Norway, Denmark or Finland*
 Splunk is here to build a safer and more resilient digital world. The world's leading enterprises use our unified security and observability platform to keep their digital systems secure and reliable. While customers love our technology, it's our people that make Splunk stand out as an amazing career destination and why we've won so many awards as a best place to work. If you become a Splunker, we want your whole, authentic self, what we call your "million data points". So bring your work experience, problem-solving skills and talent, of course, but also bring your joy, your passion and all the things that make you vary. We look at talent, values and character when hiring.
   

  

 Role summary
   

  

 Your primary focus as a Security Strategist is on what's new and what’s next to stay ahead of customer, market and technology trends. You will be part of a small team of technical and domain security subject matter experts that will identify and incubate emerging and strategic Security use cases and solutions that will unify, advance and expand the value of Splunk products for our EMEA North customers with an increased focus on the Nordics region. You will work closely with theater partners, but report up through the Global organization. You will be responsible for driving adoption and success metrics for emerging and incubation-stage security use cases and solutions for your assigned theater and region, while also fulfilling global responsibilities to help evangelize and advance the Splunk Security brand, product and GTM strategy.
   

  

 Your role will require you to interface cross-functionally at both theater and global levels with teams across sales, technical sales, customer success, partners, product marketing and product management.
   

  

 What you'll get to do!
   

  

* Develop and refine emerging security use cases for Splunk products that reflect priority customer challenges, market trends, the evolving threat landscape and unique business opportunities.
* Develop and test new maturity models, white papers, programs, workshops, demos, POVs, enablement content, and thought leadership content to showcase and accelerate adoption of emerging information security use cases and solutions.
* Represent Splunk Security internally as a security GTM stakeholder in product roadmap, launch planning, customer initiative development in strategic growth areas for our customers and our business in security.
* Evangelize Splunk Security vision, strategy and roadmap at industry events and with global customers and partners.
* Mentor security talent both within our team and across the SE and Solution Architect community at Splunk as we look to continue to increase and expand the profile of security.
* Partner with regional teams to localize global content and strategy to region-specific sales plays, enablement content, account targeting strategies and channel strategies for incubation-stage use cases and solutions with the in-theater technical sales and sales teams.


**Qualifications**
* 7+ years of technical sales, product or practitioner experience in the security industry.
* Experience with modern security technologies and their place in an organization's architecture, e.g., SIEM, SOAR, and UEBA.
* Clear and concise communicator being comfortable presenting publicly to large audiences or one on one with senior executives.
* Experience in driving complex security sales cycles across EMEA.
* Demonstrated knowledge of current threats, high-visibility security events, and trends in the marketplace.
* Familiarity with current security data sources spanning on-premises, hybrid, & multi-cloud (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) including the security detection methodologies they offer.
* Familiarity with common industry frameworks and concepts like MITRE ATT&CK, CSC CIS, LMKC, OTel, DORA, etc.
* Willingness and ability to work cross-functionally across a globally-dispersed remote organization with minimal supervision.
* Willingness to travel for industry and marketing events, customer and functional meetings.
* Based in Sweden, Denmark or Norway.


 Splunk is an Equal Opportunity Employer
   

  

 Splunk, a Cisco company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.
   

  

 Note

title: Erfaren it-arkitekt inom applikation- och infrastrukturarkitektur
description:
Är du erfaren it-arkitekt inom applikations- samt infrastrukturarkitektur och sugen på att leda vår förflyttning till containerbaserade miljöer samt vår moln resa? Kom till oss på Finansinspektionen (FI) och bidra med din kompetens! Vi är ett engagerat it-team som arbetar agilt för att leverera tjänster till FI:s medarbetare, allmänheten och företag under vår tillsyn. Nu förstärker vi vår it-organisation.
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som it-arkitekt på avdelningen Arkitektur och it-säkerhet kommer du att vara en nyckelperson i arbetet runt målarkitektur och den förflyttning FI gör mot containerbaserad microservicearkitektur i hybrida miljöer. Du bidrar med att ta fram nya arkitekturlösningar och rekommendationer som möter dagens och framtidens krav samt behov tillsammans med andra levererande agila team.
   

  

 Dessutom kommer du att representera avdelningen i it-arkitekturfrågor för att därigenom samverka och vårda kontakterna med interna och externa intressenter. Du kommer vara en del av arkitekturteamet som ansvarar för framtagandet av Finansinspektionens målarkitektur, referensarkitekturer och roadmaps samt att de realiseras på ett effektivt och långsiktigt hållbart sätt. Som ansvarig arkitekt sitter du i vårt beslutande forum för arkitekturfrågor, såväl taktiska som operativa.
   

  

 Du har en bred och djup teknisk kunskap om infrastruktur- och applikationsarkitekturer i komplexa hybrida miljöer där du säkrar arkitekturen och lösningsförslagen från ett helhetsperspektiv. It-säkerhet är självklart för dig och det genomsyrar ditt arbete och de arkitekturella lösningarna.
   

  

 Du har erfarenhet av att driva arkitekturarbete och digitalisering och en passion för att bryta ner komplexa behov och arkitekturer till enkel design och lösningar som kan underhållas effektivt. Som person kan du skapa engagemang, delaktighet och motivation för att bygga goda samarbeten. Du lyssnar, kommunicerar och löser problem på ett konstruktivt sätt, med såväl verksamheten som med team inom it.
   

  

**Din utbildning och erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig som
   

  

* har flerårig erfarenhet av att leda och arbeta fram målarkitekturer och roadmaps i samarbete med olika team från ett helhetsperspektiv för moderna applikations- och infrastrukturlösningar i hybrida miljöer
* har flerårig erfarenhet att arbeta fram tekniska standarder, referens- och lösningsarkitekturer där krav från applikation, infrastruktur och it-säkerhet kan ingå
* har en bred och djup teknisk kunskap inom flera områden som berör infrastruktur- och applikationsarkitekturer i stora komplexa och hybrida miljöer
* har flerårig erfarenhet av att arbeta med arkitektur strukturerat på en strategisk och taktisk nivå i samarbete med verksamhet och levererande team
* har mycket god förståelse för kubenetes- och containerarkitektur, ur både ett applikations- och utvecklingsperspektiv
* har erfarenhet av och har arbetat utefter något arkitekturramverk och processer
* uttrycker dig mycket väl på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


 Det är meriterande om du
   

  

* är certifierad it-arkitekt
* har examen som civilingenjör, inom systemvetenskap eller annat tekniskt ämnesområde
* har arbetat inom myndighet eller finansiell sektor
* har god förmåga att förmedla krav och lösningar mellan olika intressentgrupper
* har erfarenhet inom flera olika applikationsområden
* har erfarenhet av agilt arbete och/eller SAFe-ramverket.


**Om dig**
 I det här jobbet behöver du
   

  

* bidra till ett gott samarbete
* planera, organisera och prioritera ditt arbete på ett effektivt sätt
* ha en mycket god analytisk förmåga och kunna lösa komplexa uppgifter
* ta egna initiativ.


**Om FI**
 FI bidrar till ett stabilt finansiellt system, välfungerande marknader, en hållbar utveckling och ett högt skydd för konsumenter. Vi erbjuder dig att arbeta med samhällsviktiga uppgifter, där du är med och påverkar den finansiella marknaden.
   

  

 På FI arbetar cirka 600 personer och våra värderingar präglas av att vi är engagerade, beslutsamma, målinriktade och hjälpsamma. Vår arbetsplats ligger centralt i Stockholm. Det finns även möjlighet att delvis arbeta på distans. För mer information om vår organisation: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/organisation/
   

  

 Verksamhetsområde It leder det strategiska digitaliseringsarbetet, driver innovation och ansvarar för internationell koordinering inom it. Vårt uppdrag är brett och vårt ansvarsområde sträcker sig från löpande drift, support och säkerhet till utveckling och förvaltning av våra system, projektledning, arkitektur, upphandlingar samt leverantörsstyrning. Här jobbar cirka 100 personer, fördelade på 5 avdelningar och en stab.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Vi baserar vår rekrytering på kompetens. Det innebär att vi noggrant definierar vilka kvalifikationer som efterfrågas och sedan utgår från dem genom hela rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Vi arbetar aktivt för mångfald och likabehandling och välkomnar därför medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Arbetspsykologiska tester kan ingå i rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 På FI arbetar vi aktivt för att vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare där du som medarbetare trivs och utvecklas. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på FI och vad vi erbjuder: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/arbeta-pa-fi/vi-erbjuder/
   

  

 En anställning på FI kan innebära att säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll görs enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

**Sök jobbet**
 Välkommen med din ansökan som ska innehålla cv och relevanta intyg eller examensbevis.
   

  

 Vi avböjer all hjälp med rekrytering och annonsering.
   

  

**Anställningsform:**
 Tillsvidareanställning som inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid
   

  

**Kontaktperson:**
 Helena Lejonklou, avdelningschef, 08-408 986 23
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:**
 2025-03-14

title: IFS solution consultant
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**YOUR ROLE**
 We are seeking an IFS Application Consultant to join our fast-growing team.
   

  

 Capgemini has made a strategic decision to grow our IFS capacity in the Nordics. We do this in close collaboration with IFS and with a unique partnership. Our goal is to be the Nr 1 IFS Partner in Europe.
   

  

 As a Solution Consultant, you will map customers’ business processes to business systems/applications, answer their queries, resolve issues, and offer advice in improving their solutions.
   

  

 You will continuously develop yourself by acquiring new knowledge within the Capgemini targeted customer segments, in relevant or new IFS related functionality. You will share your knowledge with both customers and colleagues.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 In this role, you get a variety of work tasks and the possibility to gain knowledge in several areas. You will build a broad competence that is highly valued in many other teams - the career opportunities are many. You will be part of a highly engaged team who collaborates to solve complex support issues, you always get help from your teammates! Further developing your skills, you can access IFS Academy and get certified within your chosen areas.
   

  

**YOUR PROFILE**
 We are looking for people with a passion for technology, business processes and customer experiences. You also need to be able to communicate and collaborate with other people at various levels.
   

  

*To be successful in this role you need:*
* Drive and a wish to learn new things
* Attention to details
* Excellent communication and cooperation skills
* Good ability to analyze and solve issues
* Deliver good service with the highest quality
* “Can do” attitude


*Your skills:*
* Degree, preferably or relevant professional qualifications
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in IFS Applications or similar business applications
* Solution-oriented mindset, with a passion for technology, business processes and customer support.
* Interest in interacting with customers and helping them find solutions as well as suggesting enhancements to improve their processes.
* Curiosity and eagerness to learn, a proactive approach and ability to adapt quickly to new processes and procedures.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, written and spoken.
* Knowledge of PL/SQL/REST will be an added advantage.


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world while creating a tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market-leading capabilities in AI, cloud, and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion. Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Business Development Manager - Citrix
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, and Wholesale
description:
****Position:****
 Business Development Manager - Citrix
   

  

****Job Description:****
**About Us**
 Arrow's enterprise computing solutions (ECS) business is a global technology enablement company that brings innovative IT solutions to market to solve complex business challenges. We deliver value-added distribution, business consulting and channel enablement services to the world's leading technology manufacturers and their channel partners that serve commercial and government markets.
   

  

 Find out more about us in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n5Za\_pHRbzI
   

  

****Business Development Manager - Citrix**
 Location: Kista, Stockholm (Sweden)**
**About The Role & The Team**
 As the
 **Business Development Manager** 
**- Citrix** 
 in Arrow, you will join the Infrastructure Business Unit located in our offices in Stockholm. You will exercise your role within the Swedish market.
   

  

 Within this position, you will be mainly responsible for the management of the current client accounts as well as the new business development. Your role will involve continuous relationship development between the business area (Cloud Computing/Infrastructure), regional teams and the vendors, to ensure a trust and support of business objectives.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
 On the daily basis, you will be:
   

  

  

* Working with Arrow Internal Sales teams, to identify the key reseller partners with good potential to develop sales of the vendor's products and services.
* Working with the abovementioned partners to ensure they have all the tools necessary to realize their sales potential, namely:
* Bring new partners to Arrow, by the prospection (phone, email) and client meetings
* Execute successful business plans
* Build and maintain strong relationships with the vendor
* Find New Business leads
* Build and maintain strong relationships within the partner's base
* Identify new partners, engage and enable accordingly to drive incremental sales
* Initiating marketing campaigns for the partners to find new leads
* Regular and accurate forecasting of opportunities, providing detail for both short- and long-term deals
* Enable partners by providing regular sales training


**A FEW THINGS YOU'RE AN EXPERT AT**
* Development of new Customers, excellent communication skills
* At least 5 years' experience in Business Development/Account Management within the IT distribution/IT manufacturers' sector (Cloud Computing/Infrastructure sales ideally)
* Experience with Citrix products and solutions is a must!
* Self-motivated with a hardworking and proactive approach
* Very good knowledge of the local market
* Works independently but also a team player
* Fluency in Swedish and English language is a must to be successful in this recruitment


**A FEW MORE THINGS YOU ALSO KNOW (OR WANT TO LEARN)**
* Contributes to process improvements
* Ability to build strong relationships
* Target Driven


**WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU:**
* Fantastic working culture where you can make an impact
* Competitive package composed of a base salary plus bonus based on your performance with the car allowance included
* This position is a life changing opportunity to start and continue a key career move in a fast paced, international organization. Progression and investment are paramount in Arrow's ethos.


****Location:****
 SE-Kista, Sweden (Kronborgsgränd)
   

  

****Time Type:****
 Full time
   

  

****Job Category:****
 Sales

title: Enterprise & Mid-Market Account Executives - Danish or Swedish speaking
description:
**Join the planet’s most important fight** 




**Normative is now looking for Enterprise & Mid-Market Account Executives in Stockholm** 




  





 At Normative, we're on a mission to accelerate the transition to a net-zero world. We provide science-based carbon accounting software and tailored advice from net-zero experts, empowering companies to reduce their carbon footprints.
 



 Our Sales team is now growing and we’re looking for passionate and driven Account Executives to join our growing team within
 **the Nordic market** 
 and make a real impact on the fight against climate change. As an Account Executive, you will play a crucial role in helping companies achieve their NetZero goals and contribute to a sustainable future.
 



**About The Role** 




 As an Account Executive, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining strong relationships with our customers across the Nordic region, and play a crucial role in helping them achieve their sustainability goals.
 



 You will partner to understand their unique challenges and develop tailored solutions that address their specific needs. You'll be responsible for identifying and qualifying leads, building strong customer relationships, and closing deals that drive our company's growth. As a trusted advisor, you will be a key resource for them providing guidance and education on their NetZero journey.
 



**What You'll Do** 



* Manage a pipeline of opportunities and drive deals to completion
* Work toward ambitious targets, manage your pipeline effectively, and close deals that contribute to our growth
* Collaborate & communicate effectively with colleagues, stakeholders, and potential customers to ensure a smooth and successful sales process
* Stay up-to-date on the latest trends and best practices in sustainability



**What You Bring** 



* Proven experience as an Account Executive or a similar role in the B2B sales environment, preferably in SaaS companies
* Adaptability and ability to thrive in a dynamic environment. You embrace change, learn quickly, and think on your feet as needed
* Strong verbal and written communication skills in English & native Swedish or Danish with the ability to engage in dynamic conversations
* Familiarity with sales methodologies, including MEDDIC
* A collaborative and team-oriented approach
* Tech-savviness - you're comfortable with technology and can quickly learn new software and tools
* A passion for sustainability and a desire to make a positive impact on the world



 If you are a driven and passionate individual with a strong desire to make a positive impact on the world, and a real love for sales, we encourage you to apply. This is an exciting opportunity to join a mission-driven company and make a real difference in the fight against climate change.
 



 Join us and be a part of something bigger than yourself. Together, we can create a more sustainable future for all.
 



**Location** 




 Normative has offices in Stockholm, London and Copenhagen. For this role you will be located in Stockholm.
 



 The Sales team works from the office 4+ days a week as we believe in providing you with the best support and opportunity to collaborate by working from our office with your peers.
 



 The sales team in Stockholm work from the office at Folkungagatan 44.
 



**Benefits** 



* Market-based salaries and annual merit-based salary reviews
* 30 days/year of paid vacation + up to 2 additional days off
* Pension and parental leave
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag) + 1 wellness hour per week
* Social and team-building activities (off-site, after work, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact on the world
* A friendly, supportive and humble working culture



*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.* 




**How To Apply** 




 We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.
 


* Please Note: Due to the upcoming holiday period, applications may take longer to be reviewed and interviews may not begin until the New Year. Your patience is appreciated during this time \*



 Our interview process consists of 4 stages:
 


* Screening interview with a member of our Talent Acquisition team
* First interview with the hiring manager



*Online Personality & Logic assessment* 



* Interview with members of the Sales team
* Practical Case Interview



 We’re committed to hiring diversely. Having employees from diverse backgrounds brings a wealth of perspectives and experience to our team. We assess candidates based on their experience, skills and unique talents and evaluate everyone against the same criteria.
 



*Normative handles sensitive financial data and we will therefore conduct a background check before hiring any candidate.*

title: Senior Software Engineer - packaging - optimize Ubuntu Server
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 Canonical's Ubuntu Engineering Server Team is looking for open source enthusiasts to help build the distro of the future. The Server Team maintains and packages a wide variety of software including webservers, databases, and virtualization and containerization stacks. This is an exciting opportunity for you, a software engineer passionate about open source software. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company and help us to bring free software to the widest audience.
   

  

 Ubuntu Server is a platform that enables amazing technology the whole world over, and is the #1 operating system in the public clouds. Applicants to this role will have the opportunity to help with everything that goes into evolving Ubuntu. You will get to work with our experienced team and have the benefits of learning and growing alongside the best engineers in the business.
   

  

**The role entails**
* Collaborating proactively within a distributed team
* Fostering a software ecosystem with seamless user experience for all Ubuntu users
* Evaluating contributions of other engineers to maintain high-quality software standards.
* Playing a role in shaping the future of Ubuntu via both - new ideas in your areas of interest and advising on work being done elsewhere
* Collaborating with other teams in the Ubuntu and Debian communities, with upstream projects, and commercially supported customers
* Owning the maintenance of Ubuntu Server packages. Specifically but not limited to:
+ Traditional server workloads (web servers, databases, network services, etc)
+ Virtualisation and Containers
+ Package management and dependencies
+ Language runtimes and toolchains

* Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events


**What we are looking for in you**
* You love technology and working with brilliant people
* You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
* You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
* Interest or experience in open source maintenance or contributions
* Able to replay complex workloads and systems. Able to write detailed test plans and reproducibility steps.
* Feel comfortable contributing and debugging many languages such as C/C++, Python, Rust, Go, Ruby, PHP
* Experience in packaging in one or more ecosystems. This could be language specific systems (Python wheels, Rust Crates, Go Modules, or other equivalent) or any distro package format (deb, rpm, NixOS, or other equivalent).
* Experience using and creating containers and virtual machines
* You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree (or any higher) or equivalent professional experience (5+ years of professional experience)


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: R&D Team Manager – Network Manager
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**  

We are seeking a dynamic and innovative R&D Team Manager - Network Manager to join our team. In this role, you will lead and manage a team of talented engineers, driving the development and implementation of cutting-edge network solutions. Your leadership will be crucial in aligning our R&D efforts with business objectives, fostering innovation, and ensuring the successful execution of projects.


Energy transformation is a technology challenge, dedicated to innovative people sharing the passion for a better world. Join us and make an impact to the way we live today, and future generations will see the world tomorrow.

**How you’ll make an impact**

* Working in a large world-wide organization, collaborating with different stakeholders.
* Driving deliveries for energy transformation.
* Be part of the Network Manager (electrical grid operation, real time system) development team.
* Supporting, guiding and developing your team members.
* Influence system design and implementation.
* As an employee of Hitachi Energy you will be living Hitachi Energy core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

**Your background**

* University degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or other relevant area.
* You have experience from Software Development in IT-industry.
* Fluency in English is required, written and spoken.
* Previous managerial experience is beneficial, but not a must.
* Experience from working with end-customer is a benefit.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**

title: Senior Power Systems Engineer
description:
Job Description:
**Join Our Team as Senior Power Systems Engineer**

  

Are you a passionate electrical engineer with a knack for statistical analysis and data analytics?


We are on the lookout for two dynamic Power Systems Engineers to join our team!


This is your chance to design and optimize cutting-edge power systems while ensuring they meet standards. If you're ready to travel the world and engage with clients, this role is perfect for you!

  

The position can be based anywhere in any of our Swedish offices.

 **What will you do****:**

* Innovate and enhance electrical power systems for maximum efficiency and reliability.
* Lead, design, and create customer projects across the Nordic zone within EcoConsult portfolio.
* Provide applied engineering and technical consultation for customers in power systems studies, design, installation, startup, maintenance, repair, and training.
* Interpret specifications and customer inquiries to design technical proposals and pricing.
* Deliver technical solutions that may involve equipment design or upgrades, testing, and improvements in safety, reliability, or efficiency.
* Mentor and lead other engineers on medium-sized projects.
* Conduct Short-Circuit, LV/MV Coordination, and Arc Flash studies.
* Independently manage medium-sized studies and projects.
 **What will help you to succeed**

* A Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering and 5+ years of power systems engineering experience.
* Experienced with power system simulation software like PSS/E, ETAP, or DIgSILENT.
* Expertise in statistical analysis and data analytics tools like Python, R, MATLAB, and Excel.
* Knowledge of relevant standards in electrical design.
* Stellar communication and interpersonal skills, with a knack for negotiation.
* A problem-solving mindset with an eye for detail and a commitment to quality.
* Willingness to travel 50% of the time for exciting customer engagements.
 **Preferred Extras:**

* Experience in pre-sales engineering or customer-facing roles.
* Experience in lead engineering roles.
 **What do we offer you?**

  

As part of our team, you can expect:

* **Professional Growth****:** Access to continuous learning opportunities, mentorship programs, and career development resources to nurture your potential and drive your career forward.
* **Innovative Environment**: Be part of a dynamic, forward-thinking organization that encourages creativity, innovation, and entrepreneurial spirit as we lead the way in digital transformation and sustainability.
* **Work-Life Balance**: We value your well-being and offer flexible work arrangements, comprehensive wellness programs, and support to help you maintain a healthy work-life balance.
* **Global Impact**: Contribute to meaningful projects that address global energy challenges and sustainability, making a positive impact on the world while advancing your career.
* **Inclusive Community**: Join a diverse and inclusive community where your unique perspectives are celebrated, and your voice is heard, fostering an environment of collaboration and belonging.
 **Did we get you inspired?**

  

Please submit your application soonest. We will fulfill the position as soon as the suitable candidate has been found.

title: Senior Online Engineer
description:
Senior Online Engineer


Apply Now

 Apply Later


**Job ID** 10111933
**Location** Stockholm, Sweden / Copenhagen, Denmark / Oslo, Norway / Helsinki, Finland
**Business** Disney Experiences
**Date posted** Feb. 27, 2025
This role is considered remote, which means the employee will work remotely on an ongoing basis and will not have an assigned workspace at a Company designated location.


#### **Job Summary:**


About the Role & Team


Disney Digital Entertainment, a division of Disney Experiences, is embarking on a mission to create the ‘digital front door’ for The Walt Disney Company—bringing all of Disney’s magic together into a new, interactive universe.


We are building a world-class engineering team to drive this transformation and are seeking a Senior Online Engineer to join our efforts. As a Senior Online Engineer, you will contribute to the development of high-performance, scalable platforms that support Disney’s interactive experiences for a global audience. If you thrive in high-volume, transactional environments and enjoy building robust APIs and infrastructure solutions, this role is for you!


This role can be based remotely in Sweden, Denmark, Finland or Norway.


What You Will Do

* Design, develop, and maintain high-volume, transactional software platform infrastructure that is robust, scalable, maintainable, and extendable.
* Develop platform software design specifications, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and scalability requirements.
* Create and optimize application programming interfaces (APIs) to meet the data needs of the organization and integrate seamlessly with partner platforms.
* Write reliable and efficient code capable of handling massive datasets and supporting millions of users worldwide.
* Solve complex technical challenges, contributing to the continuous improvement of tools, systems, and processes.
* Collaborate with internal teams, external partners, and cross-functional stakeholders to deliver seamless integrations and ensure robust platform performance.
* Mentor junior engineers, fostering a culture of learning and technical excellence within the team.
* Participate in short- and mid-term strategic planning, contributing to technical designs and supporting project objectives.


Required Qualifications & Skills


* Proven expertise in developing scalable, high-performance platform infrastructure for large-scale applications.
* Strong proficiency in at least one of the following programming languages: Go, Rust, Zig, or C#, with a willingness to learn and adopt new technologies.
* Demonstrated ability to design and implement APIs with an extendable architecture, ensuring seamless integration across platforms and services.
* Experience working on high-concurrency systems optimized for low-latency performance and handling massive datasets.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with a focus on delivering practical, reliable solutions to complex challenges.
* A collaborative mindset and the ability to mentor less experienced engineers while working effectively in a distributed team environment.
* 5-8 years of progressively complex experience in software development, with a focus on backend engineering for large-scale applications.
* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience.


Why Disney Digital Entertainment?

* Be part of an innovative mission to deliver the next generation of Disney’s digital magic to fans around the globe.
* Collaborate with premier talent to build scalable systems powering Disney’s most iconic franchises, including Pixar, Marvel, and Star Wars.
* Shape the backend systems for a groundbreaking new interactive experience and impact millions of players worldwide.
* Work in a collaborative, global environment where innovation, creativity, and technical excellence thrive.


The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. Disney is committed to forming a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided the necessary accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive all benefits of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

As a principal individual contributor, you will develop technical design specifications, create core software for new engine modules, and enhance existing functionality. Your expertise will solve the most complex challenges, influence cross-organizational initiatives, and establish technical standards for engine development.

* Strategic Contribution: Drive leading-edge projects and initiatives, aligning efforts with organizational objectives and setting the technical direction for future development.


Required Qualifications & Skills


* Expertise and Vision: 12+ years of progressively complex experience in software development, with a focus on game engine and rendering systems.
* Technical Mastery: Recognized expertise in C++ programming, technical design, and building scalable, feature-rich engine systems.
* Leadership and Influence: A proven track record of driving technical innovation and setting organizational standards.
* Strategic Problem-Solving: The ability to tackle unique challenges and deliver impactful solutions across teams and departments.
* Collaboration and Communication: Exceptional skills in working with internal and external stakeholders to align on complex technical initiatives.
