title: Senior Integration Engineer
description:
IT Corporate is a Nordic IT unit with close to 60 employees and consultants divided into three teams. We are responsible for systems and IT solutions for If's corporate units such as Accounting, Cash Management, Marketing, Legal and HR.
Join us as we build a modern, sustainable tech unit within IT Corporate. Our mission is to embed sustainability in all operations, delivering high-quality, stable solutions that empower businesses. We’re modernizing our tech ecosystem to support the CFO unit’s transformation and improve financial reporting.  

Are you passionate about designing scalable, cutting-edge data infrastructure solutions and integration systems? Do you thrive in event-driven architectures and serverless ecosystems? If so, we’re looking for a Senior Azure Integration Engineer to join our team and help us push the boundaries of modern data engineering and integration.
About the Role
We are seeking a highly skilled Azure Integration Engineer to enable our Data Mesh called IT Corporate Data Platform using Azure Integration Services. This is an exciting opportunity for experienced professionals to take on a pivotal role in a dynamic environment.
You will be part of a dedicated team from the very beginning, building our new data mesh platform and shaping its functionality and design. This is a unique opportunity to influence and create something extraordinary from the ground up.
In this role, you will:* Design and create integration patterns using modern integration tools such as Azure Event Hubs, Azure API Management, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Bricks, Azure Data Lake Storage.
* Implement integration processes and apply security best practices to ensure robust and secure data solutions.
* Deliver innovative financial solutions for Nordic and Baltic countries, addressing complex business needs with creative technical solutions.
* Implement a robust and scalable integration architecture cross domains, establishing integration standards and best practices.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an Agile work environment to streamline development processes and ensure seamless integration of financial data.

  

What We Offer
In the same way that we place expectations on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:* An inclusive work environment where everyone is welcome.
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics.
* Social activities in a highly skilled professional environment.
* Possibility of a hybrid workplace.
* A health-promoting workplace with wellness allowance and various sports activities.
* Comprehensive insurance benefits.
* Lunch benefits.
* High pension savings.

  

About the Team
IT Corporate offers work in a modern IT environment where you’ll combine maintenance with new development projects. Our technical environment includes several platforms, and our applications support various functions and processes.
In this role you would be part of an innovative and driven team building a transformative data platform from scratch. We take pride in our expertise, not only in programming and system development, but also in project management, requirements handling, and test management. Our team works in close collaboration with customers, offering opportunities to engage with multiple customers and applications. You'll get the chance to contribute to both smaller and larger development projects in this role.
Who Are You?
You enjoy collaborating and sharing knowledge with others, and you are recognized as a proactive and dependable team member. You are highly focused on delivering results, demonstrating flexibility and a solution-oriented approach in your work. You’re comfortable engaging in dialogues with users to understand their requirements and always strive to be proactive and innovative in addressing their needs.  

Your Qualifications* A relevant educational background in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent education.
* Strong expertise in Azure Integration Services, including Logic Apps, Azure Functions, API Management (APIM), Service Bus, and Event Grid.
* Proficiency in C#, PowerShell, and Python for developing custom integrations and automation scripts.
* Strong knowledge of RESTful APIs, SOAP, OAuth, and message-based architectures.
* Experience designing and implementing event-driven and serverless architectures in Azure.
* Practical understanding of Azure security best practices, including Managed Identities, Role-Based Access Control (RBAC), and API security.
* Ability to troubleshoot and optimize integrations for scalability, reliability, and cost-efficiency.
* A business understanding of accounting, financial data, and regulatory reporting (beneficial).
* Excellent communication skills and full proficiency in English, both verbal and written.
* Experience with collaborative problem-solving and troubleshooting.
  

Additional facts and the recruitment process
Application deadline: Screening and interviewing will start immediately. However, application deadline is 20th of March 2025.
To apply for the position: Please attach your CV and answer the questions in the application form.  

Work location: Stockholm, Bergshamra.
Background check: Final candidates will undergo a background check before employment.
For more information, please contact Pontus Orrby, Head of Solutions Development, pontus.orrby@if.se.
We look forward to your application!

title: Game Prototyping Engineer
description:
Join our innovative and passionate team at Relax Gaming as a Game Prototyping Engineer! Be part of an exciting and growing team where your creativity and technical skills will drive the development of cutting-edge games.
  
  

**Job Summary:**  

As a Game Prototyping Engineer, you will play a crucial role in the early stages of game creation. You will pioneer development of software used to transform conceptual ideas into functional prototypes. Collaborating closely with game designers and mathematicians to streamline the process of modelling and visualizing new game ideas and mechanics.
  
  

**Your profile:**  

We are looking for a developer with a strong interest in mathematics or a mathematician with previous experience developing prototyping tools. As our future Game Prototyping Engineer, you should be excited to work with our talented game designers to develop the best games in our growing industry. You should be inquisitive and want to collaborate with our experienced developers to design new ways to model and visualize games efficiently. Supporting your teammates motivates you and you take pride in empowering others.
  
  

**Key responsibilities:**  

Develop java based libraries to prototype slot games.
  
Optimize functions used repeatedly to be efficient.
  
Implement analytical tools for comparing and recording statistics.
  
Maintain project repository.
  
Share effective coding practices.
  
  

**Requirements:**  

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
  
Proficient in Java
  
Strong programming skills.
  
Knowledge of probability, statistics and combinatorics.
  
Understanding of casino games.
  
Fluency in English
  
  

**As a person, you will need:**  

A natural talent for problem-solving
  
An excellent eye for detail
  
An interest in logical processes and optimization -The ability to work autonomously as well as a part of a team
  
The ability to break up large projects into manageable tasks
  
  

Bonus points for…
  
Experience with AI and automation
  
Keen interest in games of all kinds
  
  

About Relax
  
Back in 2010, we kicked off our journey with a simple mission - to create outstanding games for the modern iGaming world. Fast forward to today, and we've grown to be one of the leading suppliers in the game, boasting an aggregation arm like no other. Despite our exponential growth, we've succeeded in staying true to our core values throughout the years, these are to be: Driven, Adaptable, Supportive, and Respectful. We live and breathe this ethos across our offices across the globe, namely in Malta, Estonia, Serbia, Finland, Sweden, and Gibraltar. Keen to find out more? Learn about us here.
  
Life at Relax
  
This role is in Malmö or Stockholm.
  
Relax is at a very exciting growth stage as a company, however, we cherish our informal and flexible core atmosphere where self-initiative, taking pride in what you do and ambition to deliver the best results are key components. For the right person, there are endless opportunities for personal and professional development.
  
We are starting with interviews right away, so be quick to apply!
  
All applications are handled with full confidentiality.

title: Senior Motion Graphics Designer - CONTRACT WORK
description:

**Game Boost**
--------------

We provide remote-friendly studios with stellar game developers in all crafts.

 *Free to check us out on* *LinkedIn*

As the only motion graphics design specialist you will use your creativity and technical skills as well as your knowledge of web and game development to enhance the visual quality on multiple of the studios games.

  

* Create high-quality real-time motion graphics and VFX from concept to completion
* Work independently and manage and organize your own workload
* Support the Art Lead in developing a cohesive, high-quality product that aligns with the Art Direction

 **Details:**

* Start date: End of March
* Duration: 3 months with possible extension
* Occupancy rate: 100% assignment (Full-time)
* Level: Senior
* Work set-up: Remote or onsite in Helsinki

 **Your player profile:**

  

You are highly creative with strong technical skills in motion graphics and you seek to improve and raise the bar on the overall player experience.  

  



* Proficiency in **creating** **2D** (and 3D) **assets**
* Extensive knowledge of efficient **workflows and pipelines** to ensure a smooth art production cycle with a focus on cross-discipline collaboration

**NOTE: only applicants with a portfolio showcasing high-quality animations and VFX will be considered.**

**Traits:**

  

We believe that being humble, collaborative, and open-minded will take you a long way and is the right way to go. It's a good foundation, even if we do understand that you possess a lot more personal attributes in addition.

 ***Note:***


We believe that the world of gaming *can* and *should* include everyone.

title: System Engineer
description:
**System Engineer**

*For over 160 years, Ascom has driven innovation. With over 1300 employees, we are a global provider of ICT and mobility solutions, focusing on developing business-critical, real-time solutions for environments where mobility, stability, and time are central factors.*


You have probably benefited from an Ascom solution without knowing it. Our solutions work behind the scenes, such as clinical communication and alarms in hospitals, welfare technology in elderly care, security systems in prisons and mobile alarm systems. We are helping to digitalize the healthcare sector in Sweden and our solutions ensure that both patients and staff feel safer. In other words, working with us is a serious and exciting task – that's why we hire the very best and do our utmost to retain and strengthen them!

**At Ascom Sweden**, we are a total of 240 colleagues, many of whom have extensive expertise and long-term employment, and are the most skilled in their field. Your career development through collaboration and training is important to us, and you will have opportunities to participate in global and local initiatives, and projects internally.


We are now looking for a new colleague to join our Service & Operations team in the role of **System Engineer.** You will be part of an ambitious team that works closely together to provide our customers with the best service and follow-up, both onsite and remote.

**In the role of System Engineer**, we want to give you firsthand experience of what it's like to work with technology at the forefront of the healthcare sector, and how we make a difference and impact lives in the community. This role also has a high focus on working with Ascom’s personal safety solutions for customers in the security segment, such as prisons.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Participate in projects related to the establishment of new Ascom systems.
* Project/contract work, including commissioning and testing.
* Handling technical incidents of varying difficulty both onsite at the customer and via remote support.
* Troubleshoot and fix issues, both hardware (HW) and software (SW).
* Ensure high customer satisfaction with excellent follow-up, documentation, and report writing.
* Maintain good communication with the customer and a positive attitude.
* Manage systems based on critical communication and high security.
* Collaborate with other technicians and project managers in the team.
* Test and upgrade our customer solutions.
* Eventually participate in a 24/7 on-call schedule.
* Work within the security segment, including environments such as prisons.

**Requirements**:

* The role is security-classified, which means **you must undergo a security clearance and be approved** to take on the role.
* B-class driver's license.
* Willingness to travel.

**Technical Experience and Skills:**

* Technical Engineering: Mid-level (Practical education)
* Application Engineering: Mid-level (Practical education)
* H&S: Certified according to local regulations and Basic H&S awareness
* An engineering approach with connotations of precision, predictability, measurement, risk mitigation, and professionalism
* 5+ years’ experience in a technical System Engineering position or similar
* Experience with digital tools, good system understanding and experience with network hardware such as switches, routers, etc.
* Experience working in projects and customer service.
* Experience with the Windows platform (installation, configuration, setup, and operation).
* Knowledge of telecommunications and networking, including TCP/IP and SIP.
* Understanding and interest in GSM, 4G, Wi-Fi is beneficial but not required.
* Experience in the healthcare sector is an advantage.

**Personal** **Qualities:**

* Strong customer service skills and ability to write reports well.
* Analytical, structured, and quality-conscious.
* A team player, but also independent with the ability to plan your own workday and meet deadlines.
* Quick learner, with an affinity and interest in technical and IT-related subjects.
* Fluent in Swedish and good English skills, both written and spoken.

**We** **Offer:**

* The opportunity to influence and contribute to Ascom’s development
* A varied and rewarding workday that keeps you engaged and learning
* Flexible working hours and the possibility to work from home


Are you interested in becoming part of the team? We look forward to receiving your application!


Want to learn more about us? Read on here: www.ascom.com

*Ascom is an employer that promotes diversity, equality, and inclusion. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other protected status. We believe that a diverse workforce strengthens our team, drives innovation, and enriches our workplace. Join us in creating an inclusive environment where everyone is valued and has equal opportunities to succeed.*
company_description: Ascom is a global solutions provider focused on Healthcare Information and Communication Technology (ICT) and mobile workflow solutions.

title: Desktop Support Engineer
description:
Join our global team of over 1,000 engineer support heroes, and work with some of the world’s leading brands, from high-street giants to energy multinationals and financial institutions.


Not only will you be working alongside a highly experienced and dedicated project team, but you will also have an opportunity to gain exposure to the latest hardware and tools, including our own bespoke engineer software.

  

Your success is our success and that’s why we will support you in reaching your full potential through ongoing training and development. We take reward and recognition seriously, each quarter we recognise service excellence globally as part of our Engineer Hero Awards.

 **The role:**

  

* Handle Incidents and Service Requests and near desk support;
* Provide services to End Users that include the following:
* End User Devices including workstations, desktop PCs, laptop/notebook PCs, tablet PCs,
* Collaboration and Communication services and devices including smart phones, desktop phones, mobility devices, streaming media systems (video conferencing) and other End User computing Hardware devices and associated system Software;
* Network-attached devices (e.g. printers, scanners, copiers, multi-functional devices (e.g. printer/scanner/fax);
* Locally-attached devices (e.g. personal printers, projectors);
* Daily health checks to End User Devices and Network attached devices as required
* Meeting room support as required.
* Provide effective Deskside Support Services in accordance with the appropriate Performance Standards;

**About you:**

* You will have a minimum 1-3 years’ experience in Windows Desktop support.


Experience in:

* Windows 7-10, Microsoft Active Directory, utilization of GPOs, MS Office 365, PC hardware installation and troubleshooting, Enterprise anti-virus solutions, Helpdesk ticketing systems (e.g. ServiceNow).
* Mobile device management including IOS and Android devices, Enterprise encryption solutions, Windows PC/laptop management via Active Directory.
* Proven analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.
* The ability to multi-task, effectively determine priorities and meet SLA’s.
* Excellent communication, rapport building and internal customer service skills.


If you are interested in the opportunity to work onsite with one of A&O IT Group’s key clients, carrying out a wide range of IT related services, meeting a wide range of technical challenges and providing an excellent experience for our customers we would love to hear from you.

  

A&O IT Group

  

As a successful and growing global IT services provider, A&O IT Group deliver ‘fully managed’ IT solutions and cyber security services. Combining over 50 years expertise, and boasting an extensive global network, whilst remaining privately owned, A&O IT Group is a trusted IT services partner to clients globally.

*This role is subject to a post-offer Background Verification in accordance with the local country legislation.*

  

Learn more about life at A&O IT Group and our opportunities on our website ***IT Engineer Careers*** page.

 **NO AGENCIES**

 *We encourage diversity and seek to attract individuals with unique backgrounds and perspectives. It is important that we build a team with a diverse mix of people and skills, where everyone feels welcome and able to succeed. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability or gender identity.*

title: Senior FrontEnd Engineer - Web, Open Application
description:
**Job Description**
 Wolt is growing, not just in terms of Operating Countries, Partners and Customers but our Engineering teams are scaling too. We are at an exciting point in our journey, integrating our DoorDash cousins into a joint eco-system, rolling out several new products away from our ‘delivery’ business as well as constant improvement and iteration of our core application.
   

  

 As part of our continued growth and the on-going services provided to over 20 million users globally, we need YOU to join us as we expand our Technical Hubs in Stockholm, Sweden & Tallinn, Estonia.
   

  

 Build it, Break it, Iterate and Ship it… Simples
   

  

 Whilst we have a number of teams internally responsible for different areas of the business, our core tech is shared across the organisation. So, In terms of tech, modern Typescript and React are our bread and butter across Wolt, we also use React Native in our Partner application, while a big chunk of the backend is built using Python, Scala, as well as some Kotlin and even C++. We’re always improving our services and we aim for excellence, so if you would like to be surrounded by like minded people, we certainly have a lot to offer.
   

  

 If you are an experienced Web Engineer, a true team player and based in Sweden or Estonia, then you could be our next colleague!
   

  

 📍These roles can be based in one of our tech hubs in Stockholm or Tallinn, or you can work remotely anywhere in Sweden, Estonia or Finland. Read more about our remote setup 👉 here.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 👉 Minimum of 5 years of solid experience using modern Typescript and React in the frontend and building solid scalable services and well-structured applications using them.
   

  

 👉 If you have some React Native and app development experience (Android or iOS) on your hands - even better, we consider that a plus!
   

  

 👉 You’re a dedicated person who is pragmatic with a positive attitude, who doesn't shy away from going outside of their comfort zone, and demonstrates curiosity and willingness to keep continuously learning.
   

  

 TL;DR we have many teams looking for FE engineers. So if you have several years of experience in dealing with the front end of the house, can’t wait to learn new things (for example, tinkering in the backend if you’re up for it), have an interest in tackling scalability challenges and building some cool stuff, then be sure to drop us a line! 📫
   

  

**What We’re Offering To You**
 💯 Overall our product organization consists of a team of over 500 people at Wolt. We aim to build none other than the best-in-the-world engineering team here.
   

  

 💙 You’ll get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognise that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind, and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement.
   

  

 🙌 Join us for an exciting journey! The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash equity. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 Minimum of 5 years of experience with Typescript
   

  

**Next Steps**
 Minimum of 5 years of experience with React
   

  

 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Aiden Yun (aiden.yun@wolt.com)
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 27 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

**Working in Product Development at Wolt**
 At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

 The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

 Join us today to build Wolt together.

title: Senior Backend Engineer - Search
description:
**About Sana**
 We're on a mission to revolutionize how humans access knowledge through artificial intelligence. Throughout history, breakthroughs in knowledge sharing—from the Library of Alexandria to the printing press to Google—have been pivotal drivers of human progress. Today, as the volume of human knowledge grows exponentially, making it accessible and actionable remains one of humanity's most critical challenges. We're building a future where knowledge isn't just more accessible—it's a catalyst for achieving the previously impossible. If all of this sounds exciting, you’re in the right place.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Join the Sana AI search team to shape the future of knowledge work from enterprise search to intelligent agents. Our goal is to enable humans and agents to understand, find, and act on any piece of information, regardless of format. To achieve this we are reconsidering the traditional enterprise search stack from the ground up to be inherently multi-modal and leverage the latest developments in LLMs.
   

  

 You’ll work on all aspects of our search backend that powers both enterprise search and agentic workflows. This role requires a deep understanding of modern retrieval systems, ranking models and solid backend/data engineering skills as well as an understanding of generative AI.
   

  

 In this role, you will
   

  

* Design and implement core search and retrieval system.
* Ensure high system performance, scalability and reliability.
* Develop ranking models using rigorous experimentation and evaluation.
* Use the latest language modeling techniques to improve search results.


 Your background looks something like
   

  

* Proven experience in developing and managing large-scale search and retrieval systems (e.g., Vespa, Elastic Search).
* Skilled in optimizing performance and scalability for efficient data processing.
* Hands-on experience with data processing or workflow orchestration frameworks (e.g., Airflow, Apache Beam, Temporal).
* Systematic, first-principles and data-driven approach to problem solving.
* Familiarity with latest language modeling techniques relevant to search (e.g., LLMs, BERT, ColPali)


**What We Offer**
* Help shape AI's future alongside brilliant minds from Google AI, Spotify, McKinsey, BCG, and Slack.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Swift professional growth in an evolving environment, supported by a culture of continuous feedback and mentorship from senior leaders.
* Work with talented teammates across 5+ countries, collaborate with customers globally and work in our offices in New York, London and Stockholm.
* Regular team gatherings and events (recently in Italy and South Africa)

description:

 Today, the corporate landscape is dynamic and the world ahead is full of possibilities! title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
About us:
   

  

 Legora is working to empower lawyers and automate legal work. Our approach is to enable the lawyer of the future: a human-AI lawyer who's an order of magnitude more effective than a team of conventional legal professionals. The human-AI lawyer will iterate at the speed of their judgment, even in the most complex legal scenarios, and will out-smart and out-deliver the best pure AI system.
   

  

 You are joining an early-stage scale-up with exceptional product-market fit that thousands of lawyers use daily at global institutions such as Bird&Bird, Mannheimer Swartling, and Heineken. Backed by $35M+ in funding from top investors like Benchmark, Redpoint, and Y Combinator, Legora is a group of exceptional engineers, lawyers, and doers. Here, you will have infinite room to grow and rethink how truly worthwhile work gets done.
   

  

**The role:**
 As a Backend Engineer at Legora you will build, review and ship amazing products helping legal professionals all over the world in their day-to-day job. You’ll get the chance to work across the entire tech stack with clear ownership and autonomy.
   

  

 What you will be doing:
   

  

* Architect and implement features for our web platform
* Take ownership of our codebase, balancing high-quality code, security and speed of development
* Work with technologies such as Node.js, Python, Postgres, Elasticsearch, AWS, Azure and Kubernetes
* Review code and mentor junior colleagues to support them in their development, making the team even better!
* Drive continuous improvement and challenge us, the industry and yourself


 Who you are:
   

  

* A passionate engineer with several years of experience building great products using cutting-edge technologies
* You feel comfortable working across the entire tech stack, with focus on backend development
* You’re autonomous and take pride in the code you write
* You’re a problem solver who’s not afraid to come up with creative solutions and think holistically about software architecture
* Experience in infrastructure and integrations are a big plus


 What’s in it for you:
   

  

* Career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment.
* Direct collaboration with senior leadership and the opportunity to directly impact company growth and strategy.
* A collaborative, high-energy team environment where your ideas and contributions are valued and implemented.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Centrally located offices in Stockholm, London, and NYC, designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


 We founded Legora with the vision of giving lawyers the tools they deserve.
   

  

 We didn't build Legora for how law is practiced today; we built it for how it should be practiced tomorrow.

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Description**
**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for a passionate Data Scientist specializing in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML) to contribute to Data Enrichment efforts within Meltwater. As a part of this role, you will work with experienced team members and product managers to design, test, and implement machine learning solutions.
   

  

 Through Meltwater's innovative social listening platform, we ensure our clients never miss any mention of their brand or essential topics across various platforms, automating the entire social listening process.
   

  

 Partner with us and be part of a diverse community that values your unique contributions, empowering you to reach new heights. Join us in crafting something extraordinary.
   

  

**What You’ll Do:**
* Contribute to the development of scalable algorithms for processing large datasets, implement and evaluate machine learning and deep learning algorithms for tasks such as text classification, sentiment analysis, entity recognition, and summarization.
* Assist in the design, development, and testing of ML models for real-time processing of unstructured data.
* Collaborate with senior team members to analyze the impact of algorithm changes.
* Learn and grow under mentorship, gaining exposure to industry-standard NLP tools and techniques.


**What You’ll Bring:**
* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field, with 2-4 years working experience OR a Master’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field, with 0-2 years working experience.
* Programming Language: Proficiency in Python.
* Solid understanding of data structures and algorithms.
* Proficient in Machine Learning, including understanding Neural Networks and foundational concepts of NLP tasks such as Tokenization, Named Entity Recognition (NER), Sentiment Analysis, Part-of-Speech (POS) Analysis.
* Experience or coursework in Deep Learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a curiosity for learning new technologies.
* Good verbal and written communication skills.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure (preferable), AWS, or Google Cloud).
* Basic knowledge of containerization tools like Docker and orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
* Interest in infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform.
* Passion for exploring the intersection of NLP and emerging fields such as generative AI or multimodal systems.


**What We Offer:**
* Enjoy 25 days of annual paid time off plus an additional day off on your birthday!
* Gain exclusive access to Avanza Avanza, enhancing your financial opportunities and investment options
* Enjoy automatic enrollment into the comprehensive PlanSjuk Silver and PlanLov, ensuring seamless access to healthcare benefits and financial security.
* Complimentary CalmApp subscription for you and your loved ones, because mental wellness matters.
* Energetic work environment with a hybrid work style, providing the balance you need
* Benefit from our family leave program, which grows with your tenure at Meltwater.
* Thrive within our inclusive community and seize ongoing professional development opportunities to elevate your career.


**Where You'll Work:** 
 Brahegatan 10, 11437 Stockholm
   

  

**Our Story**
 The sky is the limit at Meltwater.
   

  

 At Meltwater, we believe that when you have the right people in the right working environment, great things happen. Our best-in-class technology empowers our 27,000 customers around the world to analyze over a billion pieces of data each day and make better business decisions.
   

  

 Our award-winning culture is our north star and drives everything we do – from striving to create an environment where all employees do their best work, to delivering customer value by continuously innovating our products — and making sure to celebrate our successes and have fun along the way.
   

  

 We’re proud of our diverse team of 2,300+ employees in 50 locations across 25 countries around the world. No matter where you are, you’ll work with people who care about your success and get the support you need to reach your goals.
   

  

 So, in a nutshell, that's Meltwater. We love working here, and we think you will too.
   

  

**Equal Employment Opportunity Statement**
*Meltwater is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: At Meltwater, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and empowered. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity and strive to provide a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment.*
*All employment decisions at Meltwater are made based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by the applicable laws and regulations.*
*Meltwater does not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, and we actively promote a culture of respect, fairness, and inclusivity. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities to apply and join us in our mission to drive innovation and make a positive impact in the world.*

title: Senior Java Software Engineer
company_industry: Software Development and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
At DbVis Software, we are passionate about building the ultimate tool for developers to manage the ever-growing world of data. Since 2003, our mission has been to create the best database tools on the planet. Our product is used by companies and developers worldwide, with over 30,000 customers in 150 countries, 7 million downloads, and users including NASA, Apple, Uber, and Netflix.
 



  





**DbVisualizer** 
 is engineered using Java, and we are currently enhancing and expanding the product by adding server-side features, real-time collaboration, AI capabilities, and a cloud journey among others. The details are still evolving, and perhaps you could be a part of shaping them?
 



  





**About the role** 




 We are looking to expand our core development team with a talented Java Engineer. You’ll be surrounded by a senior team, the product and code of high quality.
 



  





 Our team works with multi-disciplinary roles where each engineer gets to own and participate in the full lifecycle of new features. This means analyzing, architecting, designing, coding, testing, shipping and supporting our new features - so we take full responsibility for the quality, as this is how we differentiate.
 



  





 In this role, you will also engage directly with our users to understand how they use the product, help solve their challenges, and identify areas for improvement.
 



  





**Key responsibilities** 



* Develop and maintain DbVisualizer, a state-of-the-art database tool trusted by engineers all over the world



  





**About you** 




 To succeed in this role we think you are a senior Java Engineer with a knack for customer solutions. You have problably worked with desktop and web applications, and have experience in building frameworks, working with various database engines, application features, APIs and user interfaces.
 



  





 You are self-driven, motivated, eager to take responsibility and unafraid of technical challenges while thriving on discussing high-level programming concepts with your colleagues. Your ideas and contributions will not only be acknowledged - but celebrated.
 



  





**You also bring:** 



* Exceptional skills in Java
* Expertise in relational and NoSQL databases
* Experience in desktop and web applications



  





**It’s a plus if you have** 



* Experience with JavaScript, Python, React, Node.js
* Experience with Cloud services and architecture
* Experience with open source projects



  





**What we offer** 




 High responsibility in a senior environment. Opportunity to work with the whole perspective of development and be an integral part of a senior engineering team, and contribute to the development of worldwide known products.
 



  





 Our office is located on the water at Slussen in Södermalm - with probably one of the best views of Stockholm. We are a hybrid-friendly company, and many of us work from home a few days a week. We also offer:
 



  




* 30 days paid vacation
* Pension
* Private health and medical insurance
* Flexible work
* Wellness allowance



  





*DbVis Software is partnering with Safemind to support this hiring process*

title: Data Engineer
description:
RED are currently looking for a Data Engineer to work on a project with a key client of ours based in Stockholm, Sweden. This role requires someone who is already based in Sweden as they require someone who can work Hybrid and can travel to and from Stockholm weekly.
 



  





 We are looking for skills in the following:
 



  




* Have expertise in relational databases, data lakes and distributed file systems.
* Has at least 4 years of experience in structuring and making data available for data-intensive operations and using tools such as e.g. Apache Airflow.
* Has experience in development in a Linux environment and knowledge of development in Python.
* Has good knowledge of SQL and relational databases.
* Has a very good ability to express yourself verbally and in writing in Swedish.



  





 This position is a contract position running until the end of 2025 + possible extensions with a provisional start date of April 1st so if you are interested then please apply directly and someone will be in touch to discuss further.

title: Machine Learning Engineer & Data Engineer
description:
Drivs du av att arbeta med data och utveckla lösningar som gör verklig skillnad? Hos Amendo Tech får du chansen att arbeta i framkant inom machine learning och data engineering för några av Sveriges mest spännande företag. Just nu söker vi drivna och lösningsorienterade specialister för kommande uppdrag inom bank och finans, detaljhandel, myndigheter, produktbolag och snabbväxande startups. Vi erbjuder unika möjligheter för dig som är redo för en ny, stimulerande utmaning.
   

  

**Din kompetens & profil**
**Machine Learning Engineer**
 Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av att bygga och implementera maskininlärningsmodeller och som trivs med att analysera stora mängder data för att skapa insikter och affärsvärde.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:
   

  

* Programmering: Stark kompetens inom Python, Java eller Scala.
* ML-ramverk: Erfarenhet av verktyg som TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-Learn eller Keras.
* Modellutveckling: Kompetens inom modellträning, optimering och hyperparameter-tuning.
* Prediktiv modellering: Erfarenhet av regression, klassificering, klustring och djupinlärning.
* Databehandling: Vana vid dataförbehandling och analys, gärna med verktyg som Pandas, NumPy och Dask.
* Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av ML-pipelines på AWS SageMaker, Azure ML eller Google Cloud AI.
* MLOps: Erfarenhet av CI/CD-principer för ML och verktyg som MLflow, Kubeflow, eller TensorFlow Extended (TFX).
* Analytisk förmåga: Förmåga att tolka och kommunicera resultat till både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter


**Data Engineer**
 Vi söker även dig som är erfaren inom data engineering och kan bygga skalbara dataplattformar, pipelines och integrationer som möjliggör analys och avancerad datamodellering.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/verktyg:
   

  

* Programmering och scripting: Erfarenhet av Python, Java, Scala, eller SQL.
* Dataplattformar och pipelines: Kunskap om verktyg som Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, Airflow, eller DBT.
* Molntjänster: Erfarenhet av att bygga och hantera dataflöden i molnmiljöer som AWS (Glue, Redshift), Azure (Data Factory, Synapse) eller Google Cloud (BigQuery, Dataflow).
* Data Lakes och Data Warehouses: Erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataarkitektur och lagringslösningar för att hantera stora datamängder.
* ETL/ELT-processer: Erfarenhet av att utveckla effektiva och robusta ETL/ELT-pipelines.
* Big Data-ramverk: Kunskap inom hantering och bearbetning av stora datamängder med exempelvis Hadoop, Hive, eller Snowflake.
* Versionshantering och samarbete: God förståelse för versionshantering i Git och vana att arbeta i agila team.
* Data Governance och säkerhet: Förståelse för datahanteringsprinciper, GDPR och dataetik.


 Du har en vilja, nyfikenhet och drivkraft att vilja skapa nytta hos kunden samt lära dig nytt. En problemlösare som inte är rädd för att ta initiativ och vågar utforska nya vägar och arbetssätt. Du har en förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya sammanhang och processer. Du får saker gjorda och ser kunskapsluckor som en möjlighet för personlig utveckling. Du är analytisk och har stor förståelse för vikten av service och kommunikation.
   

  

 Som konsult kommer du att ställas inför en rad olika utmaningar, både från ett socialt och pragmatiskt perspektiv. Därför tror vi att du är öppen och ödmjuk för både förändring och för olikheter. Du har ett agilt sätt att möta problem och kan se dem från olika vinklar.
   

  

**Om Amendo Tech**
 Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.
   

  

 Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.
   

  

**Frågor och kontakt**
 Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 #IT

title: Data Engineer - Sportsbook
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
 We’re looking for a skilled and motivated Data Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this crucial role, you will be instrumental in fostering a data-driven culture across our organisation, enabling departments to leverage data comprehensively and facilitating data teams in building models, AI, and machine learning solutions.
   

  

 Your expertise will drive the development and maintenance of our state-of-the-art cloud-based data platform, which is central to powering our globally recognized brand. In this role, you will see a direct correlation between your work, company growth, and user satisfaction.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Build and maintain highly scalable and robust data management systems tailored to specific business needs and challenges.
* Ensure systems meet business requirements and industry practices for data integrity, security, and accessibility.
* Build, maintain, develop, test, deploy and enhance our data pipelines and systems
* Collaborate with data team and stakeholders including data architects, Executive and Product from the beginning to the delivery of a project
* Ensure the highest quality of data is made available throughout the entire organisation and systems meeting our SLAs


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
   

  

 ESSENTIAL SKILLS:
   

  

* Experience working in an online, gaming, or fast-moving industry
* 3+ years of work experience in data engineers and data platforms
* Must have experience in successfully implementing data-centric applications, such as data warehouses, operational data stores, and data integration projects
* Experience with SQL, ETL, data modelling, and Python
* Proven experience with Bigquery
* Proficient with one or more big data & new data technologies such as DBT, Apache NiFi, Airflow, Kafka


 NICE TO HAVES:
   

  

* Experience from the iGaming industry is meriting


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group, is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices world-wide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we like to empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait around for things to happen, we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English we’d like to see your CV in English please\*\*

title: Senior AI Engineer
description:
At Pocketlaw, we’re revolutionizing legal workflows using AI to make legal work faster, smarter, and more accessible. As a Senior AI Engineer, you will play a crucial role in integrating cutting-edge AI into our products, ensuring they are intelligent, scalable, and efficient. You’ll collaborate closely with our product and engineering teams to create AI-driven features that provide real value to our customers.
   

  

 If you love solving complex problems, enjoy working in a fast-moving environment, and want to shape the future of AI in legal tech, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design, build, and optimize AI-powered features using Large Language Models (LLMs) like GPT, Claude, Gemini, and Llama.
* Work closely with product and engineering teams to integrate AI seamlessly into our applications.
* Improve cost and performance efficiency through advanced techniques like vector databases and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG).
* Lead technical decisions and contribute to the overall AI and machine learning strategy.
* Stay up to date with the latest advancements in LLMs and apply best practices to our products.
* Conduct rigorous testing, experimentation, and evaluation to ensure high-quality AI implementations.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Hands-on experience with LLMs (GPT, Claude, Gemini, Llama, etc.)
* Strong understanding of NLP techniques and text representation methods.
* Expertise in ML frameworks and tooling (PyTorch, TensorFlow, LangChain, OpenAI APIs).
* Experience with backend technologies (NodeJS, TypeScript, PostgreSQL).
* Ability to optimize LLM-powered features for cost and performance.
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to turn research into scalable solutions
* A positive, solution-oriented mindset and passion for innovation.


**Our Tech Stack**
* Frontend: React, TypeScript
* Backend: NodeJS, TypeScript, PostgreSQL
* AI & ML: PyTorch, TensorFlow, LangChain, OpenAI APIs
* Infrastructure: GraphQL, Event-driven microservices, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS


****Why Join Us?****
* Work on cutting-edge AI-powered products that transform the legal industry.
* Be part of a collaborative, high-impact team where your work truly matters.
* Opportunities for growth, leadership, and innovation in a fast-scaling company.


 Interested? Apply now or reach out to learn more!
   

  

 Pocketlaw helps companies solve their everyday legal needs - empowering every team in the organisation to create contracts and manage legal with efficiency, ease and confidence. Pocketlaw is transforming legal for businesses; turning it from a business blocker into a business enabler - with the end goal of giving every company in the world legal peace of mind.

title: Senior Gameplay Engineer - Games
description:
As a Senior Gameplay Programmer at Embark, you will work on either The Finals or Arc Raiders, alongside some of the most talented people in the games industry.
   

  

 We believe that great games are made in creative environments, where builds are always playable, and teams can move fast and test as many ideas as possible. In close collaboration with our designers, you will create easy-to-use systems that enable us to iterate quickly and that encourage experimentation.
   

  

 The games we're making are built in Unreal, using C++, blueprints and a scripting language called Angelscript.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with a wide range of talents at Embark to deliver ground-breaking technical solutions to create fun gameplay for our players
* Make sure we hit our runtime-performance targets within certain domains
* Make sure we hit our network/replication targets
* Identify and build tech to further increase the productivity of our daily work
* Occasionally assist our team in debugging and fixing complex issues


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* A strong background in C++
* A good grasp of what good gameplay looks and feels like
* Fluent in English - our team comes from all over the world!
* An interest in computer science and programming as a craft


**Additionally one or some of these would be a great bonus**
* Experience with multiplayer
* Previously worked with shooter or third-person games
* Ability to speak "design"


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!
